Alice is 40 years old and married with two children aged 12 and 20. She is a farmer from the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya, where she has been farming for 15 years. Alice's farm produces vegetables, bananas, eggs and milk, which are all sold locally.
Alice has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to expand her poultry farming business. The extra income from this loan will enable her to provide for the basic needs of her family. She faces the challenge of pests and diseases, but is optimistic that in the next five years her poultry farm will have expanded despite these challenges.

loans.use: to expand her poultry farming business

loans.name: Polotbek's Group

texts.en:
Polotbek T. is a member of this group. He is 45 and married. His wife went to work in Russia to make money. Polotbek takes care of three children: a daughter and two sons. The youngest son studies at school and the other children help their dad with housework. Polotbek works as a specialist in the Migration Department.  His monthly salary is 4400 soms.  In order to earn additional money to meet his family needs, Polobek breeds livestock. With the  money received from the loan he wants to purchase sheep for breeding.  In the future Polotbek wants to purchase an apartment for his children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for breeding.

loans.name: Claudia Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia es una persona muy respetuosa y  responsable en esta  ocasión  requiere el préstamo porque desea comprar mercancía para su negocio ya  que  actualmente ella  se  dedica  a la  venta  de ropa usada ,    ve  en el crédito la posibilidad de poder  ofrecer  una  mejor    variedad  de  productos  a  sus  clientes  así  como también    una  estabilidad  económica   a su  familia.
texts.en: Claudia is a very respectful and responsible person. She now requires a loan because she would like to buy merchandise for her business. She currently sells used clothing and she sees the loan as a chance to offer a greater variety of products to her customers, as well as to provide her family with more financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Justine est née le 11 janvier 1966 au Bénin. Justine est mariée à un gendarme du nom de Joseph. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, tous scolarisés. Justine vient en aide à son mari grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité, en assurant avec lui les diverses charges de la famille. Justine à fréquenté l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Depuis sept  ans, Justine vend des céréales (maïs, sorgho, soja, haricot, etc.). Justine achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Justine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui servira à rehausser le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Justine was born January 11, 1966 in Benin. She is married to a gendarme named Joseph. The couple supports three children, all in school. Justine helps her husband thanks to the income she makes from her business, paying jointly with him the various family expenses.

Justine attended school until high school. For seven years she has been selling cereals (corn, sorghum, soy, beans, etc.). She gets her supplies in Benin.

This is the fourth time that Justine has sought a loan through ALIDé. The loan will serve to raise the level of her business activity in order to better meet the demand of her clientele.

loans.use: to buy cereals (corn, rice, beans, etc.).

loans.name: Justo  Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Justo antonio,vive en departamento de Managua,es una persona social, amable de buenos valores morales, trabahjadora, para darle una mejor acondicion y estabilida a su familia.

El señor justo  visito nuestras instalaciones para solicitar un crédito por que quiere ocupar una parte del dinero que ceprodel le va prestar lo va a invertir en las mejoras de su vivienda, en levantar una pared en su sala, compra materiales tales como cemento, arena , bloque y otra parte del dinero lo va a invertí  en compra de una refrigeradora por que quiere poner un pequeño negocio.
El señor se siente agradecido con ceprodel por darle la oportunidad de hacer realidad sus sueño por que gracias a los prestamos obtenidos en ceprodel ha podido mejoras su condiciones en su vivienda
texts.en:
Justo Antonio lives in the department of Managua. He is a social and kind person with good moral values. He works hard to provide his family with better living conditions and greater stability. 

Justo can to your offices to request a loan. A part of the funds that Ceprodel will loan him will be invested in making home improvements, to build a wall in his living room. He will purchase materials such as cement, sand, construction blocks and other materials. Another part of the loan will be invested in the purchase of a freezer to start up a business. He feels thankful to Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for giving him an opportunity to make his dreams a reality. It is thanks to loans obtained from Ceprodel he has been ale to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Naela

texts.en:
Naela owns a kindergarten and preschool. She started her project seven years ago, Naela enjoys her work and dealing with the children, Naela wants to replace the old furniture in the classrooms and playrooms. Naela took out a loan from FATEN to replace the old furniture and purchase educational toys.

Naela, who is photographed here, hopes in the future to have an elementary school besides the kindergarten and preschool.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and educational toys

loans.name: Khasrat

texts.en:
Khasrat, 35, is married and has two children. 

He sells food items in a grocery store that is located in a very busy place, the Agsu central bazaar. That is why there are always many customers who come to buy groceries from Khasrat. He has been running this business for seven years.

Khasrat’s business is the only source of income for his family. He realizes this responsibility and is doing his best to meet their needs. He is a hard worker and works long days to make sure his family has everything they need. 

Lending services from AqroInvest Credit Union have promoted the expansion of his small venture. Now his monthly income is 300 USD and he would like to increase it. 

Today he is requesting a loan of 1,300 AZN to purchase more food items and increase his monthly profit. Khasrat is hoping that from the profit of his business, he can expand his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to increase profits.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is 45 years old and has four children. Lourdes is married and one of her children is in school. Lourdes has been farming vegetables for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Lourdes requested a 14,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
Shushanik sells shoes in a rented booth at the city market. 

Shushanik dreams of renovating her house and providing necessary education for her growing sons. For these reasons, she plans to increase the variety of shoes she sells and further develop her business. With the requested loan Shushanik plans to purchase more shoes to sell. Additional income will help Shushanik to ensure a sustainable future for her family. 

Shushanik lives with her husband, pensioner father-in-law, and two sons.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Resurrecion

texts.en: Resurrecion is married and has four children. He is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. Resurrecion is a farmer who grows corn to earn a living. He has been doing this for 30 years. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers for his corn. Resurrection has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for corn

loans.name: Sungai Bambu 2 Group

texts.en:
In the picture, Leni is wearing a pink T-shirt. She is 32 years old and she has three children. She has been working in a catering company for two months. With this, she can help her family financially. 

Now she wants to use her share of the loan to pay her children's school fees. She wants her children have a better education than her, and that's why she want to send her children through university.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam has been in the business of cattle breeding for the last 23 years. The breeding business requires a lot of dedication and effort since it requires the strict control of every one of the animals, including feed and care for those that are older.  

Cattle breeding and reselling animals for a profitable price provides the only income for Islam`s family. He earn about 170 USD per month. Through this business, Islam is able to support his spouse and his four children. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,800 AZN to buy more animals to raise and sell in the market.

loans.use: purchase three cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Yort

texts.en: Yort is 42 years old and earns $3 per day as a cake seller. Her husband is a farmer and he earns $2 per day. The couple has two childrE.. Both of them are working and each earn $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $63 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy rice for making cakes to sell in Phnom Penh. Her career can provide a good income and she would like to make more cakes to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice for making cakes to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a farmer and a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya. She is 38 and married with seven children aged between 1 and 20 years old. She has been in farming for the past six years and currently employs one farmhand and produces eggs, milk and maize for the local market.

Doris has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry and boost the business. She says the loans from Juhudi Kilimo have made her family's income stable for the provision of basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with two children. Veronica is 43 years old and she lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Veronica manages an internet cafe to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase and add more computers to her business. Veronica has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Veronica hopes to improve her small business.


About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase more computers

loans.name: Rebeca Orfelinda

texts.es:
Rebeca de 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Las Lomas que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Rebeca desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas, cerdos y aves), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada, pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento ideal para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenos ingresos para solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de alimento balanceado y sanidad de sus animales, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Rebeca es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
37 year old Rebeca lives with her husband and children in their own home, which doesn't get the basic utilities, and which is located in the rural area of the  Las Lomas district which is part of the Piura department. This is an agricultural and livestock-rearing area.
For some years, Rebeca has been raising and selling small livestock (sheep, pigs, and poultry). Her corrals are behind her house and are large and suitable for the job. She feeds her animals with a commercial balanced feed, grass, and natural grains so that her animals will grow properly and can be offered for sale in the different markets in the area and in this way bring her a good income to cover the household expenses. 
She has requested a loan of $375 from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced and healthy animal feed. The income she makes from selling her animals will enable her to repay the loan and have a better quality of life. Rebeca is a hardworking person who strives to make her family move forward in life.

loans.use: to buy balanced and healthy food for her animals.

loans.name: Hector Diobaldo

texts.es:
el sr. Hector Diobaldo tiene 40 años de edad, vive en unión libre y es padre de 3 hijos, Hector se dedica a la Caficultura y Agricultura, tiene varios años de experiencia en el cultivo de café y manejo de la tierra.- esta actividad a sido el sustento de su familia. 
Don Héctor está solicitando el credito para comprar un sistema solar y así progresar, él cree que al tener energía el podrá realizar trabajos en su casa en horas de la noche y así su trabajo sea más eficaz y continuo , respecto a sus hijos poder realizar sus tareas con una mejor visión ya que desde que iniciaron sus estudios les a tocado alumbrase por las noches con candiles y en ocasiones con candelas.
texts.en:
Hector Diobaldo is 40 years old.  He lives with his partner and has three children.  Hector grows coffee and farms.  He has several years experience in growing coffee and working the land.  This business activity has enabled him to support his family.

Hector is requesting a loan to buy a solar-energy system so that he can make progress.  He believes that having power will enable him to carry out work at home during the evening hours and so his work will be more efficient and continuous.  His children will also be able to carry out their work with better vision as, since they started school, they have had to light their home with oil lamps at night and sometimes with candles.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha a 29-year-old housewife, who is a mother to a son and daughter. Suha is married to Nael who works full time in one of the Jordanian governmental entities. 

At home after Nael finishes his work, Suha and her husband help each other to create beautiful mosaic paintings and crafts. Nael started this business and taught his wife Suha, it has been nine years since they started working in this field. 

Suha has applied for this loan to buy new tools that are needed to make this art, as the ones they have are old and need to be renewed. 

Because Suha is a conservative person, Nael has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy new tools that are needed to make mosaic art

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr: Monsieur Aliou vit au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 24 ans. Il est marié et père d’un enfant d’un an. Il est commerçant  et évolue dans ce secteur depuis plus de 10 ans. Son activité consiste à vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires des habits de femmes. C’est une activité qu’il a choisi par passion  et il s’intéresse  beaucoup  aux revenus que lui procure son activité. Il est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis septembre 2010. Il a déjà remboursé  un prêt antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’habits  de femmes destinés a la vente. Son objectif est d’élargir son activité et accroitre ses bénéfices pour améliorer ses conditions de vie sociale.
texts.en: Mr. Aliou lives in Senegal. He is 24 years old. He is a married father of a one-year-old child. He is a merchant and has been in this sector for over ten years. His business consists of selling women’s clothing in weekly markets. It’s a business he chose from passion and he is very interested in the revenues he makes in this business. He has been a member of the UIMCEC bank since September 2010. He has already repaid a previous loan. He is seeking a loan for 300,000 frs to buy women’s clothing to sell. His objective is to increase his business and his earnings to improve the conditions of his social life.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing to resell

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es:
Aidee es una mujer incansable. Tiene 45 años de edad y está felizmente casada con Pablo, con quién tiene 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos, en el barrio de Santa Rosa, en el anexo de Puente Paucartambo – Chanchamayo. Aidee hace de todo. Gracias a su habilidad ha podido mantener y educar a sus 4 hijos. Actualmente cuenta con una tienda de comestibles en la que vende gaseosas, golosinas y productos de primera necesidad. En el mismo puesto expende carne de pollo, que es su negocio más rentable. “Cada semana estaré vendiendo como 50 a 70 pollos. Para eso bajo para La Merced (ciudad y capital la provincia de Chanchamayo) dos veces a la semana para comprar los pollos”, comenta.
De igual manera, cuenta con 6 lotes de terrenos agrícolas, en los que siembra café, plátanos y paltas. En este trabajo obtiene ganancias considerables pero como son temporadas y el precio es inestable, prefiere dedicarse con empeño a su negocio de ventas.
Más adelante, le gustaría instalar una bodega más amplia, donde ofrecería todo tipo de productos y confía, que con esfuerzo y constancia lo puede conseguir. Con su ayuda, Aidee podrá acceder a su préstamo número 10 de MFP, por esa razón será responsable en el pago de las cuotas, como lo ha hecho en los ciclos anteriores. Con respecto a “Luz del Futuro”, su banco comunal, menciona sentirse muy a gusto y satisfecha con el trabajo en equipo. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de pollos beneficiados para expenderlos en su tienda ubicada en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Aidee is a tireless woman. She is 45 years old and is happily married to Pablo with whom she has 4 children, 2 of whom live with her in the Santa Rosa neighbourfood in Puente Paucartambo - Chanchamayo. Aidee can do anything. Thanks to this ability, she has been able to take care of and educate her 4 children. Currently, she has a grocery store where she sells soft drinks, sweets and staple products. In the same store, she sells chicken meat which is her most profitable business, "Every week I sell about 50 to 70 chickens. For this I go down to La Merced (city and provincial capital of Chanchamayo) twice a week to buy the chickens," she says. 

Similarly, with 6 plots of farmland, she grows coffee, bananas and avocados. With this work she makes a significant profit but as it is seasonal and the price is not fixed, she prefers to work hard at her store. In the future, she would like to set up a bigger grocery store where she would offer all kinds of products and, she says, in confidence, that with effort and perseverance she can achieve this. With your help, Aidee can access her 10th loan with MFP and for this reason she will be responsible with the repayments of her loan as she has been with her previous loan cycles. With regards "Luz del Futuro", her communal bank, she says that she feels very comfortable and satisfied with the teamwork. She will invest the money in the purchase of frozen chickens to sell in her store located in her own house.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell as meat in her shop.

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Sony, 37, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

She is a housewife. Her husband is a rice farmer. Two of her children are garment workers. 

Sony is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase cosmetic and decorative material to run a beauty salon. By doing so, she can generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to renew her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic and decorative material to run a beauty salon.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha  tiene 56 años de edad, ella vive en Ica ,ciudad caracterizada actualmente por el incremento de inversión, no solo en la agro exportaciones, es decir en los fundos, si no también, en la apertura de nuevos centros comerciales que brindan muchos puestos de trabajo a pobladores iqueños.  En su tiempo libre disfruta Leer;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Martha  le gusta mucho es el Chicharrón de chancho. Martha estudió hasta segundo año de secundaria y le hubiera gustado estudiar derecho. Martha es madre soltera, y tiene 4 hijos cuyas edades comprenden  24, 21, 19 y 15 años,  todos ellos han estudiado hasta quinto de secundaria.		
	
Martha se dedica al comercio, tiene una bodega en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad, se dedica a este trabajo aproximadamente diez horas diariamente, se animo en poner este tipo de negocio porque en la zona donde vive no hay muchas bodegas y esto le permite tener un promedio de 15 clientes en un día, esto le permite ganar aproximadamente un promedio de S/.40 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/. 60. Ella piensa que su negocio tiene éxito porque ella ofrece productos de buena calidad y un trato amable. Actualmente desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarla para comprar más mercadería para su negocio y tener más productos que ofrecer.

Esta mejora podrá ayudarle a tener una bodega con productos variados y que los clientes se sientan a gusto con los productos que ofrece, con el transcurso del tiempo, mucha dedicación y entusiasmo podrá cumplir su gran sueño: “Tener su propia Pizzería en el centro de la ciudad de Ica."
texts.en:
Martha is 56 years old and lives in Ica, a city currently characterized by increased investment, not only in agricultural exports but also in the opening of new commercial centers that create many employment opportunities for residents of Ica.

In her free time, Martha enjoys reading. It is well known that Peru has the most delicious foods in the world, and one of Martha's favorite dishes is pork cracklings. She studied until the second year of secondary school and would have liked to study law. Martha is the single mother of four children who are 24, 21, 19, and 15 years old. They have all studied through the fourth year of secondary school.

Martha is a merchant who has a bodega [small grocery store] where she sells staple goods. Martha works approximately ten hours a day. She was encouraged to open this type of business because there aren't many bodegas in the area where she lives, so she is able to average 15 customers a day, which brings in an average of approximately 40 nuevos soles per day. On a good day, she can earn up to 60 nuevos soles. Martha thinks her business is successful because she offers good quality products and treats her customers kindly. 
	
This will help her to stock her bodega with a variety of products so that her customers will feel pleased with the merchandise offered. With time and a great deal of dedication and enthusiasm, she will be able to achieve her greatest dream: "To have her own pizzeria in the center of Ica."

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 56 years old, married to Rodha and blessed with 10 children. He has been selling maize for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 3,000.

He is requesting his first loan of KES 30,000. He intends to purchase more maize to sell. He will use the anticipated profit from the business to pay school fees for his children.

His hope and dream is to buy a plot for his children.

loans.use: To purchase maize to sell

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.en:
My name is Maria de la Luz and I have been selling new and used shoes for five years. My income has enabled my to help with family expenses and the education of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase new and used shoes.

Me llamo Maria de la Luz, y me dedico a la venta de zapatos nuevos y usados desde hace cinco años. Los ingresos que he obtenido de mi negocio me han ayudado con los gastos familiares y la educacion de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de zapatos nuevos y usados

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en: Maleyka is from the capital, Baku. She is married and has children. She started her business in 1995. In 2005-2006 she borrowed two times a total of $1,300 from Normicro. Now she plans to borrow an additional $800 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Alieta

texts.en: It is the income from Alieta’s store that pays the household bills and the school expenses of the children.  She used an initial loan from SPBD to purchase her shop several years ago.  Alieta heard about the program from listening to other women in her village talk about their experiences with the loans.  She launched her business smoothly, and she repaid her initial loan.  Now Alieta is interested in applying for another loan in order to purchase new goods that are in high demand by her customers.  She believes that by reinvesting in the business and expanding her product line, she can increase her profits further.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for store

loans.name: Bardomiano

texts.es:
Bardomiano is a young entrepreneur with big wishes of improvement, he started his beauty salon 4 years ago to get his independence and help his mother with some debts she had. Because of his love for this job and the good service he offers he has more clients now.

In order to buy among the near by counties and grow his business, Bardomiano is requesting a loan of $375 which would help him buy marketing products and supplies needed to keep on offering high quality services, he is promising to repay in 6 months. Be part of Bardomiano’s success, he will thank your trust and help you provide him.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Bardomiano es un joven emprendedor con grandes deseos de superación, inició su estética hace cuatro años por la necesidad de independizarse y ayudar a su madre con unas deudas que tenía. El gusto por este oficio y el buen servicio que ofrece han logrado que los clientes de Bardomiano cada vez sean mayores.

Para poder darse a conocer entre las colonias cercanas y hacer crecer su negocio, Bardomiano solicita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de artículos publicitarios e insumos que necesita para seguir ofreciendo servicios de muy buena calidad, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte de los logros de Bardomiano, él agradece mucho la confianza y el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Compra de insumos y publicidad

loans.name: Karen Elizabeth

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Karen Elizabeth. I am a merchant and I work in sales. I have my own business selling shoes in front of the Boulevard of my city. I have been doing this for three years and it generates income to cover my family’s expenses. I am a single mother and I have one son. With the income from this business, I have been able to pay, bit by bit, for a small piece of land where I plan to build my house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Karen Elizabeth, soy comerciante mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de zapatos frente al Boulervar de mi ciudad. tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia, soy madre soltera y tengo un hijo, con las utilidades que me genera este negocio he pagado poco ha poco un solar en el que pienso construir mi vivienda.

loans.use: To buy women's shoes, men's shoes, sandals, sandals for girls and boys, and blouses and skirts

loans.name: Gulbakhar

texts.en:
N. Gulbakhar is a 29-year-old woman who owns her business in the small village of Varkhankend, situated in southern part of Azerbaijan in the Saatli region.

Gulbakhar raises vegetables, particularly cucumbers, in her garden and sells them to the local bazaar traders. She has five years of experience raising vegetables. Her business has brought her a good income all the years. Cucumbers are in very high demand among the Azerbaijani people, as they use them in their everyday meals.

Since selling vegetables is the only source of income for her family, Gulbakhar and her husband work very hard to cover all the family's needs and feed their two grown daughters. Last year was too hard for Gulbakhar`s family, as the prices for food increased twice, and they are going to rise again next year. Gulbakhar applied for a loan of $1200 to develop her business. She is going to rent land and start raising other sorts of vegetables.

loans.use: To expand her farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy baking ingredients and improve the physical appearance of her business

loans.name: Gulaya

texts.en: Gulaya S. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 45 years old, married and has three children. She is selling women clothes in Beylagan city bazaar. She has seven years experience at this business. Gulaya has borrowed three loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch and repaid these loans timely. Now Gulaya needs a loan in amount of $600 to buy more kind of clothes and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Katogo A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Ritah is 30 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a teacher. Sarah has a beauty salon and parlor. She sees a business opportunity of opening up another salon in the city centre. She wants to use the extra profits to buy a piece of and for her children. Saidat sells crafts and wants to use the loan to expand business. Beatrice makes and sells snacks while Sumini offers catering services.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more hair dryers

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr:
Mr D. Kossivi (standing up and dressed in red) is 35 years old, married and father of four (04) children. He has been the owner of a woodworking workshop for the last 5 years. With this loan he is thinking of acquiring three electric saws to improve service.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr D. Kossivi (debout habillé en rouge) est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 04 enfants .Il est propriétaire d’un atelier de menuiserie depuis 5 ans. Avec le prêt il pense acquérir trois scies électriques pour améliorer sa prestation de service

loans.use: Purchase of three (03) electric saws to improve the services at his woodworking shop.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena lives in the neighborhood “Memorial Sandino”. She is 42 years old and she lives with her husband who works as security officer and her two young children, since her two elder children are already independent. She has been working as cook for the past 3 years. The family income is small that's why they have doing improvements to their house with the help of small loans. She is requesting a loan to build the sewer drains and to begin the extension of her bedroom.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elena, habita en el Barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene 42 años de edad, le acompaña su esposo quien trabaja como guarda de seguridad y sus dos hijos menores, en vista que sus dos hijos mayores ya son independientes. Trabaja como cocinera desde hace 3 años. Sus ingresos familiares son pocos es por eso que han ido mejorado su casa con créditos pequeños. Solicita un crédito para construir un sumidero y empezar la ampliación de su cuarto.

loans.use: Buy material to build the sewer drains.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is a young 28-year old baker. He has lived with his partner Lilian for four years; they don’t yet have any children. Francisco started work in his father’s bakery at the age of fifteen. Five years ago he opened his own bakery but using his father’s equipment.

He notes that the work is very demanding, as he has to get up every day at 3am in order to make bread and the other baked products that he sells. He admits to the dream of opening his own fully-equipped bakery in the not too distant future.

At this time he needs a loan to buy sacks of flour so that he can increase production and sell more bread and other baked goods.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco es un joven panadero de 28 años de edad. Vive en pareja con Lilian hace 4 y aún no tienen hijos. Francisco comenzó a trabajar en la panadería de su papá a la edad de 15 años. Hace 5 años que trabaja por cuenta propia pero utilizando las maquinarias de su padre.

Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque debe levantarse todos los días a las 03:00 a.m.para elaborar sus productos que consisten en todo tipo de panificados. Confiesa que su sueño a mediano plazo es montar su propia panadería totalmente equipada.

En esta oportunidad necesita un crédito para la compra de harinas en bolsas para de esa manera aumentar su producción y vender en cantidades mayores.

loans.use: To purchase flour.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana Y., wife of Mr. Y., lives in a four room brick house with her six daughters and two sons. She would like to apply for a loan to help her son, Bawar, who is an auto-rickshaw driver. Bawar wants to buy his own rickshaw so that he can able to earn a greater income.

Her loan group members include: Khursheed B., who wants to buy a food shop to sell samosas, a very famous Punjabi food; Suraiya B., who wants to buy and sell medicine; Kalsoom B., who wants to repair her auto-rickshaw; and Zeenat B., who wants to start a grocery shop. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their business

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina N. is orginally from the municipality of Sandino in the city of Managua. She works collecting plastic items which she later sells to shops for recycling. She has been doing this for three years because she needed extra income to help take care of her three young children. Her husband does not earn enough money to cover their expenses.

With her simple, wooden cart pulled by a horse, she works around the streets of her city collecting the plastic articles. Because of the difficult economic situation today, she has requested a loan from Ceprodel to buy the materials she needs to improve her business and help make it easier for her to collect the plastics.

La señora Luz Marina Narváez es originaria del municipio de Ciudad Sandino en la ciudad de Managua y se dedica a su negocio de recolección de artículos plásticos para luego venderlos en las casas de compra para su respectivo reciclaje. Se dedica a este negocio desde hace tres años por la sencilla razón de que tiene que mantener a sus tres pequeños hijos y además su esposo no posee el recurso económico necesario para hacerlo.

Se dirige por las calles de su municipio en una carreta guiada por un caballo y donde va pasando al encontrarse algún artículo plástico lo recoge y almacena para luego venderlo en las casas de compra. Hoy en día por la difícil situación económica que atraviesa ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de materiales para mejorar su negocio y el medio donde se moviliza en busca de los artículos plásticos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO FIX THE HORSE DRAWN CART  SHE USES TO COLLECT PLASTIC ITEMS.  THE INCOME FROM RESELLING THESE PLASTIC ARTICLES HELPS SUPPORT HER THREE YOUNG CHILDREN.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Racquel has run a restaurant out of her home for the past two years. She had a bar for more than 30 years, however due to an armed assault she had to give up the business since her physical integrity was in danger. Now she sells meals, juices and desserts every day at her restaurant, open from 11:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. She also rents the second the floor of her home. The loans that she has received have helped her purchase at wholesale the ingredients she needs to make her meals. Raquel would like to expand her business and offer chicken soup in the evenings.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Raquel tiene un restaurante en su casa desde hace 2 años. Ella ha tenido un bar por más de 30 años, sin embargo, debido a un asalto a mano armada tuvo que dejar este negocio, ya que su integridad física estuvo en peligro. Ahora ella vende menues, jugos y postres en su restaurante todos los días. Abre a las 11.30 del día y cierra a las 6 de la tarde. Ella también alquila el segundo piso de su casa. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para comprar por mayor los ingredientes que necesita para elaborar sus menues. A Raquel le gustaría ampliar su negocio y ofrecer caldo de gallina por las noches.

loans.use: Purchase at wholesale the ingredients she needs to make her meals / Para comprar por mayor los ingredientes que necesita para elaborar sus menues.

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa Nelly is 45 years old and married; she studied through high school where they taught her sewing classes both there and in the home of one of her professors. Rosa has one 22-year-old son who is working in the Paijan district, Ascope province of La Libertad, Peru where they reside.

In order to improve her economic condition, she began to sew school uniforms, costumes, suit jackets, dresses and all types of clothing. Twenty-four years ago, her father would purchase material and she would make the clothing to sell to the customers. But as she needed her own capital, she decided to participate in the Honestidad y Confianza (Honesty and Confidence) Village Bank. She has worked with Manuela Ramos Bank for 8 years where with her first $125 loan she purchased fabric, buttons, thread, tape, satin, and frames.

With this $125 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of fabric for uniforms and old recycled sugar bags to make costumes. She is the treasurer in the village bank she belongs to, where she does the accounting. She dreams of having her own home and an automatic sewing machine. She has a large clientele due to her punctuality, quality of work, price, and the finishing touches she puts in to each piece of work.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa Nelly, tiene 45 años, está casada, estudió educación secundaria, en el colegio le enseñaron Alta Costura y además una profesora le dictó clases particulares de costura en su casa, tiene 01 hijo de 22 años que actualmente trabaja, vive en el Distrito de Paiján en la Provincia de Ascope en el Departamento de La Libertad. Para ayudarse económicamente empezó a coser uniformes escolares, disfraces, sacos, vestidos y toda variedad de ropa. Hace 24 años su Papá compraba el material y la socia los confeccionaba, para luego vender a los clientes. Como necesitaba capital propio, decidió participar en el Banco Comunal “HONESTIDAD Y CONFIANZA”, tiene 08 años trabajando en Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró telas, botones, hilos, cintas, tela raso, tela lanilla a cuadros. Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 que cancelará en 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra de telas para uniformes, bolsas de azúcar de reciclaje para hacer disfraces. En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece tiene el cargo de tesorera, cuya función es llenar libretas, llevar la contabilidad. La empresaria sueña con tener una casa propia y una máquina remalladora. Tiene clientela debido a la puntualidad, confección, precio y pone esfuerzo en el acabado de la ropa.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale fabric

loans.name: Hadia

texts.en:
Hadia is 20 years old and she is married with a child one year old. She has been a vegetable seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $105 from her sales.

Hadia is now looking for a loan to buy more vegetables for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Loeub

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeub P., age 48, is a widow who makes and sells traditional Khmer cakes such as Num Ansorm, Num Korm, and Num Bot. The ingredients are sticky rice, sugar, pieces of pork, and peanuts. 

All of these kinds of cakes are made by wrapping the sticky rice and peanut mixture in banana leaves and cooking them in a steamy pot. Loeub P. starts cooking her cakes in the early morning. She sells the cakes in different locations in her area, making about $5/day of profit. 

Mrs. Loeub P. has five children. Three of them are employed by a factory, one is a goldsmith, and another is enrolled in school. 

Mrs. P. needs more capital to expand her business. She has applied for a loan to purchase more ingredients so that she can increase the number of her cakes she makes, as well as her profit margin.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to make more cakes

loans.name: Rigoberta

texts.en:
Rigoberta is a member of the Proyección Village Bank. She is 49 years old and married with five children. Rigoberta has a stand in the April 12th Market in the center of Ayacucho where she sells meat. She buys the animals at weekend livestock fairs and then brings them to the city slaughterhouse. She also sells clothing in markets and sometimes sells animals.

Rigoberta needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy skirts, blouses and aprons to sell. Rigoberta’s dreams are to see her business grow and to meet all of her family’s basic needs. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Rigoberta es socia del Banco Comunal Proyección. Rigoberta es casada, tiene 49 años y 5 hijos, Rigoberta tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril que se ubica en el centro de la ciudad, en donde vende carne, los animales los compra en las ferias los días sábado y domingo luego lo beneficia en el camal de la ciudad. Además vende ropa en las ferias y en algunas oportunidades canjea con animales. Rigoberta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de faldas, blusas, mandiles. Rigoberta sueña con que su negocio crezca y en su familia no falte las cosas elementales.

loans.use: Buy skirts, blouses and aprons for resale

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
“I am worried and a bit concerned about how would I spend our limited income to meet all my family needs”, says Luzviminda E., 47-year-old mother of four children from Lagao, General Santos City. As a loving wife, she has been helping her spouse nurture their family well.  As a couple, they jointly work hard to raise all their children and provide quality education by sending all of them to school. 

To augment their income, she is engaged in making doormats, which she sells in her neighborhood and to Star Bright Company in Polomolok, South Cotabato.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,0000 to purchase more materials in making doormats. She also considers trying to invest in other possible income areas. “I wanted to contributure to the family income to provide my children’s need”, she said. “ I believe that my being part of CEVI could help me achieve my aspirations. Now, I am well provided with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI offers”, she added.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials in making doormats

loans.name: Taumaia

texts.en: Taumaia F., 38, is married and has five children.  She has many years experience in the pancake business. She sells to the general public and villagers three days per week. Taumaia has had three previous loans with SPBD, which are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She plans to purchase flour, dripping, sugar, and ripe bananas for her pancake business. The rest of the loan will be used for buying timbers, cements, bricks, and nails for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase flour, dripping, sugar, and ripe bananas for pancake business

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
El Señor de Nombre Marcial B. A. tiene 47 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, Don Marcial tiene 2 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 18 años cursa el 3 año de la carrera y su hijo menor de 12 años cursa el 1 año de secundaria, su esposa labora en una ferretería, sus propósitos son de mantener su clientela ya que son el apoyo económico por medio ha sobrevivido con su familia, sus deseos son de establecer una tienda de ropa en la que encontrara una variedad de mercadería como lo es ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ya que en esta época es muy difícil mantener un negocio de este tipo por lo cual el podría administrarlo, sus sueños son de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ya que le gustaría poder propiciarle a su esposa todas las comodidades que se merece y también a sus hijos para que estos puedan tener un futuro económico para que no pasen necesidades.

Su actividad económica es la de mercadería en general, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 6 años, Don Marcial inicia este negocio después que lo despiden de su trabajo de la empresa Enel que en un momento formo parte del estado y mas tarde vendida a una empresa española por lo que deciden realizar recorte de personal y da inicio con otro negocio como lo es la venta de bolis o helados pero al ver la poca  ganancia que le generaba decide incorporar la venta de ropa de crédito de forma ambulante luego gracias a Dios y su experiencia como administrador logra nuevamente incorporarse a la vida profesional en una empresa donde aprovecha las oportunidades y distribuye su mercadería a los trabajadores contando también con el apoyo de su esposa que contribuye en dicha actividad teniendo como meta establecer un local fijo y sustentar los gastos diarios del hogar, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que el con su esposa realizan las compras de la mercadería para distribuirla a su clientela además agradece el contar con la Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas.
texts.en:
Marcial B. A. is 47 years old. His civil status is married. Marcial has two children whose ages are the following: his eldest son is 18 years old and he's in his third year of his career studies and his younger son is 12 and he's in his first year of secondary school. His wife works in a hardware store. Their goals are to serve their customers since they provide the economic support through which they've survived with their family. Their desires are to establish a clothing store in which one will find a variety of merchandise such as clothing for women, men and children. Since, at this time, it is difficult to maintain such a business, he could manage it. Their dreams are to improve their living conditions. He would like to give his wife all the comforts she deserves, and his children so that they may have a fruitful future and not want for necessities. His job is in general merchandise. His business is of the "on foot" nature. He's had this business for six years. Marcial began this business after he was laid off from his job at the Enel company, which at one time was part of the state and later was sold to a Spanish company that decided to cut personnel. He started with another business selling icy pops and ice cream. However, upon seeing the little earnings that it generated, he decided to incorporate sales of clothing on credit on foot. Then, thanks to God, and to his experience as a manager, he was able to enter professional life again with a company where he took advantage of the opportunity to distribute his merchandise to the workers, relying also on the support of his wife who contributes to said activity having as a goal to establish a fixed shop and to support the daily expenses of the household. The loan is for working capital since he and his wife purchase merchandise for distribution to their customers. Additionally they are grateful to Fundación León 2000 and friends.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: El señor Enrique tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos y la casa donde viven es propia. Es propietario de un motocarro, con el que se dedica a brindar servicio de trasportes de pasajeros por los distintos lugares de su zona, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 3 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de esta labor es estar en contacto con los distintos clientes que requieren de su servicio, y le es muy rentable a sola razón de que él mismo labora en su herramienta de trabajo y es quien lo administra. Lo más difícil para él es no contar con un lugar adecuado para guardar su motocarro, ya que los robos son constantes. Posteriormente quiere tener un negocio adicional de la venta de abarrotes, lo que significará nuevos ingresos para su hogar. Ya son 6 veces que está recibiendo un crédito con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal ya que se lleva bien con todos sus compañeros. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a reparar su motocarro, comprar llantas y desde luego construir un garaje para su vehículo y estar protegido de cualquier robo.
texts.en:
Enrique is 50 years old, married, with three children, and they live in their own home. He owns a motorcar with which he provides passenger transportation to different places in his area. He has been doing this work for 3 years. What he likes about this work is having contact with various customers who require his service. It is very profitable because he himself fixes his vehicle and manages it. The most difficult for him is not having an adequate place to park his motorcar, and robberies are constant in the area. In the future he wants to have another business selling groceries, which will generate new income for his home. This is his 6th loan with MFP, and he likes to work with the communal bank and he gets along well with his colleagues. With the money from the loan he wants to send his motorcar for repair, buy tires, and then construct a garage for his vehicle so it is protected from being stolen.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his motorcar and build a garage

loans.name: Bordian

texts.en:
Bordian G. owns 1.38 hectares of arable land. This year, he will cultivate sunflowers and corn on 7 hectares on arable land. He has a car that he uses to transport goods to order, but most of all he do this for his best customers.He processes sunflowers to produce oil for sale and uses maize for breeding. He also raises 2 cows and 3 pigs near his house.

The purpose of the loan is to purchase seeds and fertilizer, and to buy gas to transport the goods.

loans.use: purchase of seeds, fertilizers and gasoline

loans.name: El Mamey 1 Group

texts.en:
The El Mamey Bank of Hope is a new group of micro-entrepreneurs joining Esperanza International for a loan. They live near VilL. MelL., which is a large district on the northern outskirts of Santo Domingo. There, employment opportunities are scarce and life conditions are difficult. Most people have turned to self-employment to support their families.

This group’s coordinator is Lario P.. Lario is 28 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Despite having some college education, Lario has not been able to find a good job placement. He has taken advantage of the numerous construction sites around VilL. MelL. to sell breakfast and lunch to the construction workers. He sells good portions of traditional items like rice and beans for a very low price. He plans on using this loan to buy more food items in order to be able to cook more portions to sell, since he is finding a larger demand for his meals.

Lario hopes the profits from his business will help him establish a food business where people can come and buy from him, instead of his having to go and sell on site.

On behalf of the El Mamey Bank of Hope members and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: buy rice, beans and poultry for lunches

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Veronica es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajando por el Desarrollo”, del distrito Cabanilla, Provincia de Lampa, en el departamento de Puno; ella tiene 30 años de edad, ella tiene de un hijo, es madre soltera, estudio secundaria completa.

La señora Veronica viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, se dedica venta de abarrotes, ella solicito su primer préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que lo invirtió en comprar productos para su tienda, negocio que le va bien.

Ahora viene solicitando un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, este dinero piensa invertirlo en capital y comprar lo que necesita para llenar su tienda y refirió que pagará en 06 cómodas cuotas.
texts.en:
Veronica M. A. is a member of the Communal Bank "Women Working for Development," of the Cabanilla district, in the Lampa province, department of Puno. She is 30 years old and is the single mother of a son. She completed secondary school. Veronica has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 3 years. She sells groceries. Her first loan was for 500 soles and she invested it in buying products for her store. Her business is doing well. She is now requesting a new loan of 500 soles ($175). She will use this money to purchase additional merchandise to stock her store. She plans to repay the loan in 6 installments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long N., 42, lives in Pursat Province where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice and has two crops per year, in both the dry and rainy seasons. She is married and has two children; one child is single and the other is married. One of her children is working in the Phnom Penh City as a garment worker. Her husband, Nhgoeun, 41, works with her in the farming business and this is their main source of income. Because the rainy season is coming, Mrs. N. needs a loan of US$500 to buy additional farmland to grow crops.

loans.use: To buy additional farmland to grow crops

loans.name: Jimma

texts.en:
Jimma E., a 42-year-old married mother of one child, lives in the village of Poblacion 2 Clarin Misamis Occidental, where she owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store. The store’s main source of income is derived from selling shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc. to the local community. Jimma has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jimma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC and is now requesting a new loan, her third from the organization, of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari." Jimma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to meet her family's basic needs.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ogbonna

texts.en: E. goes to Cotonu once every two weeks, buys apples in cartons and supplies them to  roadside sellers who retail them to consumers. She needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase more cartons of apples.  E. is 42 years old, married with two children.

loans.use: Purchase apples to sell.

loans.name: Santa  Catarina

texts.es: Doña Santa C. cuenta con 42 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes Tipícos para mujeres” habita junto a  sus 5 hijos, ella y sus hijos  se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 12 años en la Artesanía su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Chocanac de la Aldea V., del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas por semana, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Santa C. is 42 years old. She is married and works as a weaver. She manufactures typical cuts for women. She lives with her 5 children who are weavers as well. Santa has been in this craft for 12 years. She lives in Caserio Chocanac in the V. Village at the Totonicapán department in Guatemala. Santa's clientele has recently increased. However, her economical condition is not good enough to allow her to increase her capital. Therefore, she came to the ASDIR Association to request a loan to use it to purchase more merchandise thereby increasing her weekly sales. She also hopes she can help his children succeed and improve her family's life conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (purcahse raw materials)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 54 years old, is divorced and has four children who are all still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Techiman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.

Mary is a trader. She deals in textile materials, primarily selling ready-made clothes and lace materials. She sells at the market square and also hawks her wares in the neighborhood.

Mary has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy more textile goods. She aspires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Мавлюда  уже 2 год кредитуется. За это время она показала себя как порядочный клиент. За период кредитования у неё улучшалось семейное положение. Она на кредит закупает сезонные ткани. У неё очень много клиентов.  Мавлюда хочет получить займ в сумме 5000 сроком на 4 месяцев.

loans.use: Закуп тканей

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S., age 61, is a widow and has six children. She lives with her children in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she operates a business selling a few groceries and ice, earning approximately US $5 per day. The family is also assisted by her children who are employed in various kinds of workplaces in the city.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase various kinds of groceries to expand her current business. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: grocery purchase

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Rosita, se dedica a la venta de anticuchos, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, los vende en una carretilla, ambulado por las los diferentes lugres de la Ciudad y por su sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, tiene muy buena acogida. 
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, a partir de las 6:00 pm de la tarde. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma alegre que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios, para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, nos cuenta que tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propio restaurant en un local bien acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Mujeres Valerosas II Comunal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 42, married, and has three dependent children. Rosita sells kebobs. She has very good daily sales. She sells from a cart on the streets in different locations in the city. She is very well received because of the good seasoning she gives her food. She is currently in the same business, and she is very happy with the work she does day to day starting at 6:00 p.m. She personally waits on her customers with her characteristic happy charisma. With this loan for 500 PEN she will buy supplies like kilos of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, and crates of eggs for daily food preparation. She will also buy some utensils to set up her business and give her customers better attention. She feels full of life with the desire to get ahead. She has many dreams and goals in her life like to set up her own restaurant in a well equipped location. At the same time she also is grateful the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the start up of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Mighty Power Group

texts.en:
Mighty Power is a group of 5 borrowers led by Akine S. who is 34 years old and has a high school degree. Akine has a 5 year-old child who is in kindergarten. He lives in West Point, Monrovia, Liberia. This community is very crowded and has a high poverty rate which pushes its residents to try many different ways to make a living.

Akine sells dry goods such as milk, sugar, and ovaltine. Before, Akine was a laborer, pushing wheelbarrows, but he later realized that he needed to own his own business. He has been operating this business for four years and still hopes for greater improvement. Akine has developed a good relationship with his customers because he is polite to them.

He hopes to eventually expand his business into a big store. Akine dreams of being able to provide for his family such that his child has a solid education and they all have better health care. He needs this loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
Pedro José M. Tellez es un señor de 47 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y su hijo en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Don Pedro se ha dedicado desde muy joven a la ganadería, especialmente le saca provecho al ganado para engorde, ya que es una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Dice estar muy contento porque gracias a este proyecto ha podido salir adelante.

Don Pedro desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢685.000 (seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar más vacas y así aumentar la producción. El sabe que contar con más vacas es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo; pero dice que así podrá fortalecer más su proyecto y así llegará a ser un microempresario exitoso.

Don Pedro es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Pedro José M. Tellez is a 47 year-old gentleman who lives with his wife and son in a community called Santa Fe located in Los Chiles, province of Alajuela. This community is a mountainous area close to the northern border of our country. The main economic activities are livestock and agriculture, specifically sowing of basic grains, sugar canes, and oranges.

Since he was very young Don Pedro has been a livestock farmer, specializing in fattening livestock as a way of generating income for his family. He says he is pleased because this project has enabled him to get ahead.

Don Pedro requests a micro credit of 685,000 colones to buy more cows and thus increase the production. He is aware that having more cows represents more sacrifice and work, but he says that it will strengthen his project and he will become a successful micro-businessman.

Don Pedro is a member of the "Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe", one of 100 organizations partners of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan and it will enable him to grow on a personal and economic level. He also points out that thanks to this kind of organizations and means to facilitate loans he can spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cows to be fattened.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi K. est une femme de 29 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle habite à Kpalimé une ville connue pour le cacao et le café au Togo. C’est une coiffeuse et avec ce prêt de Kiva, elle voudrait vendre les produits de l’alimentation générale aux devantures de son salon de coiffure.Afi est une femme très dévouée et très résolue et avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle voudrait construire une maison pour sa famille et un magasin de vente des produits de l'alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Afi K. is a 29 year old woman, married and the mother of 2 children. She lives in Kpalime a town known for its production of cocoa and coffee in Togo. She is a hairdresser and with this loan from Kiva, she would like to sell general food products in the front of her hairdo shop. Afi is very resolute and enterprising and with the profits, she would like to build a house for her family and a store for trading. FECECAV is a cooperative union created in 1995 and registered in 1997. It's mission is to serve the financial needs of local people who have been excluded from the traditional financial system. It serves more than 45,000 members in the Plateaux and Maritime regions of Togo. FECECAV is a non-profit organization.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock and sell palm oil

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en:
Bienvenido T. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan De Oro City. He is 54 years old. Bienvenido is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Bienvenido owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Bienvenido has been engaged in his business for over 43 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bienvenido joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bienvenido is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Bienvenido from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Zoila Ladislada

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ZOILA tiene 54 años, es viuda, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia tiene 4 hijos los cuales tres son mayores y la menor Zenaida tiene 18 años y estudia en el colegio “Comercio 41” del Cusco.     
 
La socia vende ropa usada en “El Baratillo” para una pequeña empresa. La socia lava, plancha la ropa y después lo vende. Ya son varios años con el trabajo y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre, trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y quiere abrir su propio negocio de venta de comida al paso. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar un triciclo y en ahí llevar comida y vender afuera de los mercados. En esta época del año es cuando más se vende comida por las fiestas navideñas.
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member ZOILA is 54 years old, widowed, and is a native of Cuzco City. She belongs to the communal bank “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She has 4 children, of which three are grown up, while the youngest, Zenaida, is 18 years old and studies in the “Comercio 41” high school in Cuzco. Zoila sells used clothing in “El Baratillo” for a small business. She washes and irons the clothes, then sells them. She has been doing this work for quite a few years and it has been going very well for her thanks to all the dedication and hard work she puts into her work. She is a mother, a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman, who has been able to help her family prosper. She wants to open her own business selling food to go. She needs this loan to buy a tricycle to carry her food and thus sell food outside of the markets. This is the season when she sells a lot of food for Christmas parties. She is grateful for the opportunity offered to her through these means and therefore she promises to make all her payments according to her time line.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs this loan to buy a tricycle to carry her food and thus sell food outside of the markets.

loans.name: Enmma Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Emma es casada y madre de 3 hijos los tres mayores de edad, todos trabajan y tiene su propio hogar, su esposo trabaja como pintor ambulante el cual la ayuda con los gastos familiares,  trabaja como docente de la Escuela Rigoberto cabezas desde hace 22 años, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do  crédito para pintar su vivienda y lograr que se mire mas bonita,  ademas de trabajar como maestra alquila tres habitaciones, de las cuales obtenien ingresos adicionales para el sustento familiar. Emma se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer  con alto espiritu de superación personal, responsable y trabajadora, es una docente que ama su trabajo ya que ayuda a muchos niños  a aprender a leer y escribir,  su sueño  es  tener estabilidad laboral, salud  y una vivienda con mejores condiciones para vivir con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Doña Emma is married and has three children, all of them adults. They all have jobs, and they have their own homes. Her husband works as an itinerant painter and helps her pay the household expenses. Emma has worked as a teacher in the Rigoberto Cabezas School for 22 years. She is asking for a second loan so that she can have her house painted and make it look better. As well as being a teacher, she rents out three rooms which provides the family with additional income. Emma is a high-spirited woman who knows how to get things done. She is a responsible and hard-working teacher who loves her work as she can help many children to learn to read and write. Her dream is to have a stable job, good health, and a better home so that she can live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: house repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy equipment for her business.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep S. is 58 years of age and a married woman. In order to meet the needs of the family, Tep S. sells a little grocery inventory out of her home. She has been engaged in this business for three years and earns approximately $3 per day. To help contribute to the family's needs, her husband works in construction and also assists her with selling. They have been married for many years and they have two school-aged and two married children. 

Tep S. hopes to expand her business and is applying for a loan to be used to buy supplies of grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To buy supplies of grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Juan Felipe

texts.es:
El señor Juan Felipe T. P. es originario de la comunidad el coyol municipio de condega se dedica a actividades agrícolas y ganaderas su finca tiene una extensión de 130 mz de terreno siendo estas mas a la actividad de ganado, se le otorgo el crédito para la compra de mantenimiento de café como compra de abono ya que este cliente cuenta con un área de ocho mz de café el cual se dedica a cultivarlas de la mejor manara posible para sacarle un buen provecho a este rubro ya que es una delas principales actividades de los nicaragüenses   
Su negocio comenzó desde niño ya que su papá se dedicaba a cultivar este rubro y aprendió de él ,hoy en día ya no cuenta con la ayuda de su papá pero siempre cultiva el patrimonio que él le dejo. Este cliente también se dedica a otras actividades como cultivo de granos básicos y ganadería y  espera que con el crédito  le  vaya muy bien porque tendrá más oportunidad de seguir trabajando y mantener su finca cada ves mas en mejores condiciones ya que su meta es tener es dejarle un buen patrimonio a sus hijos. 
Don Juan Felipe es casado y tiene seis hijos dos edad escolar y  cuatro mayores de edad que ya no dependen de él pero siempre les brida su apoyo como padre. Este es sexto crédito que se le otorga y trabaja con ceprodel desde el año dos mi cinco y nos expreso que esta agradecido con la institución por la ayuda que se le a brindado ya que a mejorado sus condiciones de vida de su familia y espera seguir trabajando de la misma forma con ceprodel.
texts.en:
Juan Felipe T. P. is originally from the community of Coyol, municipality of Condega. He makes a living as an agricultural and livestock farmer on his own land. He is most active in livestock. He is requesting the loan to purchase fertilizers for his coffee crops, since a portion of his land is dedicated to coffee and he wants to cultivate it in the best way possible to make the most of it. Coffee is one of the main activities of Nicaraguans. He has been involved in the business since he was a young boy because his father also made a living off the same land. Juan Felipe learned from him, and today he doesn't have his father to count on but he will always work on the land that he left him. Juan Felipe also dedicates himself to other activities, such as cultivating basic grains and raising livestock, and he hopes that the loan will give him more opportunities to keep working and improving the conditions of his farm a little more each time. His goal is to leave a legacy for his children. Juan Felipe is married and has six children, two school age and four who are fully grown and no longer dependent on him but whom he always supports as a father. This is his sixth loan, and he has worked with Kiva partner Ceprodel since 2005. He expressed his gratitude for helping him improve his family's quality life, and he hopes to keep working with the same success with Kiva and Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to maintain coffee crops

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en:
Bayasgalan is 48 years old and lives with her husband and their four children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger', the Mongolian nomadic tent. Their oldest daughter has graduated from university in Mongolia. 

In 2000, Bayasgalan started a sewing business with a working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~ 351 USD), but after a lot of hard work her working capital currently exceeds 3,000,000 tugrugs (~ 2111 USD). Her successful business has allowed her to pay the tuition fees of her twins and to afford family expenses. 

Bayasgalan is a very hard-working and loyal person who has a great business mind. She says “I would like to be a reliable person who doesn't break promises.” Bayasgalan is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug (~ 844 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of materials for her sewing business.
