loans.use: To purchase materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Margareth

texts.en:
Margareth is 45 years old, married, and has six children – three boys and three girls. Her children are doing well in business and school. Margareth's husband is a farmer and he also supports their home.
Margareth sells groceries and drinks to make a living. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to make her business more sustainable by working hard. Margareth is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Greziel

texts.en: 37-year-old Greziel has four kids from her husband Ranulfo. Her eldest is aged eleven. She works hard to help provide her family’s needs and sustain her children’s education. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store located at her house in Panglao, Bohol. She sells mineral water, shampoo and other necessities her neighbors regularly look for. She hopes to prosper in what she does. She applied for a loan of 16,000 PHP from CEVI, which she will use to buy more inventory for her store.

loans.use: additional inventory

loans.name: Bibizilol

texts.en: M. Bibizilol is 38 years old, is married and has a child. She has a grocery store which she attends to herself, aside from caring for her family and her home. Bibizilol began her business ten years ago with financial support from her husband and the business has been gradually growing ever since. The reason for starting the business was to increase her family’s income. In order to grow her business Bibizilol requests a loan of 3000 US dollars. She is planning to spend the loan on purchasing more goods to sell, thus increasing the range of the goods in her grocery. Bibizilol promises to repay her loan on time and thanks everybody who decides to support her. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to increase the range of her products

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha K. lives in Rung village in Takeo province. She was born in 1970. She is a farmer who owns a four-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil and it is a long way from an irrigation system. So to improve her rice production, Mrs. Sokha K. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and rice seed and to hire farm laborers to plow her rice field. Her husband, Mr. Orng Mork, is a construction worker. She supports three children. One of her children is a seamstress in the garment factory and the others are attending the local public school. Her husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and rice seed

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is widowed with four children and none of her children go to school. She also takes care of her sister’s children who are school going.  Alice owns a stall  in Owino market selling second hand shoes. She uses public transport to and from home. Alice buys from  the same market where she works. She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand shoes. She has been in this business for 10 years now and with MCDT for two and one half years, servicing her sixth loan.  She pays market dues of 25,000/= per month and 1,000 per day worked.  Alice works six days a week and her business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of second hand shoes.  Alice aspires to see her business grow big and to start going to Mombasa and Nairobi for shoes. Alice joined MCDT because she wanted to increase her capital base.  She resides in and owns a four-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more second hand shoes

loans.name: Nelba Jeovana

texts.es:
Nelba estudio muchas carreras como educación primaria, enfermería técnica, estilista y podología, Nelva tiene una clínica Podológica en un local alquilado, negocio que inicio hace 2 años, recibió una especialización en la Habana, realiza tratamiento de pies, cirugías menores. Nelba es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones que le ayudan a seguir progresando. Nelva solicita un crédito de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos para una campaña podológica que piensa realizar.
Nelba sueña con estudiar la carrera de medico podólogo, seguir especializándose y hacer crecer su clínica.
texts.en:
Nelba studied several professions like: elementary school teaching, technical nursing, hair stylist and podiatry. She runs a podiatry clinic in a rented locale; she started this business two years ago after receiving specialized training in Havana. She provides foot treatments and minor surgeries. She is a member of the Brisas (Breezes) communal bank and what she likes best about it are the training sessions that help her to continue to progress. Nelba is asking for 3000 soles to buy medicines for a podiatry campaign she plans to carry out. Nelba dreams with studying to become a medical podiatrist, to continue specializing, and to have her clinic expand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Mèmèdé Clarisse

texts.fr: A. Mèmèdé Clarisse est née en 1978 à Ganvié au Bénin et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais Clarisse ne vit plus avec son mari. Clarisse vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les différentes charges familiales. Clarisse s'est installée depuis près de douze ans au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Clarisse a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. IL y a près de douze ans que Clarisse vend divers produits (conserves de tomates et de sardine, lait, mayonnaise, petits pois, café, couscous, huile d'arachide, savons, etc.) dans sa boutique size à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Clarisse  vend de l'eau fraîche, de la glace et du jus de bissap. Clarisse achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la première fois que Clarisse sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit en vue d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mèmèdé Clarisse A. was born in 1978 in Ganvié, Benin, and is the mother of three children, all in school. But Clarisse no longer lives with her husband. She lives alone with her children and provides for the family by herself. For close to twelve years, Clarisse has lived in the Ayélawadjè area in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She ended her studies in secondary school. For close to twelve years, Clarisse has sold various products (canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, mayonnaise, peas, coffee, couscous, peanut oil, soap, etc.) at a store located in her home. As a secondary business, Clarisse sells fresh water, ice, and hibiscus flower tea. She buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. This is the first time Clarisse is seeking a loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), with the goal of increasing her working capital and better responding to the growing demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products (canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, peas, couscous, pasta, peanut oil, soap)

loans.name: Francis Otsiendo

texts.en:
Having worked in a construction firm for a considerable duration of time, Francis Otsiendo O. thought it wise to start a cereals business in the year 2008 in Lugulu to uplift his socio-economic status. The 33-year-old, a proud father of three who lives in Lugulu, travels to Busia on a weekly basis to restock his business. This is a venture that has had a positive impact on his life, but his aim of expanding the venture has been paralyzed due to lack of sufficient capital. 

In his quest to achieve this goal, he joined the Kiva loan scheme for a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to expand his cereal venture and maximize his profit to enable him to initiate another venture, which will enhance his ability to provide for the essential needs for his family.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married with eight children and all of them are at school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She owns a house which has electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses are food, water and electricity.

Monica changed her business enterprise from a food stall to selling alcohol and has been in this business for a few months. She operates her business from her shop and her customers are other traders. She works seven days a week and depends on this job for a living. Her business challenge is thieves.

Monica doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work from delivery vans, which get the gin from Kabarole district.

With the loan, Monica  plans to buy more jerrycans of local gin which she sells retail only. She is aiming to see her business grow big and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more jerycans of local gin to sell

loans.name: Ma. Evelina

texts.en:
Ma. Evelina’s desire to give her daughter a brighter future fuels her commitment to her business. She is a very hard-working woman, firm to achieve a better life. Despite the challenges and hardships caused by poverty, Ma. Evelina is still strong and dedicated in her mission to improve her family’s standard of living. The love and care of her husband makes her life quite meaningful.

To earn a living, Ma. Evelina makes “pawid “(can be used for house roofs) out of coconut leaves. Like others, they use it since they can’t afford to buy the galvanize iron for roofing. She has been engaged in this business for four years. She joined ASHI in 2007, a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. During the course of her membership, she has been an excellent performer with respect to regular attendance at center and group meetings, loan repayment, and projects. She is now seeking her third loan for the amount of 13,000 PHP to purchase raw materials needed for her business.

With access to additional working funds through Kiva supporters, Ma. Evelina is optimistic that her dreams of sending her only daughter to a university, to complete college degrees, will be achieved and they will have a happy family in a simple way of living.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Joserecto

texts.en:
Joserecto P. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 49 years old and married. He is a loving father to his five children. To make a living, Joserecto owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Joserecto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joserecto has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Joserecto is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: George K.

texts.en:
George K. M. is twenty five years old, is single, and doesn’t have any children yet. His business is located in a busy commercial area in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean’s white beaches.

George has been selling clothes and cosmetics for the last three years to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is the recent diversion of the ferry, robbing him of so many customers who used to pass near his business and hence buy his items. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well.

George is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more cosmetics to expand his business. He hopes to grow his business and open other outlets in the future. He describes himself as attractive and determined.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: La señora Rene tiene 30 años, es conviviente y fruto de ese amor tienen una hija de 5 años llamada Mayli, viven en una casa de madera que logró construir con el sudor de su frente. La señora Rene se dedica al cultivo y producción de cacao y café, lo realiza en el centro poblado de Triboline, provincia de Sivia, distrito de Huanta. Desde hace 15 años y durante todas las mañanas sale a trabajar junto a su esposo, ambos les gusta labrar su propia chacra, con el fin de que pueda mejorar su producción; pues con sus propias manos hace que los frutos mejoren cosecha tras cosecha, sin embargo le incomoda la falta de apoyo, pero no se amilana ante los problemas. El trabajo que realiza le es bastante rentable, ya que sus productos son llevados al centro de acopio de su comunidad, donde le pagan un buen precio. Sus planes para el futuro será ampliar su negocio y mejorar su estabilidad económica, para eso menciona que tiene que trabajar el doble. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, y asegura seguir cumpliendo lo pagos en sus respectivas fechas, le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal porque entre ellos existe el apoyo moral y económico. Los mil soles que solicita, lo utilizará para el mejoramiento y mantenimiento de sus plantaciones de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Rene is 30 years old and lives with her partner, with whom she has a 5 year old daughter called Mayli. They live in a wooden house built thanks to their own sweat. Rene grows and produces cocoa and coffee in the town of Triboline, in the province of Sivia, district of Huanta. 

As she has done over the last 15 years, every morning she goes to work with her husband. They both enjoy working in their farm to improve their production; with their own hands they better the fruits crop after crop. Even if the lack of support bothers her, she is not afraid of problems. Her work is quite profitable. The fruits are taken to the collection centre in her community, where she gets a good price for them. Her plans for the future are to expand his business and to improve her financial stability, and she knows she will have to work twice as much to get it. 

This is her third loan with MFP. She promises that she will continue to repay it on its due dates. She enjoys working with ther loan group because she gets moral and financial support. She will use the one thousand soles requested for the improvement and upkeep of her cocoa and coffee plantations.

loans.use: To weed and clean out her cocoa and coffee fields.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta C. is from the village of Landing, Baliangao. She is 56 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Julieta owns and operates a business growing rice to sell. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2004, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used for personal purposes. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used for rice production. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Julieta from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for rice production

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en:
Annelyn Y. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is 28 years old. Annelyn is married and has two children aged 5 and 2. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Annelyn's husband is a farmer and she helps him keep their rice crops healthy. She also helps in selling their harvest.

Annelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Annelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Aburukundo Group

texts.en:
Beatha is 28 years old. She is married and has one child who is 3 years old. Her husband works as a driver. Beatha is the leader of the borrowing group called Aburukundo Group. Aburukundo means "People Full of Love" in the Kinyarwanda language. 

Group members sell different products and each has a market stall where they operate their daily businesses. Beatha owns a retail shop and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, sugar, and cosmetics. She has had this business for four years. 

She has requested a loan to buy more cooking oil and cosmetics to sell. With the profit from the business she will buy more items for sale. In the future she would like to import more items and distribute them to other business people in her area and beyond. In the photo, Beatha is seen in the middle of the group with a raised hand. 

The extra person in this photo does not belong to this group but is married to a man who is a member of this group. In an effort to support her husband, she decided to join him in the photo. She (the non-member) is sitting in the front row on the right hand side, wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: To buy more items such as cooking oil sugar and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married man with five school-aged children. After retiring from the army, he opened a grocery shop in his town in 2008. Next to the shop he has prepared a small coffee shop where he serves clients. His wife who works as a farmer helps him with the heavy family expenses and to pay for his five children's school fees. It is very common in Lebanon to see the two family members’ working to be able to raise their children. 

Today, the borrower is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase merchandise for his grocery store and for the coffee shop to reinforce his business level.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 49 años, es una madre soltera, vive en su casa propia, junto a sus 2 hijos. El negocio al que María se dedica, es la venta de productos de golosinas, en un kiosco que se encuentra dentro de un colegio grande de varios turnos de enseñanzas. Por ello, de lunes a vienes se levanta  muy temprano por la mañana, y solo así pueda llegar a tiempo; ya que se toma una hora en carro para llegar a su negocio.  Su buen trato y su gran paciencia en la atención de sus clientes, le han generado buenas ganancias. Es por ello que constantemente acude a los mercados grandes del centro de Lima, de esa manera proveerse de más productos, fijándose las fechas de vencimiento de las golosinas, es así que viene trabajando durante 20 años en esta labor que tanto le apasiona. En adelante, piensa ampliar su negocio y terminar de construir su casa.  Es su 2do crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería en galletas, chocolates y diversidad de golosinas, para surtir su kiosco.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old.  She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her 2 children.  María's business is selling candy products from a kiosk inside a large school which has several teaching shifts.  From Monday to Friday María gets up very early in the morning.  This is the only way she can arrive on time as it takes one and a half hours by car to get to her business.  Her good service and great patience in serving her customers have made her good profits.  For this reason, she is constantly going to the big markets in the center of Lima to stock up with more products, examining the expiry dates of the candies.  She has been doing this job which she loves so much for 20 years.  In the future, she is planning to expand her business and finish building her home.

This is María's second loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.  She will use her loan to buy more merchandise: cookies, chocolates and a range of candies, to stock her kiosk with.

loans.use: To buy cookies, chocolates and a range of candies

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto de 35 años, es un hombre trabajador que hace 15 años atrás comenzó como vendedor ambulante de cocos en las calles del suburbio. 

Viviendo con su esposa y su hijo de 7 años en una zona urbana ha estado trabajando en un negocio fijo que en la actualidad decidió ubicar en el mercado del suburbio donde transitan muchas personas en busca de vivieres. Vende jugos naturales de sandia, naranja, limón etc. Comienza su día instalando una carpa en el mercado desde las 07h00am hasta que terM. su jornada de trabajo a las 14h00pm. Su esposa  también le ayuda en las mañana haciendo unas tostadas para vender en su negocio. Una de las complicaciones que tiene para vender sus jugos es que el puesto de mercado queda afuera y esta a la interperie de los ladrones. 

El quiere continuar con su negocio por eso quiere con préstamo comprar frutas para su puesto. En el futuro quiere tener una familia más numerosa y ubicar un local para su negocio para que sea más segura sus ventas.
texts.en:
Humberto is 35 years old.  He is a hard-working man who started out, 15 years ago, as an itinerant coconut vendor in the streets of his suburb.

Humberto lives with his wife and his 7 year-old son in an urban area.  He works in a regular business which he decided to set up in the local market where lots of people pass through looking to buy food.  He sells natural juices (watermelon, orange, lemon, etc.).

Humberto starts his day setting up a tent in the market from 7.00am until he finishes his work day at 2.00pm.  His wife also helps him in the mornings, making 'tostadas' to sell in his business.

One of the complications that Humberto has in selling his juices is that his market stall is outside and open to thieves.  He would like to continue with his business and, for this reason, he would like to use this loan to buy fruit for his stall.  In the future, he would like to have a larger family and set up premises for his business so that it can be safer.

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Abed

texts.en: Abed is twenty nine years old and is a very hard working man who lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He is a motorcycle transport driver and has been in business for eight months now and the business is profitable.  He faces challenges in change of weather and his ambition is to own at least three motorcycles.  Abed intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Grower

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Grower; el tiene 24 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, el trabaja en un restaurant como chef, por medio de este negocio el socio quiere ahorrar y seguir estudiando para seguir mejorando en su carrera como cheff, el socio quiere tener un restaurant. El  socio solicita el préstamo el mantenimiento de su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Grower belongs to the community bank, "Banco del Desarrollo" ["Development Bank"]. The bank is located in the district, province, and state of Cusco.

Grower is 24 years old and single. He alternates his daily activities with the restaurant business, where he works as a chef.   Grower is using this job to increase his savings and continue studying to get ahead in his career as a chef.  He would like to own his own restaurant.

Grower is requesting this loan for the maintenance of his house.  He is thankful thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan to support the maintenance of his house

loans.name: Ngveang

texts.en:
Mr. Ngveang Y. T. was born in 1971, and he is a villager who lives in Kbal Chrouy village in Kandal province. He and his wife are recyclables sellers who are able to earn a small income to support their family. Since this business is doing well, they want to expand it. So Mr. Ngveang Y. T. would like to ask for a loan to buy more recyclables to expand his business. With this loan, he hopes to increase his income to improve his family's well-being. 

This couple has two children who are both laborers. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy more recycled items to enlarge his business activity

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es:
Tal y como lo describe Miriam del Socorro R. C. su trabajo inicia desde que se levanta y termina cuando se acuesta y es esta su forma de vida, pues desde pequeña esta luchadora incansable ha trabajado en diferentes oficios para ganarse la vida. Lavar ropa, trabajar en una mina, vender arepas, cremas y otros productos han sido algunos de los trabajos que ha desempeñado para salir adelante. 

Actualmente Miriam vende gas a los vecinos de la vereda del municipio de San Roque de donde es oriunda y para mejorar su servicio necesita de un préstamo para mejorar el piso del local ya que es en arena, así mismo espera comprar más gas para tener mayor capacidad de respuesta para sus clientes.
texts.en:
As Miriam del Socorro R. Castano describes it, her way of life is to work from the moment she  wakes in the morning until she goes back to sleep. Since she was a young girl this tireless fighter has had a several businesses to earn a living, including, providing laundry services, working in a mine, selling Venezuelan corn cakes and creams and other products. These have been some of the occupations she has had to make a living. 

Miriam sells propane gas to her neighbors in the municipality of San Roque, her place of origin.  In order to improve her service she needs a loan. She will improve the flooring of her store, currently it is only sand. She also wants to purchase more propane gas to have larger quantities in store for her clients.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Intesar

texts.en:
Intesar is a young woman from Nablus. She is married and a mother of six sons. Intesar's husband is a ministry employee. Intesar started a small business in her house.  She has a small piece of land next to the house. She started using it to grow seasonal vegetables and sell them to neighbors. The number of clients is growing and this helps her improve the project.

Intesar took a loan from FATEN to grow in a larger space of land and start packaging her crops for sale. Intesar's husband appears in the picture here instead of her, as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to package her crops for sale

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
Mrs. Yet A. is 36 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a construction worker who earns approximately 5 USD a day. They have four children, three of whom are single and one who is married and starting a household. Yet A. lives in the capital, Phnom Penh, and runs a small store in front of a garment factory where she sells breakfast and lunch to the garment workers. Her business generates a daily profit of about 3 USD that she uses to help provide for her family’s expenses.

Yet A. is requesting a loan to purchase a used motorbike to commute to her place of business. A motorbike will allow her to easily travel to her work and other places.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years. Bebiana also earns additional income from food vending.

Bebiana is borrowing PHP 15,000  through NWTF to buy more items to stock her sari-sari store.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  

Bebiana dreams of sending her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn M. is from Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 49 years old. Marilyn is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 29 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel es un hombre soltero de 40 años de edad,  tiene casa propia, vive solo, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo  luz. Su casa está ubicada en la  Pradera que pertenece a la provincia  de Chiclayo.  Es una zona urbana dedicada exclusivamente al comercio, agricultura y turismo.

Samuel se dedica ha manejar su mototaxi (transporte utilizado por las personas en rutas pequeñas que tiene como cupo máximo de 3 personas), ésta labor lo realiza diariamente  en la ciudad de Chiclayo, cuenta con  su propia clientela y también se dedica a criar animales como cabritos y carneros, su corral se encuentra en la parte exterior de su casa, ésto le permite obtener mayores ingresos para poder cubrir sus necesidades diarias.

A solicitado Samuel un préstamo ha Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para brindarle mantenimiento a su mototaxi y para comprar más animales para su venta en los distintos mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo, permitiéndole cubrir así su préstamo como tener un mejor nivel de vida.

Samuel es muy cocnocido por ser una persona  de confianza, muy respetuoso y responsable con su clientes que utilizan sus transporte, con el único objetivo de salir adelante y poderles ayudar enviando a sus padres un poco de dinero ya que se encuentran en otro lugar.
texts.en:
Samuel is a single, 40-year-old man.  He has a house of his own and lives alone.  The house only has electricity and is located in La Pradera which is part of Chiclayo Province.  It’s an urban zone dedicated exclusively to commerce, farming and tourism.

Samuel drives a mototaxi (transport used by people on short routes; it can carry a maximum of three people).  He works daily in the city of Chiclayo and has his own clientele.  He also raises animals, like goats and calves; his corral is located in his yard.  This makes it possible for him to earn higher income to cover his daily needs.

Samuel has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to service his mototaxi and to buy more animals to sell in Chiclayo’s various markets which will allow him to repay his loan and have a better standard of living.

Samuel is very well known for being a trustworthy, very respectful and responsible person with the customers who use his means of transport.  His only goal is to get ahead and be able to help out his parents sending them a little money because they are located elsewhere.

loans.use: to buy more animals and to service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Ana Adilia

texts.es: La señora Ana, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja en una empresa privada para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ya que ellos tienen una hija a su cargo, los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de  vida  y darle un mejor bienestar a su pequeña hija, doña Ana desde hace dos años labora como empleada domestica en una casa privada, lo cual su salario no le permite comprar de una sola vez los materiales de construcción y poder realizar las paredes intermedias de la vivienda , con el préstamo va a comprar  playcem, clavos , cuartones , regla , entre otros materiales .
texts.en: Señora Ana lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband.  He works for a private company to earn money to help with the household expenses.  Since they have a daughter to take care of, their family plans are to improve their living conditions and give their young daughter an improved well-being.  For the last two years, doña Ana has worked as a maid in a private home.  Her salary is insufficient for her to purchase the building materials all at once to be able to build the interior walls for her dwelling.  With the loan, she will purchase cement board, nails, wood beams, a straight edge and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marco es cliente nuevo de emprender, es su  primera secuencia de crédito individual,  El cliente   es transportista propietario y trabaja con su movilidad de manera particular por el alto y zona central de la ciudad de La Paz, con el dinero del crédito realizara Cambio de caja de automático  a  mecánico para su movilidad, El cliente vive  en  anticrético por la zona Munaytapa  es casado con Sra. María y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando en primaria el Sr.  Marco trabaja mucho y de esta manera salir adelante económicamente estar mejor por el bienestar de sus hijos y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Marco has been undertaken as a new member and subsequently this is his first individual loan.  This member is a self-employed transportation provider and works with his mobility in particular fashion navigating the altitudes and central area of La Paz.  With the money from the loan he will replace the automatic gear box to a manual for mobility.  The member lives on a contract-to-rent in the Munaytapa area, he is married to Maria and they have two children who are in elementary.  Marco works hard, this way he can get ahead economically and look after the well being of his two kids and improve the quality of life for his whole family.  He is thankful to the institution for the help presented to him.

loans.use: to change gear box from automatic to manual for mobility

loans.name: Kosai

texts.en:
Kosai is 28 years old. He is married and a father of two children. He is a farmer and he has been doing farming for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for maize farming.

Kosai learned about KADET LTD. through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and to educate his children. 

Koai's hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and to buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene 28 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería hace mas de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. No es el primer crédito que tiene con Fundación León 2000 ya que sabe que por medio de los diferentes créditos ha logrado salir adelante porque son necesarios para que los negocio crezcan. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y comprar granos básicos, detergentes, sopas, enlatados y papel higiénico.
texts.en: Maria Auxiliadora is 28 years old.  Her business is a general store.  She has made her living with this business for more than 7 years.  This is not her first loan with Fundación León 2000.  She has been able to get ahead through the different loans she has been given.  She knows that the loans are necessary for businesses to grow.  This loan is for working capital and to purchase basic grains, detergents, soups, canned goods and toilet paper.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, detergents, soups, canned goods and toilet paper.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Evelia has a shop where she sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Evelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Evelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Srihorng

texts.en: Srihorng sells flowers and feeds the chickens. Her husband is a Tok Tok driver. Their income is $10 per day. She has three children who are five, three and one years old. Every month she has to spend $83 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $40 on transportation, and $40 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to purchase a new motorbike for the Tok Tok service because the current motorbike is old and needs a lot of fixing. In the future, she wants to have a store in Phnom Penh market to sell flowers so that she can make a good income to help her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 35-year-old married man with three children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his children and have a self-sustaining business. For five years he has been in the agricultural sector, specialised in growing maize. He started with four acres of land but now he has twenty acres of land all covered with maize. His major challenge has been price fluctuations for maize products and his dream is to own a maize milling machine. Joseph needs this loan to clear land for growing maize.

loans.use: to clear land for farming.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen supports her family financially by selling buffalo milk. She gets the milk from her buffalo and sells to her community clients to generate income for her family. Besides her work, she also manages her household responsibilities very well. 

Her husband is a fruit vendor. He offers his customers fresh seasonal fruits for reasonable rates. Parveen is the mother of seven children. Four of them study while the others stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. With the loan, her husband will buy fresh seasonal fruits in bulk to be able to sell more to his customers and earn better profits. 

Parveen hopes that this investment will be a profitable one for her husband's business and that it will improve the living standard of her family as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Parveen.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits for selling

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo está satisfecho porque recibirá su nuevo credikiva, con el primero compró una moto para transportar los productos con una carrerilL.. En L. actualidad esta aplicando a su segundo credikiva con el cual comprará una moto tanques y filtros. Su mensaje a los financiadores D. Kiva es el siguiente:  “ Quiero darles mis agradecimientos por brindarme L. oportunidad D. ensanchar mi negocio y D. esta forma aumentar mis ingresos y poder cumplir con L. necesidad básica D. mi familia y contribuir D. esta manera a solucionar los problemas D. falta D. agua potable en mi ciudad.” Si usted quiere conocer L. historia D. Leonardo ingrese al siguiente enlace:  http://kiva.org/lend/208554
texts.en:
Leonardo is pleased to receive a new Kiva loan. His first loan was used to buy a motorcycle for transporting his products using a trailer. At the moment, he is applying for a second Kiva loan so that he can buy a motor, tanks, and filters.

He sends the following message to Kiva lenders: “I want to express my appreciation for giving me the opportunity to expand my business and increase my income so that I can meet the basic needs of my family and contribute toward solving the problems caused by a lack of clean drinking water in my city.”

To learn more about Leonardo’s story, please click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/208554

loans.use: to buy a motor, tanks, and filters.

loans.name: Chhearng

texts.en:
Chhearng, 42, is the mother of six lovely children who lives in Ornlong Veng District, Ordor Meanchay Province, Cambodia. All of her children are single. For the past six years, Chhearng has been a rice farmer and she earns a low daily income. Her current rice crop is not growing well because of the lack of fertilizer and increased weeds and insects in her fields. 

Chhearng has therefore decided to request a loan through the Kiva partner HKL to purchase fertilizer and insecticide. This will be her first loan with HKL and she hopes that her loan will increase her profit. In the future, she is hoping to have a bigger house than she currently does. Chhearng is very grateful to all of the lenders who help her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Fatullo

texts.ru: Фатулло занимается выпечкой национальных лепешек. В день он выпекает около 350-500 шт. лепешек.  В своей улице он единственный кто имеет лепешечный цех. Потребители является его соседи и жители, которые живет в этом территории. Он очень трудолюбивый человек и любящий отец 4 детей. Кроме того он также занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном он выращивает фасоль и кукурузу. Его жена и дети помогает ему в бизнесе. Он получает стабильный доход от своего бизнеса и с прибылью недавно построил новый дом для своего сына. Фатулло хотел бы получить займ для покупки муки с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Fatullo is involved in baking national flatbread.  He bakes about 350-500 flatbread per day.  He is the only person on his street, who has a bakery.  Fatullo's customers are his neighbors and residents, who live in this area.  He is a very hard-working person and a loving father of four children.  Besides this business, he is also involved in growing agricultural crops.  Fatullo primarily grows beans and corn.  His wife and children help him in this business.  He earns a stable income from his business and recently used the profits to build a new house for his son.  Fatullo wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of flour in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Talal

texts.en:
Talal is a 36-year-old married Lebanese man living with his wife and three children. He has more than 20 years of experience working as a car blacksmith. He is specialized in repairing car bodies. His is the main source of income for the family. 

Today he is asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase special machinery. This will be his second Kiva loan and he is asking for a higher amount because he states that such sum will help him meet his business needs in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase special machinery

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
Yeny pertenece al banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” y cada treinta días las reuniones se realizan en la ciudad de Izcuchaca en la comunidad de Compone. 

Yeny tiene 28 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Espinar y vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de carne de cordero, trucha y menudencia de cordero. Ya son cinco años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en el trabajo. En esta oportunidad Yeny requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo carne y trucha. 

Yeny agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Yeny belongs to the San Isidro de Compone community bank.  The members meet once a month in Compone, a neighborhood of the city of Izcuchaca.

Yeny, 28, is partnered and has two children.  She was born in the city of Espinar and lives in the city of Cusco where she works.  She owns a business selling meat, trout, etc.  She started the business five years ago and is happy with her progress.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise--meat and trout, for example--that she will resell.

Yeny is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail food business.

loans.name: Evergreen Group

texts.en:
Milton is 37 years old and lives in Harare. He is married and has two children, one of whom is attending school.  Milton runs a manufacturing business producing chemicals. The business has been in operation for 2 years.

He says the major challenges he faces are lack of capital and stiff competition. Milton has requested a loan of $400.00 to purchase raw materials. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve the well being of his family. In the future, Milton plans to export chemicals.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for producing chemicals.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious is 28 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is single and has a child that attends school and lives at home. For the past three years, Precious has been running a grocery shop where she sells many items such as toothpaste, cream, nutrition, etc. She has a lot of customers and her daily sales are very high during the dry season. Precious is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business. Precious plans to expand her business and wishes her children to continue the business.

loans.use: to purchase more toothpaste, cream, and other items

loans.name: Diégane

texts.fr: Monsieur Diégane vit au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 42 ans. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants de 10 mois et 8 ans. Il est agent de  dans une société de gardiennage  qui assure la sécurité des différents guichets de l’U-IMCEC. Il sert dans l’un des guichets de l’IMCEC  ou il est membre depuis  novembre  2006.Auparavant il était cultivateur et c’est sous l’influence d’un de ses amis  qu’il s’est retrouvé dans le secteur du gardiennage. Ce qui l’intéresse néanmoins ce sont les connaissances qu’il  noue avec la population et aussi les revenus que lui procure l’activité. Il a déjà remboursé 5 prêts antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour la fabrication de briques et la continuation du bâtiment   qu’il  est en train de construire  progressivement au village.
texts.en: Mr. Diégane lives in Senegal. He is 42 years old. He is a married father of two children, who are 10 months and 8 years old. He is an agent at a security company who provides security for different UIMCEC banks. He works at one of the IMCEC banks, where he has been a member since November 2006. Before that, he was a farmer, and it was the influence of one of his friends that he moved into the security sector. What interests him, however, is the people he meets and also the income he makes. He has already repaid 5 previous loans with the institution. He is seeking a loan of 200,000 frs for making bricks and the continuation of the building that he is in the middle of gradually building in the village.

loans.use: to make bricks

loans.name: Myriam Sonia

texts.es:
Myriam es una mujer casada de 37 años,  su esposo se dedica a realizar el servicio de transporte público a través de un taxi. Juntos tienen 2 hijos, un pequeño de apenas 2 añitos y uno que cursa el nivel de secundaria con 15 años de edad. 

Myriam se dedica a la venta de productos ORIFLAME (Cosméticos, Perfumes, Collares, Aretes, entre otros), con la finalidad de generar otro ingreso se dedica también a ser operadora en una empresa de taxis (consiste en recepcionar llamadas y dirigir a los taxistas a zonas donde clientes solicitan sus servicios). Ella conocía ya del negocio de venta de cosméticos y le entusiasmó mucho la idea de negocio, ella le vende a sus amigas y conocidos, también le agrada muchísimo conocer a gente nueva.  En un día Myriam puede ganar 38 soles  que junto a las ganancias de su esposo le permiten poder pagar lo básico para su familia. Actualmente desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarla para poder comprar productos ORIFLAME que se encuentran en oferta por acercase Navidad.

Esta mejora podrá ayudarle a tener nuevos productos que ofrecer y así poder en algunos meses tener muchos más clientes que le permitan ganar mucho más y esto la ayudará a cumplir su gran sueño: "Quiero ser gerente de mi zona vendiendo a muchos más clientes y también deseo que mis hijos sean exitosos profesionales".
texts.en:
Myriam is 37 years old, and she is married.  Her husband provides public transportation with a taxi.  They have two children.  The little one is barely two years old, and the 15 year old goes to high school.

Myriam sells Oriflame products (cosmetics, perfume, necklaces, and earrings, among others).  In order to generate another income she also works as an operator at a taxi company (consists of taking calls and directing the taxi drivers to the area where customers request their services).

She already knew the business of selling cosmetics, and she was very enthusiastic about the idea.  She sells to her friends and acquaintances.  It also gives her great pleasure to meet new people.  Myriam is able to earn 38 soles a day.  Together with her husband’s earnings they are able to pay for their family’s basics.

She currently wishes that the Kiva lenders are able to help her buy Oriflame products that are now a special offer because Christmas is coming.  This improvement will help her to have new products to sell.  That way she will be able to have a lot more customers in a few months.  This will allow her to earn a lot more.  It will help her fulfill her big dream, “I want to be the manager in my zone, selling to a lot more customers.  I also wish for my children to become successful professionals.”

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfume, necklaces, and earrings, among others.

loans.name: Roeurn

texts.en:
Roeurn, 33, is married and resides with her husband, three children, and an elderly mother in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are construction workers. 

Roeurn is requesting a loan of 1200 U.S. dollars (USD) to purchase wood to build a new house. By doing so, she will have a convenient house in which to stay. In the future, she would like to send her children to a mechanic training center and support them in studying higher.

loans.use: To purchase wood to build a new house.

loans.name: De Peddlers Group

texts.en:
Kadie is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadie was born in the village of Rosinte about 37 years ago. She is married to a driver and the couple has five children – two in primary school and two in secondary. Kadie sells firewood, oranges, cassavas, etc. Kadie has been doing business for many years now.
 
With the help of this loan, Kadie and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Kadie will use her share of the loan (400,000 SLL) to buy firewood and oranges in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood and oranges in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Gloria pertenece al banco comunal "MAMACHA ASUNTA DE CALCA"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Calca perteneciente al departamento de Cusco, a una hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 22 años de edad y es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 11 meses de edad; la socia se dedica  la compra y venta de productos de belleza, ella vende por catalogos, la socia tambien se dedica  la agricultura ella siembra y cosecha maíz, la socia en esta ocasión desea el prestamo para invertir en la compra de maíz para sembrar y luego abonar.

La socia agradece el prestamo y se compromete a cumplir conel pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The member Gloria belongs to the communal bank "Mamacha asunta de Calca"; The bank is located in the province of Calca, which is located in the division of Cusco, one hour from the city of Cusco.

The member is 22 years old, is living with her partner and has one child, age 11 months. The member buys and sells beauty products for a living. She sells by catalogs. The member also plants and harvests corn for a living. On this occasion she desires a loan to invest in the purchase of corn to plant and later fertilize. She appreciates the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule and the timeline established.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of corn to plant and later fertilize.

loans.name: Burenbuyan

texts.en: Burenbuyan, 34 is an accountant with a private company and has been working for 5 years. She lives with her husband and her daughter in a slum suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband, Gurvanbaatar, has run a taxi service for the last several years. Lately his taxi has broken down and is in need of repair. Therefore he decided to renovate his car with the new spare-parts. The loan Burenbuyan is taking will be dedicated to purchase the new spare-parts for her husband’s taxi.

loans.use: To purchase new spare-parts for her husband’s taxi repairs.

loans.name: Anny

texts.en:
My name is Anny and I sell clothes for adults and for children, I have had my business for five years, with which I have been able to care for my two children who are school-aged. I make my sales by commission, I visit offices and neighbors who buy what they need from me, and commission me to sell them other items.

Loan Use: Purchase blouses, pants, T-shirts, socks, shorts, for adults and children.

Me llamo Anny y me dedico a la venta de ropa para adulto y niño, tengo cinco años de tener mi negocio con el que he logrado mantener a mis dos hijos que estan en edad escolar. Mis ventas las hago por encargo, visito oficinas y vecinos quienes me comprar lo que necesitan y me hacen encargos de otros productos.

loans.use: Compra de camisas, pantalones, camisetas, calcetines, short, para adulto y niño.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pais would like to buy six more steers

loans.name: Ioe

texts.en: Ioe S. owns a small grocery shop in a Samoan village.  Her husband works at one of the supermarkets in the capital. Their combined income at present allows them to send their seven children to school.  Ioe strategically opened her shop near the river because that is where villagers gather.  She has used previous microloans to finance the expanding of her inventory. She is currently seeking additional loan funds to use in a similar fashion.  Her dream is to be able to provide her children with the means for future success. She hopes that the growth in her revenue will be enough to finance a university education for all of her seven children.

loans.use: to re-stock her shop

loans.name: Shirinali

texts.en: S. Shirinali lives in Fatalikend village in Saatli. He is 39 years old, is married and has 5 children. He runs a small business of one milk cow and a calf. These cattle were enough to cover necessary family needs. He is going to broaden his farm and purchase one more milk cow and will begin selling the milk to local people.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow

loans.name: Shahbeyim

texts.en: Shahbeyim J. lives in Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan. She is married and has three children. She owns a small booth in Beylagan city bazaar and engages in clothing sales. She mostly sells children clothes. She established her business ten years ago. She purchases the clothes from an airport trading center in Baku. She needs $600 to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Wafika

texts.en:
Wafika is a 51-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in the area of Hay El Sillum, a very poor neighborhood of the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. Wafika has a shop in which she sells bottles of water. She also offers water delivery services in her neighborhood. She is requesting a loan of  $1000 to pay the yearly mechanic fees due for the minivan she uses water delivery. If she does not pay this tax, the minivan may be confiscated by the police. 
Wafika has received loans from Majmoua for the past four years. With the consecutive loans she received from the Institution, she was able to expand her business, generate more revenues and proudly raise her kids. She has an excellent history of on-time repayment.

loans.use: To pay the yearly mechanic tax for the minivan she uses in her business

loans.name: Assiba Amélé

texts.fr:
Ms. Assiba Amélé G. was born October 31st, 1971 in Lomé. Trained as a judge, she also supports herself with secondary activities such as trade. She lives in Djidjolé neighborhood and is seeking a $1000 loan to extend her retail activities buying and selling products imported from France.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Mademoiselle Assiba Amélé G. est née le 31 octobre 1971 à Lomé. Juriste de formation, elle fait aussi d’autres activités parallèles comme le commerce. Elle habite à Djidjolé et sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour l’extension de ses activités d’achat et vente des produits divers qu’on lui envoie de la France.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of retail goods

loans.name: Marina's Group

texts.es:
Clementina, Marina, and Cleofé have been partners of “Banco Comunal Muyurina” (Communal Bank Muyurina) for 4, 1, and 4 years respectively.

Doña Clementina is 54 years old and has 8 children. She sells vegetables at the market “Nery García”, but she also grows different crops on her land, such as Chinese onion, cilantro, and spinach, among others.

Marina is 30 years old and has 3 children. She owns a beauty parlor and sells cosmetics and jewelry.

Cleofé is 35 years old and has 4 children. She is a farmer and grows different vegetables depending on the season and the demands. Her products are sold at the market “Nery García”.

Clementina, Marina, and Cleofé request loans of 1000 soles, 1000 soles, and 600 soles ($900.00) which will be invested in buying vegetable seeds, fertilizer, incecticides, shampoo, earrings, hairpins, perfumes, and colognes.

The savings will be used to purchase more land, for the education of their children, and to increase their business capital.

The dream of Clementina, Marina, and Cleofé is to build their house, improve business, buy a vehicle, and proviD. better education for their children so they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Stlruck, Kiva volunteer.

Clementita, Marina y Cleofé son socias del Banco Comunal Muyurina hace 4, 1, 4 años respectivamente. Clementina tiene 54 años y 8 hijos, y venD. verduras en el mercado Nery García, pero además D. vender verduras, también siembra en sus chacras diferentes verduras como cebolla china, culantro, espinaca, entre otros. Marina tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Marina tiene un salón D. belleza y venD. cosméticos y joyas. Cleofé tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, es agricultora, siembra diferentes verduras dependiendo la época y la demanda. Las ventas D. sus productos son realizadas en el mercado Nery García. Clementita, Marina y Cleofé necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 1000 soles y 600 soles, que serán invertidos en la compra D. semillas D. verduras, abono, insecticidas, champú, aretes, ganchos, perfumes, colonias. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para comprar más chacras, para la educación D. sus hijos, aumentar el capital D. su negocio. Los sueños D. Clementita, Marina y Cleofe son construir su casa, mejorar su negocio, comprar un carro, mejor educación para sus hijos y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, shampoo, earrings, hairpins, perfumes, and colognes.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
I am Shamim A., wife of Habib Saqib. I live with my family in the small town of Borewala, Pakistan. My loan group and I are borrowing for the first time. My husband runs a pharmacy and we need a loan to buy medicines to sell. This is a small town and there are not many pharmacies here, so business is good.

I am also requesting help for the members of my group, all of whom are mutually responsible for each other's loans. Jinda B. wants a loan for her laundry. Yasmeen B. needs a loan for her pet shop. Zarina B. sells milk for a living, and needs a loan to buy more supplies to sell. Zulakhan B.’s husband runs a grocery store which needs new inventory. Arshad B. manufactures bicycle seats and needs the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: Buy medicines for a pharmacy and other items for various small businesses

loans.name: Nevzeta

texts.en: Nevzeta lives in Gornja, Zenica with her husband and 2 children, 22 and 28 years old. She is 51 years old. This is her second loan of 1000KM and she is going to use it to buy stock and animal feed. She hopes that she will improve her household and monthly income.

loans.use: Buying stock and animal feed.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa is a member of Banco Comunal Las Margaritas, and is located at Jr Pachitea 785, in the Callería district of Ucayali. She is 55 years old, has 6 children and her husband is a farmer. Ninfa invested her first $100 loan from Manuela Ramos in a shop selling food.

She now has a grocery shop and also sells food at night. She starts her day at 6am to prepare breakfast for her family, after which she works at her shop, selling clothes. She then prepares and sells food from 6pm until 10pm, with the support of her children.

With this next loan of $550, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, a crate of milk, a crate of noodles, and provisions for preparing food, such as chicken, oil, eggs etc.

Ninfa is very happy because she can run her own business and has learned to see the value in herself. Her business is growing rapidly and her takings are increasing, to her and her family’s delight.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ninfa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Margaritas, ubicado en el Jr Pachitea No 785, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es agricultor. Ninfa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 decide invertirlo en el negocio de venta de comidas.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega de venta de abarrotes y también con el negocio de venta de comidas en la noche, se levanta a las 6am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la venta de sus ropas y paralelo a ello con la ayuda de sus hijos prepara y vende sus comidas a partir de las 6pm hasta las 10pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de leche, 1 caja de fideos, y víveres para la preparación de sus comida como: pollo, aceite, huevo, etc.

Ninfa esta muy feliz, porque puede manejar su negocio y aprendió a valerse por si misma , su negocio esta mejorando rápidamente, aumentando sus ingresos, para satisfacción de ella y de su familia.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar etc. for her shop

loans.name: Melvin Alonso

texts.es:
This client, Melvin, is asking for a third credit refinance in order to invest in home improvements (Plastering and placing a floor in the kitchen). He works for the National Farmer’s Union, he also cultivates at his mother’s finca on the weekends, as he is a hard-working and responsible man who has worked in the fields and is from a peasant family, and in this way he obtains basic foodstuffs which provide additional help to support his income. His family is composed of two children: the elder son is 14 years old and studying the first year of secondary school and the younger daughter is 12 years old and studying in the sixth grade of primary school: his wife works as a volunteer in a community childcare centre, caring for children from deprived backgrounds. His dream is to have a home with all the comforts that her family merits, and that his children study so that in the future they become excellent professionals and have job security.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El cliente Melvin está solicitando un 3er refinanciamiento de crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Repellar y echarle el piso a la cocina), Trabaja para Unión Nacional de Agricultores y Ganaderos, también se dedica a cultivar en la finca de su mamá los fines de semana, ya que ha sido un hombre trabajador y responsable que ha trabajado en el campo y es de origen de familia campesina y de esta forma obtener los alimentos básicos como apoyo a los ingresos que el obtiene; su familia esta compuesta por dos hijos, el hijo mayor de 14 años estudia 1 er año de educación secundaria y la niña menor de 12 años estudia 6to grado de educación primaria, su esposa trabaja como voluntaria en un centro Infantil comunitario cuidando niños de escasos recursos económicos, su sueño es tener una vivienda con todas las condiciones que la familia amerita, y que sus hijos estudien para que el futuro lleguen a ser excelentes profesionales y tener estabilidad laboral.

loans.use: Home improvements, placing floor in the kitchen

loans.name: Blanca Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica is the mother of 2 children, 7 and 3 years old. Her husband works in a warehouse. She started her business because she needed to help with the family expenses and help her children to get ahead. For this reason she decided to sell shoes by catalog, starting with a few orders. Later her sales began to increase because she offers payment plans in installments, which is why people look to buy from her.

She now needs a loan of US$ 600, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise. She would like to invest her earnings in another activity such as jewelry sales, so that she can take advantage of her customer base and have more earnings. With your help this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Veronica es madre de familia de 2 niños de 7 y 3 años, su esposo trabaja como almacenista. Inició el negocio porque necesitaba apoyar con los gastos familiares y sobresalir con sus hijo, por eso es que se decidió por la venta de zapatos por catalogo, con pocos pedidos para después ir incrementando sus ventas, esto ha sido ha que da plazos para que le paguen por lo que la gente la busca para comprar con ella.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia, ella desea invertir las ganancias en otra actividad, la venta de joyeria ya que puede aprovechar la cartera de clientes que ya tiene vendiendoles ahora joyeria y asi tener mas ganancias. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Hit Kaing Group

texts.en: Five people in Kol Kup Village in Kampong Chhnang Province form a borrowers' group, and Mrs. Hit K. is the group leader. She owns a small piece of land and her soil is now infertile. Therefore, she has asked for a loan to buy more fertilizer to support her field, in order to obtain a better crop. Mrs. Hit K. is 52 and the mother of three children, all of whom are employed in a garment factory. Previously, Mrs. Hit K. obtained another loan from AMK to buy fertilizer for her field.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to support her field in order to obtain a better crop

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda has been selling beer out of her house for the past two years. She also attended cooking school and had been preparing desserts for past three years. However, she had to put this activity on hold because she works everyday as a chef in a restaurant.

The loans have helped expand her beer business. She purchased a freezer and was able to finish paying it off.

Esmeralda would like to have a glass display case with desserts outside of her house. She would have her sister tend it while she works.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer

Esmeralda vende cerveza en su casa desde hace 2 años. Asimismo, ella estudió gastronomía, por lo que se dedica a preparar postres desde hace 3 años. Sin embargo, ha dejado por el momento esta actividad, debido a que trabaja todos los días en un restaurante como chef. Los préstamos le han servido para incrementar su negocio de venta de cerveza. Asimismo ella se compró una congeladora, por lo que le ha servido para terminar de pagarla. A Esmeralda le gustaría tener una vitrina con postres afuera de su casa y dejarle a su hermana el negocio, mientras ella trabaja.

loans.use: To expand her beer business.

loans.name: Marling Benita

texts.es:
Mrs. R. A. is 45 years old, she is single and has no children, sells underwear and shoes from home to home, her goal is to have a store so she can stop offering her merchandise from place to place, her wish is to be able to improve her economic situation and be able to buy one day her own house because she is currently leaving with her mother. With the loan she is requesting she wants to get more merchandise to be ready for Christmas sales, as September is so close to December; Mrs. R. has 22 years selling merchandise, this activity is an alternative to unemployment and lack of academic studies because she didn’t have the economic resources to study, so this activity is her source of income.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora R. A., tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera no tiene hijos, se dedica al comercio de ropa interior femenina y masculina, calzado en general de forma ambulante, su proposito es poder llegar a tener un local fijo donde establecer su negocio y dejar de andar ofreciendo su mercaderia de forma ambulante, su deseo es poder superarse economicamente y cumplir su mayor sueño que es poder adquirir su propia vivienda ya que donde habita es de su señora madre. Con el financiamiento pretende adquirir mas mercaderia aprovechando la oportunidad que ofrece el mercado dado la temporada del mes de septiembre estando proximo al mes de diciembre; la señora tiene 22 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercaderia teniendo esta actividad como una alternativa al desempleo y a la falta de preparacion academica de la cual carece por no haber tenido el apoyo ni los recursos necesarios para lograrlo, constituyendose esta actividad en su fuente de ingresos.

loans.use: Working Capital / CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham A. is a 40-year-old man who lives in an Internally Displaced People settlement, Bilasuvar. He is married and has 2 children; they are studying at school. He learned his profession as a cattle farmer from his father when he was 17. After he got married, he continued working in the same business.

Ilham was quite successful in his business but as prices for everything are increasing and selling calves is still the only financial source in this family, it is very hard to keep his family in normal conditions. The only way to improve his life is to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 1000 USD to purchase an additional cow for dairy sales and two calves. He believe one day he could pass on all his experience and knowledge to his son so he could continue the family business, but Ilham is doing everything possible now to not allow his son to face the difficulties Ilham has now.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow for dairy sales and two calves

loans.name: Rahel F.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Rahel F. Mwasbeja from Tukuyu. Married with two children aged seven and nine,. she is also responsible for supporting two orphans whose parents died of HIV, as well as her brother’s children. Rahel has been operating a video business since 2001, working 12 hours per day, 7 days per week, assisted by her husband.

Rahel currently earns about $40 per month from her business and is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy some screens so that she can start showing videos as well. In the future, she plans to open a theater for showing films. Rahel thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy some video screens so that she can start showing videos.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel tiene 48 años, vive solo porque no tienes esposa ni hijos. Samuel se dedica a la fabricación de artesanías para vender a los turistas que llegan de visita a la Isla Tata Kily del Lago Titicaca. Al ser soltero se dedica netamente al trabajo, ha inventado una variedad de souvenirs para los turistas que demandan mucho de sus invenciones, vendiendo además aves disecadas oriundas de la zona. A Samuel le gusta mucho crear, es por eso que es muy paciente y detallista con sus  creaciones, pero muchas veces no dispone del material necesario para realizar lo que el dibuja en su mente. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero comprará material para el relleno de sus aves disecadas, entre otros materiales para poder generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Samuel is 48 years old and lives alone because he is unmarried and does not have children. Samuel makes artisan pieces to sell to the tourists that arrive to visit the Tata Kily Island at Lake Titicaca. Being single he totally focuses on his work, he has created a variety of souvenirs for the tourists who demand many of his inventions; in addition he sells taxidermied birds of the area. Samuel likes to create, he is very patient and pays attention to detail in his work, but many times he doesn’t have the necessary materials to make the products he sees in his mind. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money he will buy taxidermy materials to stuff his birds among other materials to be able to generate greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make artisan objects

loans.name: Khaladdin

texts.en: Khaladdin S. is 48 years old and married with three children. Thirteen years ago, he started his business of raising sheep. His primary business is with the local restaurants. As mutton is very popular among Azerbaijani people, this business can bring stable income. Khaladdin works as a farmer to help with the harvest. Despite having two jobs, his business is still quite small and doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Khaladdin would like to request a loan to expand his business. He will use the profit generated by the business to repay the loan on time. Khaladdin is asking for a loan of 1200 USD in order to buy more sheep to raise. He thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: Purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Sothim's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothim V. is a group leader of five women who all live in Phum Por village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Nim Savy, is a fisherman. He now faces a small problem because he does not have enough fishnets for his fishing. Thus, Mrs. Sothim V. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband's business. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 28 years old and a mother of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is seven months old.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so.
