Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK (Kiva's Field Partner) has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets for her husband's business.

loans.name: Bashiran Majeed Masih Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is a 46-year-old married lady and has resided in a city named Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 25 years. Her husband's name is M. M. and he has an animal food selling business. He has been in this business for the past 15 years.

She is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. Her sons are also involved in their father’s business. Her daughter is 12 years old and stays at home and does household work. Bashiran baji is involved in a milk selling business. She has a buffalo at her house and gets milk from her by getting up early in the morning. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband. She successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy animal food to resell.

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Fozia baji and Razia baji each want a loan to buy leather to resell. Wanaliat baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animal food to sell

loans.name: Livia,

texts.es:
A sus veintiún años Livia maneja un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza desde hace un año, con la finalidad de tener un ingreso adicional y poder apoyar en lo gastos de su casa. Livia es soltera y no tiene hijos, por lo que ahora esta enfocada no solo en crecer en su venta de negocio si no también en terminar sus estudios universitarios.
Actualmente, esta cursando el tercer año de su carrera de educación primaria, gracias a estos estudios ha podido obtener un puesto de trabajo en un colegio cerca de su casa. En el futuro ella solo desea dedicarse por completo a su profesión y crecer en la mercadería de su negocio.
Por otro lado, ella integra un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras,  por medio del cual esta recibiendo talleres de bisutería y de bordados.
texts.en:
Twenty-one-year-old Livia has been running a small beauty product business for a year so that she can earn extra income and help out with the household expenses. Livia is single and has no children, which is why she is now focusing not only on making her business grow, but also on finishing her university studies.

She is currently in her third year of her major: primary education. Thanks to her education, she has been able to obtain a job at a school near her house. In the future, she hopes to fully dedicated herself to her career and increase her business’ inventory.

Additionally, she is part of a group of enterprising women, through which she is receiving training in making costume jewelry and embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beauty products

loans.name: Mounira

texts.en:
Mounira is a 52-year-old widow who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon. She has been working as a seamstress for eight years. She sews at home and also cooks when she is asked to. Mounira requested a loan of $500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her sewing and some raw materials for her cooking. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time.

Mounira is special in her work because she does it well and has experience. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When Mounira first started her business, she didn’t have enough money. She decided on doing her business because of her experience and her precise work. In the future, she plans on expanding her sewing business and opening a restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase thread for her sewing and some raw materials for her cooking.

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.es: A la vivienda del señor Epifanio M. le está haciendo falta las protecciones en ventanas y puertas pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar acabo la mejora. Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar y colocar las protecciones en la vivienda. Y así estará mas segura cuando el estén en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Epifanio Martinez's home lacks safety devices on its windows and doors but he is currently in need of financial help in order to install them. He is asking for a loan to pay the person who will install such devices on his home thereby keeping it safe while he is at work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install safety devices on his home.

loans.name: Laulaau

texts.en: Laulaau L. L. is 57 years old and married with seven children. She sells biscuits seven days per week, and has many years of experience in this line of business. She has no previous loans with Kiva partner, SPBD. Laulaau expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 WST. SPBD loans are Laulaau’s only access to capital because she has never qualified for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, yeast and coconuts

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for five borrowers who live in the province of Kampong Chhnang, Cambodia. Mr. Kong S., age 47, has been selected to be group leader by the other members.

Mr. S. currently earns a living by making furniture. He sells his products to buyers who come to order at his house. He makes products like nets, traps, baskets and those made from bamboo. His wife, who is a good housewife, cares for three teenage children and sometime works with him in making tools. Two of their children are working in Thailand as construction workers.

Mr. S. plans to use half the loan to buy bamboo to make furniture and half of the loan to buy a piglet to raise.

The other four borrowers are:
Mrs. K. is a furniture maker, who is looking for a loan to purchase zinc to cover the roof of her house.
Mrs. L. is requesting a loan to buy raw material to support her business making baskets.
Mrs. L. makes fishing tools for sale and she needs for a loan to purchase farmland to grow a rice crop.
Mrs. P. is a local furniture maker who requests a loan to purchase bamboo.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to make furniture with

loans.name: Bujwaha Ntegega Rosemary Group

texts.en: N. Rosemary is 26 years old. She is a married lady with three children who all go to school. She has been operating her business of selling used clothes for over 3 years. She will use this loan to purchase used clothing to sell. Her dream is to work hard and construct a residential house.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tto buy more crops for her business

loans.name: Vilma Salome

texts.es:
La señora Vilma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Poderosas de Santa Rosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 49 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 09 hijos (todos dependientes de ella)  y tiene estudios  de secundaria incompleta,  vive en el Barrio Panca Quia.

Inicia su trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi medio año, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado menor para engorde

Ahora ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de carneros para engorde y luego los venderá en los días de ferias de la zona.  Los días domingos se dedica a la venta de Pan.

Su deseo es formar un establo de ganado menor y mayor mejorado.

A ella le gusta la garantía solidaria, y su forma de trabajo.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the Las Poderosas de Santa Rosa Community Bank, which is located in the Azangaro district, Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 49, married, and has nine dependent children. She went to high school, but did not finish. She lives in the Panca Quia neighborhood. She started working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos about half of a year ago. She used her initial loan of 300 PEN to buy small life stock to fatten. She now needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy sheep to fatten. She will then sell them on the days the fair is held in her zone. On Sundays she sells bread. Her wish is to set up a large, improved stable for small and large live stock. She likes the warranty of solidarity and the way they work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep to fatten

loans.name: July

texts.es:
July es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita. 
July es madre soltera tiene 30 años, una hija de 8 años que estudia en la escuela estatal.
July  estudio contabilidad  en el instituto Gilda y termino decidió poner un negocio de venta de lubricantes  pero no le fue bien por que daba mucho crédito, traspaso su negocio a otra persona.
Nuevamente decidió poner un negocio esta vez con su hermana, de venta de carne de res  y  vacuno actualmente tienen cuatro años vendiendo. 
Desde que July esta en Finca los préstamos han sido de mucha ayuda para capitalizarse, siente que es un respaldo.   
July necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles para la compra de carne de res de carnero. 
El sueño de July es comprar un puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
July is a member of the Melcochita cooperative bank. July is a 30-year old single mother, and has one daughter who is 8 years old and in public school. July completed her accounting studies at the Gilda Institute. She decided to start a business selling lubricants, but it did not go well for her because she gave out too much credit. She transferred her business to someone else. She decided to start another business selling beef, in partnership with her sister, which she has been doing for four years. Since July has been with Finca, the loans have been a great help in capitalizing her business and a great support. July needs a loan of 3,000 soles to buy meat. July’s dream is to buy a stall at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela vive en la c/ J. Choquehuanca de la zona Villa Nueva Potosi en la ciudad de La Paz, 
 
La señora vive junto a sus hijos y se dedica a la venta de hortalizas, por las distintas ferias que se realizan en la zona de Calacoto

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, cuenta con un pequeño capital de trabajo con el cual tiene  mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Marcela lives on J. Choquehuanca Street, in the Villa Nueva Potosi area in the city of La Paz. She lives with her children and sells vegetables in the various street markets in the area of Calacoto. Thanks to previously granted loans, she has a small amount of business capital, which has enabled her to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda U. is from the city of Aloran. She is 31 years old. Linda is married. To make a living, Linda owns & operates a "sari-sari" store business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Linda has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.In 2009, Linda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14900 PHP from PMPC. Linda is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell & to renovate her general store for expansion. This loan will be the  15th loan taken out by Linda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell & to renovate her general store for expansion

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años y es madre de 3 hijos, todos independientes..

Juanita se dedica a la venta de Refrigerios y se inició con S/. 300.00 y fue por iniciativa propia quien decidió emprender su negocio y empezó vendiendo refrigerios en un Colegio, cerca de su casa.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, cuenta con un Kiosco especialmente acondicionado, dentro del Colegio; donde vende comidas preparadas como juanes, tamalitos, arroz chaufa, arroz con pollo; dulces y golosinas; chifles, canchitas y en bebidas gaseosas, refrescos y jugos.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y le va muy bien, sus principales clientes, son los alumnos y docentes.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de refrigerios. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Doña Juana is a member of "Banco Comunal "Las Orquídeas", District of Tarapoto, province of San Martin, Department of San Martin. She is married, 44 years old and the mother of 3 children, all independent.

Juanita sells refreshments for a living, she started with S/.300.00 and on her own iniciative she decided to set up her business and started sales at a school close to her house.

Presently she sells from a specially conditioned stand inside the school where she also sells food such as "juanes", tamales, fried rice, chicken rice, candy and sweets, snacks, popcorn and pops, soft drinks and juice. She is doing very well with the business, her main customers are students and teachers.

With this loan of S/.2,500.00 she will buy supplies such as sacks of rice and sugar, "javas" of chickens and eggs, bunches of bananas, noodles, and cooking oil by the dozen, as well as kitchen utensils in order to offer better service.

She feels a lot of energy to continue selling her refreshments. She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to fulfill her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to prepare refreshments.

loans.name: Jose Ausberto

texts.es:
el señor Jose A. M. tiene 53 años de edad, el tiene un taxi, su punto para recoger personas es en el mall las Cascadas de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, el tiene un permiso para trabajar en ese lugar y pertenece a una asociacion de taxis llamada ASCAMUNT, son mas de 20 socios, el objetivo es darles transporte a muchas personas que visitan dicho mall, tambien tienen contratos con personas que trabajan en dicho mall, los llevan en horas de entrada y salida de sus trabajos.
Jose es casado y tiene 4 hijos.
ahora necesita el dinero para poder reparar el motor del taxi, ya que empieza a darle problemas.
su meta es comprar varias unidades de taxi y asi poder defenderse en un futuro.

loans.use: repuestos para reparar motor del taxi

loans.name: Eduardo Rey

texts.es:
Eduardo Rey G. G. es un señor de 34 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y su pequeña hija de tres meses en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Don Eduardo se ha dedicado desde muy joven a la ganadería, especialmente le saca provecho al ganado para engorde, ya que es una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Dice estar muy contento porque gracias a este proyecto ha podido salir adelante.

Don Eduardo desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢685.000 (seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar más vacas y así aumentar la producción. El sabe que contar con más vacas es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo; pero dice que así podrá mejorar y fortalecer más su proyecto y así llegará a ser un microempresario exitoso y poder ofrecerle una calidad de vida mejor para su esposa y para ofrecerle un buen futuro a su hija.

Don Eduardo es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Eduardo Rey G. G. is 34 years old who lives with his wife and small three-month-old daughter in a community called Santa Fe, located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community is known for being a mountainous region and for being very close to the northern border of the country. Its main economic activities are raising livestock and agriculture, growing specifically grains, sugar cane and oranges. Since his youth, Don Eduardo has raised livestock, specifically benefitting from fattening cattle, as a way to bring an income to his family. He says he is very happy because he has been able to make a successful living thanks to this project. Don Eduardo would like to obtain a microloan of ¢685 colones ($1,200) in order to buy more cattle and thus increase production. He knows that increasing his number of cows is a sacrifice that will demand more of his time, but with them he will be able to further improve and strengthen his project and develop a successful small business and be able to offer a better quality of life for his wife and a good future for his daughter. Don Eduardo a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, one of the 100 member organizationes of EDESA in Costa Rica. This would be his first loan, and with it he hopes to grow on both the personal and economic levels. He also points out that, thanks to these kinds of organizations and creditors, he can dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cattle for fattening

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is forty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works to help her husband financially to provide for the family. Lydia is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice with stew. She sells by the road side in the afternoons. She procures the goods from nearby towns. Lydia has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful of giving her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other cooking ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Relia

texts.es: La señora Relia es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región  D. Ucayali, tiene 52 años, es madre D. cuatro hijos mayores D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza y cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que trabaja como mecánico D. motores y soldador. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Carmen Cabrejos” desD. hace nueve años. El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles, este préstamo le permitió invertir en la compra D. cosméticos. En la actualidad requiere un préstamo D. 2000 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos D. belleza como perfumes, talcos, cremas, maquillaje y vender a sus clientes y amigos. La meta D. Relia  es culminar sus estudios y  tener una tienda D. prendas D. vestir y productos D. belleza para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Sra. Relia is an enterprising and dynamic woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 52 years old and the mother of four adult children. She sells beauty products and has the support of her husband, who works as a mechanic and welder.

Relia became a member of the Carmen Cabrejos Communal Bank nine years ago. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to purchase cosmetics. She currently needs a loan of 2000 soles to purchase beauty products such as perfumes, talcum powders, crèmes, and makeup to sell her customers and friends. Relia’s goal is to finish her studies and open a store where she sells dress clothes and beauty products for women, men, and children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: To earn a living, Fatima sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers in the market. She hopes to sell her foodstuffs at wholesale prices in the future. She hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is 35 years old and married with 4 children. Her husband is a government worker. Her eldest child is 20 years old. She is a focused, hard worker. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa P. con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio de salón de belleza el que posee en el departamento de Estelí específicamente en el municipio de Condega donde a diario ofrece su servicio estando abierto el establecimiento desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta por las noches.

Luego que ella sale del bachillerato, tenía la vocación de ser estilista y estudió varios cursos hasta llegar a poner su propio negocio el que ha mantenido desde entonces ya que ella es una de los primeras estilista de este Municipio lo que le favorece en tener su propia clientela

Realiza cortes de cabello a todas las personas, así como  peinados, tintes de cabello, etc. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de los productos de belleza como son peines, gelatinas, tintes, cremas, entre otros productos que le ayudaran a mejorar las condiciones de su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa P. works hard at improving her beauty salon, which is located in the town of Condega in the department of Estelí. She offers her services every day and is open from early in the morning until nightfall.

After completing high school, Rosa chose to become a stylist as her vocation and took different courses until she could establish her own business. Being one of the first stylists in the city gave her an advantage in building up her clientele.

Rosa provides haircuts to everyone, as well as other services such as styling, coloring, etc. This loan will be used to purchase beauty products and supplies such as combs, gels, dyes, creams, and other items that will help improve the condition of her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & supplies

loans.name: William Oswaldo

texts.es: William Oswaldo es soltero, se desempeña como docente de secundaria en la Escuela Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell desde hace varios años, como aun no se ha casado vive con sus ancianos padres y un hermano a quienes les ayuda con los gastos del hogar,  actualmente este cliente esta cursando su ultimo semestre de la Carrera ciencias de la Educacion en la Universidad URACCAN y es el presidente estudiantil de la universidad,  el se ha caracterizado por ser un joven alegre, amistoso, responsable y de muchos deseos de superacion personal y profesional. Esta solicitando  su 4to refinanciamiento para invertirlo en la construccion de una habitacion y asi tener mayor privacidad, el se siente agradecido con AFODENIC ya que con los créditos anteriores ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y comprar sus electrodomésticos, el aspira para este proximo año estudiar un post grado para vivir actualizado con sus estudios, su sueño es tener trabajo para que a su familia no le falte nada y salud.
texts.en:
For several years, William Oswaldo has worked as a high school teacher at the Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell School. He's not married, so he lives with his elderly parents and his brother, and helps them with household expenses. William is in his final semester of the Science Education program at URACCAN University. He's also the student body president. William is known as a happy, friendly, responsible, highly motivated student. This is his fourth loan, and he'll use it to create a room for himself in his parents' home, where he can have more privacy. William is grateful to AFODENIC because his previous loans have allowed him to afford home appliances and improve his family's living conditions. Next year he plans to begin graduate studies, and he hopes that by earning a good living, he'll be able to take care of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more commodities for her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and married with four children, ages 8, 9, 10, and 12, and all of the children are attending school. He is a dairy farmer in the Nkubu area near Mount Kenya. He's been in this business for 15 years and sells fine beans, bananas, and milk to local brokers. Previously, he worked as the middle-man, buying bananas from farms and selling them in Nairobi. He says that the main challenge to his business are diseases that affect the dairy cow.

He has successfully repaid two previous loans through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 20,000 and 45,000 and requested this loan for Kes. 70,000 to purchase a dairy cow. John says that the dairy cow will provide milk for his children to drink as well as income to help him provide an education for his children. In the future, he would like to expand his dairy farming with a better cow shed.

John added that loans from Juhudi have really helped because he has gotten both income and manure for his farm from the dairy cows.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is an innovative, for-profit social enterprise working with smallholder farmers in Kenya. Juhudi directly finances dairy cows, chickens, agricultural equipment, and other assets that are specifically chosen to create immediate cash flow. Many of the assets are insured to prevent devastating business losses, and targeted technical assistance is provided to farmers, from agricultural training to basic bookkeeping and local market research. For its clients and their families, Juhudi also offers life insurance and a medical aid program. Through all these services, Juhudi is creating sustainable growth and employment in rural communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario, es una mujer muy responsable, vive en el Distrito D. Calleria, región  Ucayali, tiene 51 años, es madre D. tres hijos y dos dependen D. su cuidado, ella se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, esta actividad la realiza en su casa y también D. manera ambulante, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que trabaja en la Municipalidad. Rosario forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres solidarias”, desD. hace 4 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra D. un tablero para golosinas, ahora ella necesita un crédito D. 1200 soles, que será invertido en la compra D. productos D. plástico como: jarros, baldes, bandejas, vasos, etc.
La meta D. Rosario es tener una pequeña tienda donD. pueda vender diversos productos.
texts.en:
Rosario is a very responsible woman. She lives in the District of Calleria, Ucayali region. She is 51 years old and the mother of three children, two of which depend on her for their care. She is dedicated to the sale of cosmetics. She carries out this activity in house house and also door to door. She counts on the support of her husband who works in the city hall. Rosario has been part of the "Supportive Women" Communal Bank for 4 years. The first loan that she received was of 300 soles, which was invested in the purchase of a showcase. Now she needs a credit of 1200 soles, that will be invested in the purchase of plastic products such as: pitchers, buckets, trays, glasses, etc. The goal of Rosary is to have a small store where she can sell diverse products.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic products such as pitchers, glasses, trays, etc for her store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther W. W. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and they have two children aged six years old and four months old whom they would wish to give good education someday. Her business is located at Mukuru kwa Njenga, Nairobi, Kenya. 

Her business is situated in a slum area but Esther is able to get many customers. It is well known by the name of Hunter Boutique. She has been selling men's and ladies' shoes, trousers, shirts, tops, handbags, and mattresses for the last nine years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge is lack of enough working capital. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Esther is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more shoes to grow her business. She has plans to open new shops and even move the one out of the slums and locate it by the highway. She is courageous, adventurous, and a risk taker.

loans.use: buying shoes to resell

loans.name: Kodir

texts.en:
M. Kodir has been running a grocery sales business for more than 10 years. He has plans to grow his business. Kodir aims to improve his business and establish a strong reputation in his neighborhood. His dream is to someday grow from a mini grocery store to a big one. Kodir says, "My objective is to progress in the business and in the future, transform this grocery store into something greater." He is asking for a loan of $2,600 USD to buy merchandise in bulk. Kodir is very grateful to everyone who is helping him achieve success in his business with this loan.      

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Leonil

texts.en: Leonil N. is from the village of San Miguel, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. He is 37 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Leonil owns and operates a business providing transport services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,400 PHP a month. In 2010, Leonil joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Leonil plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 23-year-old married man who lives in Chtoura, in the Bekaa. Five years ago, he decided to open a hairdressing salon since he had already learned hairdressing skills in his previous job. He had become a talented hairdresser and took the decision to work on his own. He opened his own salon and now receives customers from his region and its surroundings. 
Today, for the first time, Alaa is asking for a loan to buy additionA. supplies, such as hair gels, shaving soap, a new seat, a washbasin to wash hair, etc. In doing so, he hopes to expand his customer base and increase his business productivity and income. He also plans on making some changes to his salon's decor so that he can attract more clients. In the future, he plans to open a second barber shop.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing supplies and equipment

loans.name: Nirosha

texts.en:
Nirosha L. is a 33-year-old married woman living with her husband and daughter in Akurassa, Sri Lanka.

Nirosha and her husband work together producing colorful floor rugs, a business that they have been running for one year now. They are both very hard-working and have seen success because there is a strong market for their products. Their business is situated near to Akurassa town, so they have a good market for their rugs.

Nirosha is seeking a 25,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to develop her business further. With the loan, she plans to buy cloth and other materials necessary for producing these rugs.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for making rugs

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: At the age of 37, Romeo L. now has four school-aged children. His family lives in the village of San Jose. Romeo owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest. In 2006, Romeo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Romeo is requesting a new loan of 26,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his eighth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Kear

texts.en: Mrs. Kear H. is 46 years old and lives in Ream Andaeuk village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Mon Marng, are farmers who own two hectares of land to cultivate rice and cane for a living. For this farm, Mrs. Kear H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her crops. Aside from farming, Mrs. Kear H. is also a Khmer noodle seller in the local village. She earns a small income to support her family. This couple has five children. One of the children is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other four are students and also support their parent's businesses. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Oretan

texts.en:
Madame Oretan A. sells cereals out of her home in Hedzranawoe, Lome. She is 30 years old and married to a man who works as a machinist at the local beer and soda factory in Lome. They have one child. 

Madame A. has been working in this business since 2005. She normally purchases her merchandise at markets in the northern Togo and has asked for a loan of 250,000 Communauté Financière Africaine Francs to help make her purchases. This is her first time taking a loan from WAGES, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase corn, rice, and beans

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen K., who is 48 years old, has a business selling bags of maize flour, tomatoes, and peeled, dried cassava at the market. She requested a loan in order to stock bags of pulses (groundnuts, peas, cowpeas, etc.) to sell.

Hellen is widowed and has only a son who does not go to school. In the future, Hellen wants to see her son married.

loans.use: To stock bags of pulses to sell

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr:
Lucie Mukarytabana  est une fille de 28 ans, née à Kicukiro - Kigali, province de Kigali du Rwanda. Elle est célibataire, elle a habite a Kicukiro. son niveau d’éducation est primaire

Concernant son activité, elle est commerçante des produits des charbons  à Kigali, elle a une expérience de 5 ans dans ce domaine et. Le crédit contracté avec ACB est  son premier prêt.
Dans l’avenir, elle veut continuer ses études car elle a suspendu en troisième année secondaire par manque du minerval, elle pourra avoir une valeur et se marier ensuite.
texts.en:
Lucie Mukarytabana is a 28-year-old girl who was born in Kicukiro – Kigali, a province of Kigali in Rwanda. She is single and lives in Kicukiro. She has an elementary school education. She sells coal products in Kigali, which she has been doing for 5 years. The loan she has with ACB is her first. In the future, she’d like to continue her studies, because she stopped attending middle school due to lack of funds to pay the fees. She will thus have value and be able to marry.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 16 bags of coal to resell

loans.name: Sear

texts.en:
Mr. Sear S. is 24 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sreymao S., is 21 years old. She and her husband have been married since 2007 and have only one young daughter. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sear has been a fisherman for two years. He fishes from the river and lake near his house. His wife sells fish that her husband catches. He is asking for his first loan of US$ 400 to purchase a boat and fishing materials for his fishing business.  

Sear is not in the photo; he is replaced by his wife.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and fishing materials for his fishing business.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity S. is currently in the business of selling beer and local brew at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and purchase more brewing ingredients such as yeast, etc .  Charity is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a serviceman. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar at the market.

loans.use: stock more crates of beer and purchase more brewing ingredients such as yeast, etc.

loans.name: Rosemosin

texts.en:
Rosemosin Q. is from the village of Cabisera 27. He is 38 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately $350 per harvest.

In 2010, Rosemosin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Victor Rafael

texts.es:
Víctor Rafael D. León R. 
Víctor  es D. 22 años D. edad, casado, tiene una hija , es tejedor , actualmente se dedica como comerciante, en la actividad tiene 4  años D. experiencia, solicita su tercer crédito, para ampliación D. capital, las referencias personales y D. créditos anteriores indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora por lo que no tendrá dificultades para efectuar los pagos correspondientes.
texts.en: Víctor Rafael D. León R. is 22 years old, married, and has a daughter.  He is a weaver, but currently works as a merchant.  Victor has four years of experience and is requesting his third loan so that he can increase his capital.  His personal references and credit history indicate that he is a responsible and hardworking individual who will not have difficulty completing his payments.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & increase his capital

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a member of Provider Group of Faulu Kenya. He runs his business in an open space, where he makes tea, doughnuts, eggs and samosas. He has been in the business for four years and has managed to employ two people. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has been trained on how to keep business records. He hopes to have a stable business in the future. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a boiler and two kettles. In five years, he wants to own and run a hotel.

loans.use: To buy a boiler and two kettles

loans.name: Lilian Wambui

texts.en:
Lilian Wambui N. is 30 years old and she supports a family of three people. Her spouse is Kilas Kisento and he is employed. They have two children, aged 11 years and three years old.  Lilian operates a taxi Business in Narok town and she has been in this business for six years.

She learned about KADET LTD from a market awareness campaign done by KADET staffs in Narok town. This will be her first loan which she is planning to spend on buying some spare parts and servicing of her car.

With the anticipated profit from the business she plans to pay school fees for her children. Lilian dream is that she will own a fleet of cars and build a nice house.  She is a hard working woman with a great vision.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service her car.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 30 years old, and is in the mechanical engineering industry. He offers vehicle repair services in a very competitive area of Nairobi. 

He is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy spare parts for the lathe machine. His customers are motor vehicle owners and motor dealers. He was previously employed as a mechanic before starting his own business ten years ago. He hopes to buy more machines and open a large workshop in the future.  In five years, he believes he will have his own car. 

Since joining Faulu Kenya, he has become financially independent and he has learned how to save and live within his means.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for lathe machine

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is 46, and is married with 6 children. He lives in Nabatieh, in the south of Lebanon. He has worked as a taxi driver for 28 years and also provides school transportation for the locA. students.

Imad is asking for a loan of $2,500 to pay university fees for his children. He has had a previous loan with A. Majmoua and has always maintained an impeccable repayment history.

loans.use: To pay children's university fees.

loans.name: María Adoración

texts.es:
La Señora María C. es socia del banco comunal La Estancia, vive en la comunidad de la Estancia que pertenece al cantón Paute, este cantón se caracteriza por la belleza natural de sus paisajes, es de clima templado, en sus tierras se cultivan las mas hermosas flores, su gente es de un corazón muy calido y amable.

La Señora. María tiene  55 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos  de 42 y 37 años de edad quienes son casados y viven independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, gracias al trabajo y sacrificio del trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María se dedica a la cría de cuyes, pollos, vacas, cerdos, pavos, patos y muchos animales mas, actividad que realiza hace varios años, también se dedica a la agricultura  siembra hortalizas, todos sus productos y  los animales los vende en su propia comunidad.
 
Es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, fue incentivada por su vecina a ingresar al banco. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. Su sueño es conservar su salud.
texts.en:
Mrs. María C. is a member of the La Estancia communal bank.  She lives in Estancia which is in Paute canton.  This canton is characterized by the natural beauty of its scenery, its moderate climate.  Beautiful flowers are grown in its land and its people are warmhearted and kind.

María, 55, is married and has two children who are 42 and 37 years of age.  They are married and live independently.  Her husband’s a farmer and raises animals.  Thanks to the work and sacrifice of them as a couple they have managed to build their own house.

María raises guinea pigs, chicken, cows, pigs, turkeys, ducks and many other animals.  She’s been doing this for many years.  She also farms vegetables.  She sells all her farm produce and her animals in her own community.

This is the second loan she’s had with the communal bank.  She was motivated to join by a neighbor.  She will use the new loan to buy chicks and feed for them.  Her dream is to stay healthy.

loans.use: To buy chicks and food for them.

loans.name: Alma Iris

texts.es: Alma Iris es una joven que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación  su negocio es el servicio de taller de carpintería y una pulpería. Ella busco la forma de mejorar su medio de vida siempre la experiencia que ha obtenido con ambos negocios ha sido muy difícil pero con una buena administración han salido adelante. El motivo del financiamiento que solicitan es para la compra de materia prima para arroz, aceite, golosinas, frijoles y madera para la carpintería.
texts.en: Alma Iris is a young woman who has been working with Fundación Leon 2000 for quite some time. Her businesses are a carpentry workshop and a pulpería [small grocery store]. She is always looking for ways to improve her quality of life. The experience she has gained through both businesses has been difficult, but thanks to her good management, they have continued to succeed. The reason she is requesting this loan is to buy staple products like rice, oil, candies, and beans, as well as wood for her carpentry business.

loans.use: to buy staple products for her small grocery store and wood for her carpentry business

loans.name: Aichurek's Group

texts.en:
Aichurek J. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kadamjai, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 36 and married to a construction worker. Together they bring up a son and two daughters. The son and the first daughter attend school, and the youngest daughter is a baby. 

A year ago with the initial investment of 500 KGS, Aichurek started to breed poultry. She earns 1,000 KGS per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase feed and 10 hens for breeding. In the future Aichurek wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase hens

loans.name: Miryam

texts.es:
Doña Miryam A. es una señora de 55 años, casada, madre de doce hijos. Vive en la localidad de Nueva Virginia de Siquirres de Limón. Se ha dedicado siempre a su familia y ahora cuenta con el apoyo de un hijo para el servicio que brinda de sastrería.
Inició su negocio hace diez años. Ve en su comunidad la manera de aumentar sus ingresos, ya que es la unica satrería que hay. Por lo que solicita financiamiento a Fundación Mujer para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
Ella invertirá su préstamo en la compra de materia prima tales como telas, hilos, encajes, zipper entre otros.
Su sueño es tener un taller de costura bien acondionado y grande para asi ir superandose poco a poco y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
Actualmente cuenta con el obstáculo de falta de capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. por ese motivo busca financiamiento en Fundación Mujer para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Doña Miryam A. is a woman of 55 years of age, married and the mother of twelve children.  She lives in the locality of Nueva Virginia de Siquirres de Limón.  She has always been dedicated to her family and now she counts on the support of a son for the tailoring service that she offers.  She began her business ten years ago.  She sees in her community a way to grow her income, since hers is the only tailor shop that there is.  For this reason she requests financing from Fundación Mujer to cover the demands of her clients.  She will invest her loan in the purchase of commodities such as fabrics, threads, laces, and zippers, among others.  Her dream is to have a dressmaking workshop that is large and well equipped.  Toward this goal she continues growing little by little and improving the quality of life for her and her family.  At present she faces the obstacle of a lack of working capital for the purchase of commodities. For that reason she seeks financing from Fundación Mujer to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy materials such as fabrics, thread, laces and other such supplies.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen G. M. de 37 años de edad, reside en San Juan Opico, en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, un hombre muy trabajador el cual se dedica a la pesca artesanal y así mismo trabaja como albañil. María se dedica a la elaboración de tostadas de  yuca y plátanos las cuales prepara en su casa de habitación y posteriormente sale a vender de forma ambulante por los diferentes parques de San Juan Opico, lo que le permite aportar a su hogar. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para hacer algunas mejoras a su hogar como arreglar el piso y techar una parte de su casa la cual carece de techo. Todo esto lo hace con el enorme deseo de brindarle un mejor hogar a sus cuatro hijos todos menores de edad.
texts.en:
37-year old María del Carmen G. M. lives in San Juan Opico in the department of La Libertad with her husband, a very hardworking fisherman who also works in construction. 

María makes yucca and banana tostadas (fried tortillas) in her home and then sells them in the local parks. In this way she earns money to pay for household expenses. 

María is seeking a loan to make improvements to her house such as  fixing the floor and putting a roof on the part of the house that doesn’t have one. She is very keen to do all of this so that she can provide her four children with a better home.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients to make tostadas

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ausi Jacqueline

texts.es:
Ausi tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus dos menores hijos en casa de su madre ubicada en el distrito la Matanza ubicado en la Provincia de Morrropon que pertenece a la región Piura, que se ubica a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo capital de la Región de la Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en general. Ella ofrece estos productos tanto al crédito como al contado y los ofrece principalmente entre sus vecinos y conocidos. Adicionalmente ofrece abarrotes y fruta.  Esta actividad la realiza hace dos años la cual le permite ayudar al mantenimiento de su economía diaria.

Ausi desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio ya que se acerca la temporada de colegio donde la demanda de su negocio aumenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.
texts.en:
Ausi is 33 years old and single.  She lives with her two minor children in her mother’s house.  It is in the Matanza district, Morropon province, Piura region.  It is located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She sells general clothing.  She sells these products as much on credit as for cash.  She sells mainly to her neighbors and acquaintances.  She also sells groceries and fruit.  She has been doing this for two years, and it helps meet her daily needs.

Ausi wants to get more merchandise to expand her business.  The school season is approaching, and the demand for her business increases.  That is why she believes it is advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,500 soles.  The loan will help her reach her objective.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos, 30, is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for ten years now and sells his maize, milk and beans locally. He also earns income from procuring and selling sand to the local market.

He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo for his poultry farm. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him meet his basic needs. He hopes to have established a breeding farm in the next five years. His primary challenges have been poor market prices for his farm produce and competition.

loans.use: to maintain his poultry farm.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy H., 55, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. 

H. and his wife are farmers, earning an income of about US $3 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $74 on food and US $56 on the other necessary expenses. 

H. is requesting a loan of US $700 to purchase mobile spare parts for one of the children to sell. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy mobile spare parts to resell

loans.name: Yvunette Ann

texts.en:
Yvunette Ann L. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Yvunette Ann is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Yvunette Ann owns and operates sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Yvunette Ann has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Yvunette Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Yvunette Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Yvunette Ann is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the second loan taken out by Yvunette Ann from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie P. is from Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Josie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Josie owns and operates a business venture in the transportation sector providing motorcycle services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Josie has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair existing vehicle for better service. Josie is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Josie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Juan Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Juan es un padre de familia muy responsable,  comenta  que acudió con nosotros para solicitar su crédito ya que le quiere hacer unos arreglos a su casa, anteriormente   realizo una pequeña  barra en el interior de  su  domicilio y una cocina, las cuales por  falta  de  recursos no  a  podido  concluir ya que no le alcanzo con el presupuesto que  tenia  contemplado, el  Sr. Juan  ve  en el  crédito  la  posibilidad  de   ofrecer  una  mayor  comodidad  a  su  familia la cual  representa  lo mas  valioso  en su  vida.
texts.en: Mr. Juan is the father of a responsible family.  He says that he came to us for credit because he wants to make some repairs in his home. Previously he built a small bar inside his home and kitchen, which for lack of resources he could not complete because it did not stay within the budget that he had thought it would.  With this loan, Juan sees the possibility to offer comfort to his family which is the most valuable thing in his life.

loans.use: To refurbish his kitchen.

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
La Sra.  Rosa Aurora pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo” del Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene 68 años y tiene tres hijos; todos ya cuentan con familia propia.

Inicia su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad  con un capital de S/500.00 nuevos soles; haciéndose rápidamente de muy buena clientela por su carisma y buena atención,  lo que le permitió ampliar su negocio.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00,  surtirá y comprará  productos como:  cajas de jabones, cajas de leche, sacos de azúcar y arroz, paquetes de fideos, jabas de huevos así como insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes y otros productos para dar una buena atención a sus clientes.

Rosa Aurora  es una mujer emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con un Mini Market.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella, a realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Rosa Aurora is a member of the Comunal Bank “El Abiseo” in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, department of San Martín. She is married, 68 years old and has three children, all of whom have their own families already.

She started her small grocery and basic goods business with 500 new Peruvian soles of capital. Quickly building a good client base due to her charisma and good customer service enabled her to expand her business.

With this loan of 2000 new Peruvian soles she will stock up buying products such as: boxes of soap, milk cartons, sacs of sugar and rice, packets of noodles, beans and eggs as well as personal hygiene and household cleaning supplies, soda packets and other products to give good customer service.

Rosa Aurora is an entrepreneurial woman. Her dream is to have a Mini Market.  She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her realize their dreams.

loans.use: to buy soaps, milk, sugar and rice, noodle packets, beans, eggs etc.

loans.name: Chanroeun

texts.en:
Chanroeun and her husband are weavers. They have been married since 1993 and have two children--one son and one daughter. Both are in school. The family lives on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chanroeun is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

Photo: Chanroeun is weaving.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Moiyao

texts.en:
Moiyao , 31-years old, married and supports three people.  He has been operating a retail shop for the past four years. 

He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more stock.  With the profits generated he plans to expand his business from retail to wholesale.

He dreams to be rich.  He is an assiduous man who works with great effort to attain more despite limited resources.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in his store

loans.name: Maria Simona

texts.es: La Señora Maria Simona se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva en sus 34 años, siempre ha sabido trabajar y mantenerse muy independiente. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo, lo cuales siempre le ha proporcionado los ingresos necesarios. El negocio lo inicio porque de sus ahorros decidió comenzar esta actividad, ella con mucho empeño y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante, pues su Madre le ha enseñado a ganarse la vida de la manera más humilde. La inversión del préstamo será para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, trajes faldas y otro tipo de vestimenta. Sueña con tener su propio establecimiento en el mercado.
texts.en:
María Simona sells new clothes.  In her 34 years she’s always known how to work and support herself independently.  She has four children in her care and she’s always provided them with the necessary income.  She decided to use her savings to start the business.  With much sacrifice and dedication she’s managed to get ahead for her mother taught her how to earn a living in the most humble way.

The loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, skirt suits and other types of clothing.  She dreams with having her own establishment in the market.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits and other types of clothing.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 31, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to July Tito, a driver, and she is a mother of two children. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. Like most Filipino parents, Nenita believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Nenita operates an internet café business. There is more need, now than before, for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or any office documentation, as well as people who just love to surf the net and social networks. Aside from the internet café, Nenita is into direct selling. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 619 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 29,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy an additional computer, mouse, keyboard, mouse pad, and other supplies for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nenita dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for computer parts and accessories

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en:
Zainab is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She is 36 years old and was born in Makeni. She is married to a tailor, and the couple has three children who are attending primary and secondary school.

For the past ten years Zainab has been selling shoes, slippers, flip-flops and vests. With her share of the loan her group is requesting, Zainab would like to try a new type of business: selling groundnuts and palm oil. To do so, she will use her loan portion to buy bags of groundnuts and gallons of palm oil.

With the help of this loan, Zainab and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bags of groundnuts and gallons of palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is married with two children. Marieta is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Marieta is raising a pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to purchase more pigs to sell.

Marieta has been a member of PMPC for two months. In the future, Marieta hopes to have good living conditions and to make her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to sell.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 65 years old and married with five children. She does poultry farming to earn a living for her family. She has employed one person in her business. She has 11 years of experience in her business. She also owns rental houses to earn extra income for her family.  Previously, she used to sell second-hand clothes.

Annah hopes to become a major supplier of poultry products.  She has requested 70,000 Kenya shillings to build more rental houses.

loans.use: To build more rental houses

loans.name: Lita

texts.es: Lita, de 30 años, es madre de tres niños, de 12, 6 y 1 año de edad; es conviviente con su pareja con quien educa y alimenta a sus hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia y esperan poder estar siempre unidos por el bien de sus hijos. Lita es una mujer muy dinámica y alegre, se dedica a la venta de queso y pan molde a crédito, entrega por la mañana y pasa a cobrar por las tardes, esta actividad realiza entre sus amigos y vecinos, lleva ya trabajando un promedio de tres años y lo hace sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es independiente y administra su propio horario y eso le da ventajar de hacer otras actividades. Espera mas adelante poder crecer junto a su familia en un negocio que puedan estar siempre unidos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP por tanto espera el apoyo de ustedes para continuar trabajando. Con el monto solicitado, comprará quesos, pan, yogurt y manjarblanco para tener mayor stock en sus productos.
texts.en: Lita, 30 years old, is a mother to three children who are 12, 6, and one years old. She lives with her partner with whom she educates and feeds their children. Together, they live in their own house and hope to be able to always be united for the wellbeing of their children. Lita is a very dynamic and happy woman. She is dedicated to selling cheese and bread molds on credit. She makes deliveries in the morning and spends the evenings receiving. She conducts this work among her friends and neighbors. She already has experience with this work for three years and she does it alone. What she likes about her job is that it's independent and she manages her own schedule and this gives her the advantage to do other activities. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow the business with her family so they can always be together. This is the first loan with MFP. As a result, she hopes for your support so she can continue working. With the amount requested, she will buy cheese, bread, yogurt and blancmange (vanilla pudding) in order to have greater stock of her products.

loans.use: To purchase cheese, bread, yogurt and blancmange.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 31 years old. He is married to Hannah and they have one child. He has practiced livestock farming in Naivasha town for the last five years.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more sheep to rear and sell later.

In the future, George hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy more sheep to rear.

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Otgonbaatar, 55, lives with his family in an apartment. He has only one son who is 29 years old and lives with his parents. 

Otgonbaatar has been working at the Mongolian Railway Company as a welder for many years. Now he is a guard for the company, since he is going to retire soon. 

His dream is to build a house for his son and help him to start his life. Fortunately, he already started building the house and is 90 percent finished. Now he needs funding to finish the house and he is requesting a loan for it.

loans.use: To finish building a house for his son.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Rosalinda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Maria Maxima

texts.es: La señora María es cliente antigua D. la institución ella vive en casa familiar en la zona D. las Carmelitas en Cota Cota, la Sra. Máxima se dedica a la repostería en su misma casa ya que ella tiene  su tienda donD. realiza sus tortas galletas  y quequesitos,  ella es muy conocida por la zona por las ricas masas que prepara doña máxima es casada con el Sr. León quien ya se jubilo por lo que le ayuda con las compras D. los ingredientes sus hijos ya son mayores y cada uno ya realizo su viva aparte ella esta solicitando el crédito para  la compra D. insumos como harina arroz azúcar para la elaboración D.  pásteles.
texts.en: The lady María is a longtime client of the microfinance institution.  She lives in the family home in the zone of the Carmelites in Cota Cota.  María Máxima works as a baker in her own home in which she has her store where she makes cakes, cookies and cupcakes.  She is very well-known in the area because of the rich desserts that she makes.  María Máxima is married to León who is already retired so he helps her with purchasing the ingredients.  Their children are already grown and each of them live elsewhere.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of supplies such as sugar and flour for the preparation of cakes.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es: Norma Isabel tiene 35 años, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace más de 11 años que tiene este medio de vida, uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido el tiempo pues tiene que brindarle a su hijo lo necesario y dedicarle tiempo a su negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de lápiz labial, cremas, shampoo, tratamientos, pintura de uñas entre otros. Ella necesita incrementar su capital y la forma de realizarlo es obteniendo este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Norma Isabel is 35 years old. She sells cosmetics and has earned her living in this manner for more than 11 years. One of her greatest challenges is having the time to provide what her child needs and still have time to devote to her business.

This loan will be used to buy lip pencils, crèmes, shampoo, treatments, nail polish, and other products. She needs to increase her capital, so obtaining this loan will help her buy merchandise.

loans.use: to buy lip pencils, crèmes, shampoo, treatments, nail polish, and other products.

loans.name: Harrison Chege

texts.en:
Harrison used his previous loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer and to pay casual laborers. He was able to plant and then have a very profitable harvest. Harrison repaid the loan well and in good time.This will be his third loan, which he plans to use to buy farm supplies and to pay for labor.

In the future, Harrison hopes to improve his farming skills and methods, to get  more income and to become one of the leading farmers in the area.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and pay for labor

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Afiwa est une femme âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée  å un commerçant. Elle a 2 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier à 4 ans et le dernier a 9 mois.  
Afiwa travaille comme coiffeuse depuis 2009. Elle coiffe tous clients dans son salon. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille avec deux apprentis. 
Afiwa a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits cosmétique, des mèches, des tissages et des bazins. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Afiwa voudrait agrandir son atelier. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afiwa is a 26-year-old woman. She is married to a shopkeeper. She has two children, one of whom is in school. The first-born is four and the youngest is nine months old.

Afiwa has been working as a hairdresser since 2009. She does the hair of all the clients in her salon. She buys her products in Lomé. She works with two apprentices.

Afiwa requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy beauty products, hair extensions, weaves and colorful cloths. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Afiwa would like to expand her workshop. She says that with the profits, she plans to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Dianora Del Socorro

texts.es:
El municipio de Telica en León se caracteriza por tener varios puestos de pulpería siendo muchas las personas que visitan dichos puestos para las compras necesarias para el hogar.

La señora Dianora posee su propia pulpería en el municipio y actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de productos como arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, jabón y ace para continuar ofertándolos de forma tal que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos. 

Agradece a Ceprodel porque dicho crédito le será de mucho beneficio para su propio desarrollo en su negocio de pulpería.
texts.en:
The municipality of Telica, in Leon, is known for its grocery stalls and many people visit these to buy necessary home products.

Dianora has his own grocery stall and is requesting a loan to buy products such as rice, oil, sugar, toilet tissue, soap and bleach to continue offering them so that her customers are satisfied.

She thanks CEPRODEL because this loan will be a huge benefit for the development of her business.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, oil, sugar, toilet tissue, soap and bleach for her store.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она медсестра и у нее низкая зарплата и это не хватает на содержании семьи. Её муж не живет с ней уже 5 лет и все заботы и проблемы семьи в её плечах, кроме того у неё проблемы со здоровьем, поэтому ей очень тяжело содержит двоих детей.  Чтобы перешагнут все эти трудности она начала заниматься скотоводством для того чтобы немножко улучшить финансовое положения семьи.
