Шарофат запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки скота и корма для них. Она очень надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие. Спасибо вам большое!
texts.en: Sharofat is a smart and hardworking woman.  She is a nurse and has a low salary, which is not enough to support her family.  Her husband has not lived with her for five years, and all of the family's worries and problems reside on her shoulders.  Besides this, Sharofat has health issues, which makes it more difficult for her to support two children.  In order to get past all of these difficulties, she got involved in animal husbandry to slightly improve the family's financial situation.  Sharofat is requesting a loan in the sum of 5000 Somoni to purchase livestock and fodder for it.  She relies on your help and mercy.  Thank you very much!

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fodder

loans.name: David S.'s Group

texts.en:
This are a group of teachers from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lender to seek for a loan of 3,000,000 SLL (US$700) in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. Gradually, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries.

Pictured in the right is David, the leader of this group. The fifty-eight year old is a native of Mamunta village in Northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a nurse and the couple has seven children, two are in primary school, one is in secondary school and the other is in college. David has served in the teaching profession for thirty-six years now. He is going to use this loan in order to pay college fees for his child.

loans.use: to pay college fees for his child.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en: Kelvin is 22 years old and single. He operates a printing shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. He describes his business environment as favorable for business because there is less competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income. He hopes to expand his business to a big company and be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a printer.

loans.use: To buy a printer

loans.name: Joseph Muita

texts.en:
Joseph is a 51-year-old fruit and vegetable seller in Kongowea, Mombasa.  He is a married father of three.  He has been doing this business for the past eleven years with great success.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more kale, bananas, tomatoes, oranges and carrots. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and to expand his business further. 

He hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Neslie

texts.en:
This is Neslie. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Neslie dreams of continuous growth in her business and hopes to give her children a good life and future.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Three years ago Julia started a business offering shoes by catalogue. She wanted to support the family economy because her husband is a taxi driver and his income is not steady or enough to meet the families needs (i.e. such as the school expenses for their children). The family members are: Julia, her husband and their five children. She sells her merchandise giving credit or through “tandas” (by turn). With the new school period approaching, she requires this credit and with this amount she will be able to finance her clients in this upcoming season.

She is requesting a loan for $650.00 USD, payable in a term of 4-8 months. She wants to buy enough merchandise and in this way to face the increase of her clients demand for this season.

ESPAÑOL

Hace 3 años que la Sra. Julia inicio su negocio de venta de zapatos por catálogo a fin de ayudar a su economía familiar, ya que su esposo es chofer de un taxi y sus ingresos son variables y no podían cubrir las necesidades de educación de sus hijos. Su familia esta formada por ella, su esposo y tienen 5 hijos. La forma en que vende sus productos es a crédito o mediante tandas. Es por eso que en esta temporada escolar en que los niños regresan a clases requiere de un préstamo para poder financiar a sus clientes.

El préstamo que solicita Julia es de $650 USD a pagar en un plazo de 4-8 meses, el cual le permitirá comprar suficientes mercancías para hacer frente al incremento en la demanda de sus clientes para esta temporada.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a plot of land to grow more horticultural plants

loans.name: Herotia

texts.en:
Herotia is married with five children. She is very talented in making elei and prints. This is why she decided to operate this particular business. She spent her first loan starting her operation and utilised the profits to pay for the school fees of her five children, whom are all attending high school. She believes that the loan and her hard work allowed her to continue operating her business.  The business has made it possible for her and her family to meet their needs.

She is looking forward to have another loan to improve the business.  The money will be used to buy different materials and paints.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and paint

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy would like to buy 2 young pigs.

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria is married and has a 17-year-old son and a 13-year-old daughter. Her husband's salary is very small and not enough to pay the bills without extra income. Six years ago, Maria started a business selling cosmetics via catalogue, and soon after incorporated undergarments and found greater success. Now she has also added shoe sales and has continued to see her sales grow. Love for her family and faith in her husband are a daily motivator for her to work harder and improve her business.

To meet her clients' demands and provide them a quality service, Maria is requesting a loan of $475, which she will use to purchase supplies. She plans to repay the loan within six months. The well being of this family is in your hands. They are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria de la Luz es casada y tiene un hijo de 17 años de edad y una hija de 13. El salario que su esposo recibe era muy bajo para solventar los gastos del hogar y ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra, desde hace siete años Maria inició su negocio vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo, poco después incluyó la venta de blancos y obtuvo mejores resultados, ahora ha incorporado la venta de calzado y continua creciendo con su negocio. El amor a su familia y el fiel compromiso que tiene con su esposo la motivan día con día a esforzarse más y a mejorar su negocio.

Para poder cubrir la demanda que tiene y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Juana Marisol

texts.es:
Economic hardship has taught Juana many important lessons about survival and providing for her family. In an effort to improve her family’s situation, she decided to open a small grocery store in her home together with her mother-in-law. She brings enthusiasm and good cheer to her business every day, growing in popularity such that a number of local families rely solely on her store for their basic needs. Her tireless efforts have helped improve her quality of life, and she is highly motivated to continue to grow her business. To this end, she would like to expand the types of products she offers and to be able to offer them to her customers at better prices. With your support, we can make the wishes of this hard-working mother a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Tras varios años de decadencia económica por la que atravesaba su reciente matrimonio Juana obtuvo muchas lecciones de vida para sobrevivir y poder proveer el sustento diario a su familia, es así que con la ayuda de su suegra ella decide abrir una pequeña bodega en su casa y desde entonces gracias a su perseverancia y trabajo la conserva y obtiene de ella muchas satisfacciones; ha ido creciendo con el tiempo y en la actualidad está progresando aún más ya que se ha convertido en una de las pocas tiendas que abastece totalmente la demanda de muchas familias en la zona que actualmente habita, además con el trato amable que brinda cada día a sus clientes le garantiza una larga vida a su pequeño espacio de ventas. Su desempeño durante todo este tiempo ha podido contribuir notablemente con la mejoría de su calidad de vida familiar y sus tres queridos socios se han convertido en el mejor motivo para que siga deseando continuar con este trabajo.Su continua búsqueda la lleva ahora a desear incrementar la cantidad de artículos a fin de poder ofertar más productos a menor precio a cada uno de sus asiduos clientes para la satisfacción de sus necesidades.Con tu valioso aporte podemos hacer que el anhelo de una madre diligente se haga realidad.

loans.use: Purchase more goods/products for small grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for her eatery

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Ms. Maxima has lived in Chosica for 30 years. She has 5 children and is a single mother.

She began to sell clothing house to house to be able to provide her children with food. Her business was good for her and that's how she could open a small store in her house. Her neighbors know the situation of what happened to her and so they support her by buying her products and this allows her to move her children forward, providing them with the education that she could not have.

Now she is in charge of two of her children, ages 4 and 12. She is giving them the education that she and the older children could not have.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer.

La señora reside hace 30 años en Chosica, tiene 5 hijos, es madre soltera. Empezó vendiendo ropa ofreciendo de casa en casa, para poder brindarles alimentación a sus hijos, su negocio le fue bien y es así como pudo abrir una pequeña bodega en su casa, sus vecinos conociendo la situación por la que pasaba la señora, la apoyaron comprándole sus productos y es así como la señora pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos, brindarle los estudios que ella no pudo tener. Ahora esta a cargo de dos de sus hijos de 4 y 12 años, les está dando la educación que ella y sus hijos mayores no pudieron tener.

loans.use: To increase the variety of products in her store

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Chun and her family live in Preak Ampil Commune along the Mekong River. She married in 1960 and has only one daughter. She and her husband, Sok Buk, are farmers. They grow tomatoes, papaya, and eggplant in Koh Tang on the Mekong River, while her daughter sells Chinese noodles and coffee at home. 
She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time, this time in the amount of $1,000 to buy a new small tractor for plowing.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor

loans.name: Melisa Mirella

texts.en:
Mirella has been an associate of the community bank “Cocharacas” for one year. She joined after her mother, another associate, invited her. Mirella mentioned that she enjoys the training account values, and how to manage money.

Mirella is 20 years old. She is studying law at the university. Mirella is the oldest in her family, and when her parents separated she had to start working at a very young age. She worked 12 hours a day for less then US $200 per month.

Six months ago Mirella started a business. With the help of her mother and the little money she could scrape together, Mirella started selling women’s clothing. She travels to the city of Lima to buy products and then sells them to her friends and family.

Mirella needs a loan of 1600 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy shoes, shirts, and pants.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Marella plans to use her savings to pay for school, and to build a home. Her dream Is to continue moving forward, help her siblings, have a united family, own a home, and be a professional.

loans.use: Mirella needs a loan of 1600 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy shoes, shirts, and pants.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio V. is 35 years old, single, and is from the interior of the country. Evers since he was young worked helping his father on the farm planting fruits and vegetables. About eight years ago he decided to come to the city of Luque where several of his brothers were working, all of whom are very humble and hard working.

His brothers helped Gregorio to get started in Luque through the purchase of a pickup truck so that he could make a living through mobile sales of various types of goods. As such, Gregorio sells staples such as sugar, rice, flour, canned goods, housewares, and so forth. He travels to Chaco Paraguayo (northwestern Paraguay) twice a week in order to sell his goods to pre-established clientele.

He would like this loan so that he can buy merchandise in larger quantities, because last month he obtained new customers who have made large orders of merchandise. In the longer term, he has set his sights on buying a larger truck in order to expand his business and income.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Gregorio V. tiene 35 años y es soltero, es de una zona del interior del país. Desde muy pequeño trabajo ayudando a su padre en la chacra plantando hortalizas y frutas. Hace 8 años aproximadamente decidió venir a la ciudad de Luque donde se encontraban varios de sus hermanos trabajando, gente muy humilde y trabajadora.

Sus hermanos ayudaron a Gregorio a establecerse en la ciudad de Luque y en la compra de una camioneta para dedicarse a la venta ambulante de distintos tipos de mercaderías. Es así como Gregorio vende artículos de primera necesidad como azúcar, arroz, harina, fideos, productos enlatados, artículos para el hogar entre otras cosas y viaja dos veces a la semana al Chaco Paraguayo para vender sus productos a clientela ya formada.

El desea el crédito para poder comprar mercaderías en grandes cantidades pues este último mes ha logrado obtener nuevos clientes que hicieron pedidos grandes de mercaderías. Mas adelante tiene proyectado comprar una camioneta más grande, para ir ampliando de este modo su negocio y sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, flour, canned goods, housewares, and so forth

loans.name: Sorie P.

texts.en: Sorie is 41 years old, married and has four children.  He runs a pharmacy business in Makeni town. He has been running this business for more than 5 years at a very small scale.  Sorie would like to expand his stock and is requesting a loan of Le. 3,500,000 to do so.

loans.use: to purchase more of the most frequently requested medications and supplies

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komla D. is a 37-year-old man, married, and a father. He runs a shop, "Etablissement Ventout" in Kpalimé, one of the biggest cities in Togo. He sells various items, and he has an apprentice who works with him (see photo). Komla wishes to use these Kiva funds to increase the capacity of his enterprise by buying Togocell prepaid cell phone cards, soap, wristwatches, and other goods for retail sale. He has already had success with FECECAV loans, so he hopes to repay this loan in only one month! He hopes to continue to improve the quality of life for his family by the profits he is going to make selling his merchandise.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Komla D. est un homme âgé de 37 ans, marié et père. Il opère une boutique, « Etablissement Ventouts » à Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Il vend les produits variés et il a un apprenti qui travaille avec lui (dans le photo.) Komla souhaite avec les fonds de Kiva augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en achetant les cartes de recharge Togocell, du savon, les montres et les autres produits pour revendre. Il a déjà réussi avec les crédits de FECECAV donc il espère rembourser ce crédit dans un mois seulement ! Il espère continuer améliorer la qualité de vie de sa famille par les profits qu’il va dégager dans la vente de ses marchandises.

loans.use: To increase the capacity of his enterprise

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru:
Farhod G. lives in the Khuroson region. He is married and has 4 children. He owns a store, where he sells various foods and other products. He has been in this business for the past 5 years. His experience tells him that to increase the profits, he needs to obtain more inventory. To do so, he needs additional financing. This loan will enable him to purchase more inventory and pay off the credit within then next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Гадоев Фархот проживает в районе Хуросон. Занимается торговлей . Имеет магазин , где продает продукты питания и другие промышленные товары. Занимается торговлей уже пять лет. Опыт работы подсказывает , что надо увеличить товарооборот. Но для этого сначала нужно получить кредит . На эти деньгт он купит товар и в течении 10 менсяцев будет погашать кредит. Фархот женат и имеет четверых детей.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
Doña María Elsa is 58-years-old. She lives in the Carlos Aguirre neighborhood. She has 5 children, and her life companion is a salesman.

Doña María Elsa makes and sells mirrors, which she makes herself by hand. She has been in this business for 5 years, and the difficulties that she has faced have been in periods of low sales due to the difficult economic situation in the country. She started this business with severance pay from her old job, all due to the attraction she felt for making mirrors, and she thought it could be a good business. The use of this loan will be the purchase of supplies so she can make her mirrors. She has large orders and doesn't have enough capital to satisfy the demand of her customers. She hopes to be able to keep working hard to grow her business and to make it stable.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Maria Elsa tiene 58 años de edad, habita en el barrio Carlos Aguirre, tiene 5 hijos quienes son estudiantes, su compañero de vida es agente vendedor.

Doña Maria Elsa se dedica a la elaboración y venta de espejos, los cuales los hace ella misma y de forma artesanal. Tiene 5 años de estar en este negocio y las dificultades que ha encontrado son las épocas en que hay ventas bajas debido a la difícil situación económica del país. El negocio lo empezó con la liquidación del antiguo trabajo, todo debido a la atracción que sentía por la elaboración de espejos y pensó que podría ser un buen negocio. El uso del préstamo será la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de espejos, ya que tiene pedidos grandes y no cuenta con suficiente capital para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Espera poder seguir trabajando duro para hacer crecer su negocio y hacerlo más estable.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to make her mirrors

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea P. and her husband, Mr. Poch Duch, are pig breeders in Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province. Since they currently breed ten pigs and their business is doing well, Mrs. P. is requesting a loan to buy six more pigs for breeding. 

Mrs. P. is 64 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are married and live separately while the three others are tailors in the local village and make a small income that assist their parents' expenses.

loans.use: To buy six more pigs for breeding

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel O. sells different kinds of drinks at Pedu in Cape Coast. Emmanuel has a senior high education. He is not yet married and has no children. Emmanuel has been selling different kinds of drinks since 2005. He is responsible for paying rent and other utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more drinks for sale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save for his future and also to take care of his sister's child since he does not have a child of his own.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married and lives with his wife in Ivano-Frankivsk. He offers transportation services as a taxi driver in his home town. He has been in this business for four years. Oleg's enterprise has benefited a lot from Nadiya Ukraine financial assistance. Presently, he is making about $40-50 of income each day.

Oleg has recently purchased a newer vehicle which runs more smoothly and helps him serve his customers better. Oleg is requesting a 5000 Grivna loan, $975, to pay for his license and insurance. He intends to meet all government requirements and ensure the safety of his clients. Oleg admits that he is very happy to be self-employed. He used to work as a truck driver for a local company, however the taxi business suits him and his lifestyle a lot better. Oleg is hoping to use a portion of his profits to pay for his wife's university fees as she is a student getting a higher education in one of the local universities.

loans.use: pay for license and insurance

loans.name: Ugur

texts.en: Ugur is 44 years old, married, and has two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, and is settled in the Khirdalan settlement. Fifteen years ago he started the business of transporting goods with his car. He would like a loan of 970 AZN to buy additional spare parts.

loans.use: to buy the spare parts

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty M. sells fried fish and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Betty is 27 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband is a soldier. Her child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land and build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Samuth

texts.en: Mrs. Samuth K. is a villager in the Tbeng Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer who has a plot of land to cultivate rice in order to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Chhuon Sao, is a firewood seller. Although they try to work hard, they still earn insufficient income which cannot provide a better life for the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Samuth K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family. Mrs. Samuth K. is 32 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her family

loans.name: Shamim Tariza Amanuel Group

texts.en:
Shamim tariza baji is a 44-year-old married lady and has resided in an area named Ismail Nagar of city Lahore, Pakistan, for the past 27 years. Her husband's name is A. and he works in a factory. Shamim baji has three kids: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son works in a factory. The others are free and don’t do anything.

Shamim baji sells clothes to share the financial burden with her husband so that they both easily manage the household's expenses. She buys clothes from a famous city (Multan) and sells in her native city Borewala. She has been in this work for the past 15 years. She successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her clothes selling business.

She is the group leader of some more women of her locality. Agnus baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Kosar parveen baji wants a loan to buy material (leather, polish and nails) for her shoe making business. Chanda baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Bushra baji wants a loan to buy masonry tools to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Gabriella

texts.es:
Gabriela tiene apenas 20 años y vive en la ciudad de Acahay con sus padres.

         Gabriela está cursando el segundo año de la carrera de contabilidad en una de la universidades de la zona ,para poder solventar los   gastos de su estudio  hace dos años con la ayuda de sus padres  montaron  un pequeño negocio que consiste en  una librerìa   anexo venta  de celulares, su negocio  se encuentra ubicado en un  lugar estratègico  en frente mismo de un colegio  motivo  por el cual  tiene  una buena  cantidad de clientes y maneja un  buen  nivel de ventas a su corta edad  ya es  independiente  y paga sus  estudios  con el   producto de su sacrificio 

        Solicita el créditos para la compra de cuaderno ,boligrafos, mochilas
texts.en:
Gabriela is barely 20 years old and lives with her parents in the city of Acahay. Gabriela is in her second year of studying Accounting in one of the local universities. In order to pay her tuition, two years ago with her parents' help they open a small business: bookstore and cell phone sales. Her business is strategically located in front of the high school and therefore has a good number of customers. She is able to make a good number of sales and at her young age is financially independent and paying for her studies with the income she has earned through much sacrifice. She is asking for this loan in order to buy notebooks, pens and backpacks.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens and backpacks

loans.name: Lucy T.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Lucy S. from Mbeya. She is married and has two children, aged 1 and 11. 

Lucy has been running a shop since 2000. She buys commodities, such as soap salt, sugar, matches and other home supplies, wholesale and sells them retail. She works at her business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Lucy currently earns about $140 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase more items in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the range of stock. Lucy thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more items in bulk.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa D. is engaged in the business of raising hogs. She is thankful that her husband is helping her in maintaining her business aside from managing their farm, which is also a source of income. Her need of additional capital leads her to request a loan of PHP4,000 that she will use to purchase a piglet. She promises to be more diligent and be more patient to make her business grow. Through her enterprise, Marissa is hoping that she can support the education of her children in school and hopefully finish college degrees. When this happens, she will be the proudest mother, says Marissa. 

Marissa is married to Warlito, who works as a farmer. She is 34 years old and lives peacefully and happily in the village of San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isabela.  They have three children: Ana Mae - 14 years old, second year high school student; Warren - 12 years old, grade six; and Kaycee – 10 years old, grade five.

loans.use: To purchase a piglet

loans.name: Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en:
Fadhila is a clothes seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day, she works at her business for 7 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes, to add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Fadhila is 35 years old, married, and has seven children: ages 18, 16, 14, 12, 10, 8 and 5. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Maryam and Mwajuma. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en:
Nahida N. was born in 1965 and is single; she sells woman's clothes in the city of Ramallah, Palestine. Nahida has been in the clothing sales business for 5 years. Now, she wants a loan of US $3000 to buy more clothing to expand and improve her business.

Nahida is confident that her good taste in clothing and wide selection of products will allow her business to continue to grow.

loans.use: To increase clothing store inventory

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson U. A. sells pepper soup to people within his community in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. He is 35 years old and married with 2 children. He has been in this business for a long time. He hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase pepper soup ingredients. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more pepper soup ingredients

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn G. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old. Jocelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn engages in buying and selling of gold dust from traditional gold miners in her village. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of bought gold dust to the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for more than 19 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP (US$175), which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan Jocelyn has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her gold dust business

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia C. es una dama muy alegre que desde muy jovencita aprendió a elaborar tortillas y hoy en día es el negocio propio que ella tiene y es su fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, su negocio requiere de la compra del maíz para elaborar las tortillas y por esta razón es que espera en Ceprodel para que le brinde un crédito y así comprar el maíz para elaborar las deliciosas tortillas que ella sabe preparar en su localidad en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua.
texts.en:
Lidia C. is a very happy woman. When she was a very young girl she learned to make tortillas. She now has her own business, and it is her source of income to support her family. As with all developing businesses, her business needs to buy corn to make the tortillas. That is why she hopes that Ceprodel will give her a loan. Then she will buy the corn to make the delicious tortillas that she knows how to prepare. She will do this at her site in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn

loans.name: Pedregal Group

texts.es:
Los miembros del banco comunal “PEDREGAL”, viven en la comunidad de Chifla que pretendes al distrito de Huanoquite  provincia de Paruro, ubicado a 3 y 30 horas de la ciudad del Cusco.

Estos socios son un grupo de 10 miembros, alternando sus diferentes actividades y  dedicados principalmente a la agricultura y a la ganadería, ellos compran y venden todo tipo de ganados vacunos y animales menores, aves de corral, ellos los compran muy tiernos y los hacen engordar y reproducir, de este modo ellos pueden vender sus derivados y vender la producción a mayor precio, por otro lado y dependiendo a los meses, ellos siguen dedicados a la agricultura, trabajan aún en forma arcaica las tierras, sembrando, maíz, diferentes variedades de papa, verduras, cebada, trigo y otros productos; para lo cuál ellos requieren el préstamo  para poder comprar ganados y algunos animales menores, también unas semillas para la siembra de sus tierras.

Nuestros socios se encuentran muy agradecidos y valoran el esfuerzo realizado mediante este medio comprometiéndose así con cumplir en forma disciplinada con el pago total de sus préstamos en las fechas establecidas.
texts.en:
The members of the Pedgregal community bank live in the town of Chifla, some 3 1/2 hours from Cusco, in the Peruvian province of Paruro.

The group has 10 members who make a living raising livestock and farming. They buy and sell cattle and smaller animals and keep birds. They buy young animals, then fatten and breed them so that they can sell what the animals produce for a higher return. They also work at farming, spending more or less time at it depending on the time of year. They still work the land in the traditional way, planting maize, various kinds of potatoes, green vegetables, barley, wheat and other products. They need the loan so that they can buy cattle and some smaller animals, along with seeds to sow their fields.

Our members are very grateful for the help that the receive and are committed to repaying the loan within the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle and smaller animals for livestock businesses.

loans.name: Jhonnys Bismarck

texts.es: Don Jhonnys de 40 años de edad, habita en el barrio villa Carlos Fonseca, de la comunidad de Villa del Carmen, Municipio de Managua, casado, su esposa se dedica ha a dar clase en un colegio de la región y se ayudan mutuamente para ofrecerle un mejor porvenir a su familia, tiene seis hijos que actualmente estudian. Trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa de Carmen en el cargo de concejal desde hace seis meses, en el gobierno anterior esta en el cargo de vice-alcalde del mismo municipio. La construcción de una oficina de abogado en su casa de habitación. Siendo un ingreso más. Por falta de financiamiento no se ha realizado su proyecto. Agradece a la Institución por el préstamo, permitiendo comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, zinc, bloques, ladrillo y otros. Generándole mayores utilidades y beneficio a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Jhonnys is 40 years old. He lives in the Villa Carlos Fonseca neighborhood, in the Villa del Carmen community of Managua. He is married and his wife teaches at a school in the region. They help each other out to provide a better future for their family. They have six children who are all in school. He has worked for the municipal administration of Vila de Carmen as an attorney for the past 6 months. In the previous administration, he was deputy mayor of the municipality. The loan is for the construction of an attorney's office at his house, for additional income. He has not completed his project due to a lack of financing. He is grateful to the Institution for the loan that will allow him to purchase construction materials such as cement, rebar, zinc, concrete blocks, bricks, etc. This will increase his earnings and benefit his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build an office

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is so glad that, through her hog-raising and mushroom-production businesses she is able to support the basic needs of her family. She wants her businesses to grow and, in line with this, she would like to obtain a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders as additional capital for her mushroom-production business. Leonida said that the amount she is asking to borrow will not only benefit her mushroom business but also be a big help to her family.

Leonida is married to Roel L. who is a house carpenter. They live peacefully in the simple Barangay of Isidro Paredes, somewhere in Diffun Quirino province. The couple helps each other in providing their children’s allowances and tuition fees in school. Her youngest child is already a senior high school student and Leonida is hoping that, through the improvement of her businesses, she will somehow be able to send her child to college.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: El señor José Santos L.  tiene la edad de 36 años, además tiene 2 hijos y ellos han sido para él la inspiración de su vida. Su trabajo es el brindar le servicio de soldador. Hace 10 años aproximadamente, que se dedica a este negocio y aunque es un oficio cansado, peligroso y agotador, ha sabido desempeñarse excelentemente. Esta vez José solicita un préstamo que le ayude a sufragar gastos en el mejoramiento y mantenimiento de su negocio e invertir en materia prima para la compra de ciertas herramientas que son necesarias. Su deseo  es tener un ingreso estable e instalar un local que les permita a sus clientes localizarlo.
texts.en:
Sr. José Santos L. is 36 years old and has 2 children, who have been the inspiration of his life. For approximately 10 years, he has provided services as a welder. Even though the work is tiring, dangerous and grueling, he manages to perform his job very well.

This time José is requesting a loan to help defray the cost of improving and maintaining his business. He will purchase tools that he needs for his job. He desires to have a stable income and hopes to acquire a location for his business where customers can find him.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel es casado con la señora Petra y viven solitos ya que todos sus hijos ya se casaron, su esposa se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y de su esposo, el tiene su negocio de venta de rusas (refresco con frutas y chile en polvo) y gorditas de picadillo, chile colorado etc. 
El motivo por el que están solicitando su crédito es para la compra de más mercancía de materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos consumibles.

loans.use: Compra de mercancia para elaborar sus productos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de l'huile rouge

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa C. de 41 años de edad reside en el municipio de Colon del departamento de La Libertad con su familia que está compuesta por su esposo de 61 años de edad quien se encuentra jubilado y sus tres hijos de 17, 16 y 14 años de edad. María es una persona muy alegre en su hogar y su negocio,  hace unos años empezó con su tortillería a raíz del de la jubilación de su esposo, María tuvo la idea de iniciar su propio negocio en el cual ella podría aportar económicamente al hogar, y es así como ahora con once años de experiencia en su negocio le han dado el éxito de una clientela estable y gran demanda es por eso que ahora solicita de un crédito para comprar insumos y aumentar la producción de tortillas diarias
texts.en:
María Teresa C. is 41 years old and lives in the town of Colon in the department of La Libertad. Her husband is 61 years old and retired. The couple has three children (ages 17, 16, and 14). María is a cheerful person who started her tortilla business a few years ago shortly after her husband’s retirement. She was inspired to start her own business so that she could continue supporting her family financially. María has now been in business for eleven years and attributes her success to a stable clientele and high demand. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies so that she can increase her daily production of tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her tortilla business

loans.name: Macharia

texts.en:
Macharia is 40 years old and married with two young daughters. He was previously a farmer but has been selling scrap metal in Nairobi for two years now. He is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES to add to his stock of scrap metal.

Macharia describes himself as hardworking and determined. Since he joined Kiva partner Faulu, he says that he has learned business management skills. As his business expands, he hopes to buy a truck for transporting his goods, and purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To add to his stock of scrap metal

loans.name: Biyinzika Development Group A Of Mukono

texts.en: Robinah N. is 20 years old and cares for her one child in addition to her parents. She sells secondhand clothes at the local market and generates 30,000 USH per week from the business.  She would like to use the loan amount of 200,000 USH to purchase more clothing. Robinah believes that with greater inventory she will be able to boost business and attract more customers to her stall. She is very hard-working and hopes to be able to pay for the education of her child.

loans.use: Purchase more used clothing

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea D. is from the village of Paddad, Alicia, Isabela. She is 21 years old and single. To make a living, Lea owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and other goods, in the local community. Lea has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 1,400 PHP weekly.

In 2007, Lea joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lea is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lea from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items in order to expand her product offering

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, 39 years old, is a married woman. She has a 5-year-old child. She wants to give a bright future to her child. She also wants to improve her family’s living conditions. She is into rice farming. According to her, her land is now being prepared for the next planting. She wants to achieve an abundant harvest.

Emma joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies needed at her farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica I. is from the village of Dimalco Bonifacio, Misamiz Occ. She is 44 years-old and married with two children. Veronica owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as soap powder (for laundry), salt, sugar, candy, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Veronica joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy large quantities of pork

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn L. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Mailyn is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Mailyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Mailyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mailyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mailyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mailyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used additional capital for her business. This will be the third loan taken out by Mailyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth J. is currently in the business of selling  groundnut paste at home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of groundnuts to make paste to sell.  Elizabeth is 25 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bags of groundnuts to make paste to sell

loans.name: Hamrokul

texts.ru: Пошокулов Хамрокул проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Хамрокул имеет средне- специальное образование "Бухгалтер". Более 15 лет занимается растениеводством. Имеет небольшой участок земли, где сажает пшеницу. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
P. Hamrokul lives in the Shahrituz region. He’s fifty-six years old, married and has three children. His wife is a housewife. Hamrokul has an education as an accountant. For more than fifteen years he has worked as a farmer, growing wheat on a small plot of land that he owns. He’s asking for a loan in order to buy mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Josefina's Group

texts.en:
Josefina B. is from the village of Baculud, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 55 years old. Josefina is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Josefina is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josefina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Josefina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Nshunga Abamwe Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
R. Denis is a hardworking man, committed to his business and agricultural enterprises. He deals in poultry farming, cattle keeping and a banana plantation, all of which generate income for his family.

Denis’s main drawback has been cattle diseases and pests that attack his cattle and plantations and which have reduced his yields. Therefore this loan is to help Denis buy more farm tools like pesticide, and mulches for the plantation. This will help him improve his yields in terms of milk, eggs and bananas, thus enabling him to meet his customers’ high demand.

The improved yields will increase Denis’s sales revenue, hence making him more able to meet his family’s requirements in terms of his children’s tuition fees and other needs and enable him to live a more self-sustaining life.

loans.use: To purchase farm tools like pesticide and mulches and manure for his plantations

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 33 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. Her husband works as a rice vendor. To provide additional income for her family, Erlinda is starting a business buying and selling rice in the neighborhood. She is ambitious and determined to launch a successful business venture of her own. Erlinda would like to receive a loan to purchase rice inventory. Since the beginning of her membership in Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Erlinda is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. Her long-term goals are to build a sustainable business, to fund her grandchildren’s college education, and to construct a more durable home that can withstand flooding common in her town. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her new business will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase rice inventory

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em M., 59, is widowed and resides with her two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She is at home while her two children are employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of $2 each per day to help cover the family's expenses.

M. is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase chickens to raise. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Neang Chhay

texts.en: Mrs. Neang Chhay S. is 34 years old and lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice. She also sells groceries at her home to earn additional income to support her family. Mrs. Neang Chhay S. is requesting a loan to pay a laborer to plow her farm and to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crops. She wants to use the rest of the loan to buy piglets for breeding and pig feed. Mrs. Neang Chhay S. is a widow with a child, who is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To pay a laborer to plow her farm, to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Pepertual

texts.en: Pepertual A. moves around in Abura to sell jewelry and children’s panties.  Pepertual has been educated up to the senior high level.  She is a widow living with her two children. With the income she makes from her sales, she takes care of her family. Her loan will be used to buy extra items and a variety of jewelry for sale. She wishes to use the new revenue from her business to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: buy extra items and a variety of jewelry for sale

loans.name: Lenny

texts.es:
La Sra. Lenny C. tiene 20 años, está casada hace más de tres años con el Sr. Hugo Padilla Ayala, tienen una hija de 1 año de edad. Todavía viven en casa de los padres en una zona lechera y agrícola por excelencia.

La Sra. Lenny se dedica a la lechería desde hace 5 años, toda su producción de leche entrega a una empresa que elabora productos lácteos que posteriormente venden en el mercado local. 

El primer crédito que requirió fue utilizado para comprar una ordeñadora, este equipo facilitará el trabajo haciéndolo mas eficiente y fácil. Ahora desea poder adquirir otro crédito para poder comprar una vaca lechera mas y de esa manera poder incrementar su producción de  leche cruda. En el primer crédito que obtuvo Lenny demostró mucha responsabilidad con los pagos y es por esta razón que desea que la gente de Kiva confié una vez más en ella. Y agradece a todos los que la ayudaron anterior mente y confiaron en ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lenny C. is 20, and has been married for three years to Hugo Padilla Ayala for more than three years. Together they have a 1 year old daughter. They still live with parents in an area known for it's excellent dairy and agricultural production. Lenny has been working in the dairy industry for the past 5 years. She delivers all her milk to a local company that processes dairy products and sells them in the local market. Her first loan was used to purchase a milking machine which made her work easier and more efficient. Now she hopes to get another loan to purchase another dairy cow to increase her production of raw milk. Lenny showed great responsibility in repaying her first loan and for that reason hopes the Kiva folks with trust her once again. She thanks all of those that helped and trusted her previously.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchasing sewing materials and a new machine

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo B. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 51 years old, married, and has 6 adult-aged children. Wilfredo owns and operates a fishing business, and he gathers and sells seaweeds to the market. 

Wilfredo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Wilfredo is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase a pump fishing boat which will improve his fishing business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: Loice N.  is currently in the business of selling various items such as "simsim" (sesame seeds), onions, tomatoes, beans, etc.  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans, "simsim" and some tomatoes to sell.  Loice is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by building a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans, "simsim" and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Susan Koinato

texts.en:
Susan is 23 years old, a single mother of one school-going child.  She has been in livestock farming for the last three years.  

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the cash to buy six calves which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

Susan hopes to build her own house in future, enabling her to move out of her parents' house where she currently lives with her child.

loans.use: To buy 6 calves which she will sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Neftalí Simeón

texts.es: Neftalí Simeón P. R. de 26 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soypango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su compañera de vida y una pequeña hija de un año de edad. Neftalí posee una panadería propia la cual le compro a un cuñado y en la cual ha ido invirtiendo poco a poco, comprando todas las herramientas necesarias para la elaboración del pan y así mimo ha ido haciendo mejoras en el local, con el fin de poder contar con un mejor ambiente laboral. Neftalí cuenta con 5 repartidores de pan los cuales día con día entregan el pan en bicicleta por diferentes colonias. El negocio es bastante estable y así mismo le permite brindarle trabajo a otras personas, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder mejorar su panadería comprando un horno industrial, debido a que el que posee en la actualidad es un horno artesanal; así mismo Neftalí quiere poseer mayor cantidad de materia prima como harina, manteca y otros más para hacer su trabajo más rápido y eficiente el cual no solo beneficie a su familia sino también a sus empleados.
texts.en: Neftalí Simeón P. R. is 26 years old and lives in the Soypango municipality where he lives with his life partner and little girl that is a year old. Neftalí has his own bakery that he bought from a brother-in-law and has invested in it little by little buying all of the tools necessary to make bread as well as making improvements in the place so that he can have a better working environment. Neftalí has 5 delivery people who each day deliver bread by bicycle to different neighborhoods. The business is very stable and it gives work to other people. Neftalí needs the loan since he has a traditional oven and he wants to buy an industrial oven he also wants to have a greater quantity of raw materials like flour, grease and other items to make the bread faster and more efficiently; that not only will help his family but also his employees.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make bread and to buy an oven.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn M. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 54 years old, married and has 4 adult children. Merlyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food & daily-use products and also retails rice. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sumaya Nompayan Enole

texts.en:
Sumaya Nompayan is a forty year old, modest lady from kilgoris County, South of the  Great Rift valley. She is married to Daniel who is a farmer. The couple has six children with the oldest being 18 years while youngest is two years of age.

Sumaya has been a farmer for the last 21 years and is growing stronger in this business due toa  high demand for maize as a cereal in this part of Kenya. She joined KADET limited to gain access to micro credit and is taking out her first loan. She will use the loan to hire farming fieldhands and buy maize seedlings for this planting season.

Through hiring other fieldhands, Sumaya is sure of a bumper harvest thus good profits which she will use to improve the family’s living standards and also pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy maize seedlings and to hire farming fields

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Alberto;  tiene 43 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de venta de comida quien conjuntamente trabaja con su esposa en este negocio, a su vez  el socio trabaja  en el sector turismo con su carro, transportando a los turistas a sus respectivos tours. 
 
El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz y carnes.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Alberto belongs to the “Puntualito” community bank which is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province and Cusco department. 

Alberto is 43, married, and has 6 children. He has a business of food sales and works together with his wife in the business. He also works in the tourism sector with his car, transporting tourists to their respective tours. 

He requests the loan to purchase cooking products such as rice and meats.

Alberto is thankful to those who take part in his dream by funding the loan, and he commits to making the loan payments on schedule.

loans.use: To purchase cooking products such as rice and meats

loans.name: Dickson Kuya

texts.en:
Dickson Kuya K. is 27-years-old, married to Koitoi K., and he is father of two school going children. Dickson is a businessman involved in buying and selling of cows and he has been doing this for the last ten years. 

Dickson learnt about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan. He is planning to buy more cows. He will fatten the cows for about five months, then he will take them to the market to sell. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire land for farming to increase his income.

His future dream is that he will be able to do well in business. His hope and dream is to become a large scale and commercial business man.

loans.use: To more cows and sell them after five months.

loans.name: Naida

texts.en:
Naida R., from the village of Manamong, Aloran, Misamis Occidental is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. To make a living, Naida owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector running a farm in local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In August 14, 2008 Naida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC used to add her capital from her business, she is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP for additional capital. This will be Naida seventh loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital of her farming business

loans.name: Lucia Milagros

texts.es: Solicitante, tiene 32 años, es madre soltera, vive en casa familiar, tiene un hijo que esta en edad escolar, se dedica al negocio hace mas de 4 años,  señora tiene la meta de tener negocio propio, y cumplir con sus sueños y objetivos, solicita credito para capital de trabajo, para invertir en el negocio,
texts.en: Lucia is 32-years old, a single mother, and lives in the family home. She has a school-aged son. She has been running her business for more than four years. Her goal is to have her own business and fulfill her dreams. Lucia is seeking financing so she can buy more products for her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Davud

texts.ru: Хасанов Давуд проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупно - рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить финансовое положение в семье.
texts.en:
Davud H. lives in the Shahritus region. He is 47 years old, married and has three children. He completed secondary education.

He earns his living by raising livestock. He has been engaged in these types of activities for 15 years. The loan will be used to buy young animals, in order to increase their quantity. 

He wants to expand his business and to improve the financial situation in his family.

loans.use: To purchase young animals

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Don Victoriano R. E. es trabajador de una empresa de Acueductos desde hace 20 años, desempeñando el cargo de Agente de Seguridad.

El es Casado de 55 años de edad, tiene 2 personas a su cargo y una de estas es menor de edad. El vive en el departamento de Managua en el Municipio de Ciudad Sandino.

Este es el primer crédito con CEPRODEL, el lo solicita para mejorar su casa, como es ponerle piso y hacer un muro.
texts.en:
Victoriano R. E. has worked for an aqueduct company for 20 years.  He is a security guard.

He is 55 years old and married.  He has two people under his care, and one is a minor.  He lives in the Managua department in the Ciudad Sandino municipality.

This is his first loan with Ceprodel.  He is requesting the loan to improve his house.  He will do things like put down a floor and build a wall.

loans.use: To improve his house by putting down a floor and building a wall

loans.name: Linda Buwere Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en: M. Sarah is a 31-year-old hardworking and enterprising businesswoman who has been operating a used clothing sales business in Nasuti-Mukono for 6 years. The happily married mother of two says her business's clientele consists mostly of local residents. With the improving prospects after getting this loan, M. Sarah is anticipating the growth of her business, which currently generates 65,000 UGX weekly. M. Sarah will use this loan to purchase more bales of used clothing to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothing

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Demetria D. 57 años D. edad, natural del distrito D. Quimbiri, esta casada con Isidro D. 58 años y tienen 02 hijos Linda D. 21 años y Marilyn D. 19 años juntos residen en su propia casa en la  comunidad D. nueva esperanza departamento D. Cusco. Demetria y su esposo Isidro, son el sostén D. su hogar por el cual se esmeran cada día por el mejor bienestar D. su familia, Demetria se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesina y cuenta con 11 hectáreas D. terreno; donD. ha cultivado, cacao, hojas D. coca, café, plátano y cítricos. Ha trabajado durante 30 años y en tiempos D. cosecha cuenta con el apoyo D. la mano ajena por lo cual contrata jornaleros; D. esa manera podrá cosechar más rápido y poder comercializar D. manera vertiginosa dichos productos a las empresas acopiadoras, quienes le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo D. cada producto que venD.. El problema D. su trabajo radica en no poder combatir con los insectos, que perjudican a sus plantaciones, pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar mas plantones D. cítricos para expandir sus sembríos y aumentar en su producción. Para  así darle una buena estabilidad económica a  su familia y pasar con tranquilidad su edad longeva. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad D. pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Se siente muy agradecida con la institución por facilitarle el crédito solicitado. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará un lote D. terreno en donD. construirá su casa ha base D. material noble, ubicada en la ciudad D. Quimbiri.
texts.en:
Demetria is 57 years old and originally from the district of Quimbiri. She is married to Isidro, 58, and they have two children: Linda, 21 years old, and Marilyn, 19 years old. They all live in a house they own in the Nueva Esperanza community in the department of Cusco. Demetria and her husband Isidro are the pillar of their home and work hard every day to ensure the well being of their family. 

Demetria is devoted to her work. She is a farmer and ploughs the land; she has 30 hectares of land, where she grows cocoa, coca leaves, coffee, banana and citrus fruits. She has worked for 30 years. During the harvest she hires labourers to help her, so as to harvest faster and quickly sell her products to the wholesalers, who pay her very well for every kilogram of product she sells them. The problem with her work is being unable to combat the insects that damage her crops. However, her priority at the moment is to buy more citrus plants in order to expand her crops and increase production, so as to proviD. her family with financial security and have a quiet old age. 

This is her first loan with MFP. She is aware that she is responsible for paying all installments on time and she is prepared to do so. She is very grateful to the institution for having provided her with the requested loan. With the 3,000 soles requested she will buy a plot of land in the city of Quimbiri where she will build her home with solid materials.

loans.use: Buy a plot of land where to build her home.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. lives in Abee which is a community near the coastline near Elmina. Her job is to sell locally-made body powder and soap as well as oil and yams. She sells these goods by carrying them on her head in large bowl. She then walks the streets in her village. 

Efua has three children she is taking care of all by herself because she is divorced and does not get any support form the children’s father. Most of the money she makes with her business is being used to take care of the basic needs of her family. She also sends her children to school which means she has to pay for books and other learning material. 

To be able to provide the opportunity of education for her children she would like to expand her business. In order to achieve this goal Efua wants to buy more goods to be able to sell more and as a result increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy more goods such as locally-made body powder, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 51 years old and has six children, one of them in school. Melba is married. Melba is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Melba requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs and feed.

Melba has been in this business for 26 years. Melba also earns additional income from fish and food vending.

In the future, Melba would like to send her kids to school and use her income for family needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 41 and is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 12 years old.  He sells various products such as slippers, umbrellas, underwear, bananas, etc. He operates his business from 7am to 6pm every day except on Saturday, and he has been engaged in this business for eleven years. His place of business is clean.

Francois has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more products, such as slippers, umbrellas, underwear, bananas, etc. to sell.  He will reinvest any profits in this business and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers, umbrellas, underwear, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 42 years old and her spouse Geoffrey is a teacher. They have four children, aged 17,15,11 and eight years old.  Evaline owns a cereals store in Chepkongony trading centre in Kapsabet town. She has been in the business for a period of nine years earning a monthly income of KES 19,500.

Evaline has borrowed a loan from KADET LTD of KES 50,000, this being her second loan after servicing the first loan successfully. She hopes to use the money to purchase 15 bags of dry maize and three bags of beans. She will resell these items to the local suppliers.

The profits will be used to increase the inventory in the store. She hopes to become a major supplier of maize in the area in the future.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Flor Esterfilia

texts.es:
Flor  tiene 44 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos.  Vive en casa propia la cual esta ubicada en un pequeño sector llamado Cruz de la Esperanza en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Flor se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares, de oficina y productos escolares en su domicilio, desde hace 02 años.  A lo largo de este tiempo sus ventas se han visto en aumento en estos dos años en los cuales también ha ganado ganando la fidelidad de un  buen numero de clientes, los cuales están muy contentos con sus productos. 

Flor ha decidido solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000nuevos soles.  El destino del crédito será para la compra de más útiles escolares y para comprar un lote de productos de belleza que se encuentra en oferta. El cual le dará una mayor rentabilidad.
