Flor  es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresaria y salir adelante.   Flor es una clienta nueva para Edpyme Alternativa, con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Flor is 44 years old and has 2 children. She lives in her own home located in a small area, Cruz de la Esperanza, in Chiclayo.

Flor has been selling writing materials for school or office and scholastic products in her home for 2 years. During these 2 years her sales have increased and she has also won the loyalty of a good number of clients, who are very happy with her products.

Flor has decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN. The loan will be used to buy more writing materials and a batch of beauty products currently on offer, which will provide her with greater profit.

Flor is quite a calm and responsible person. Her greatest desire is to be able to grow and progress as a business woman.  Flor is a new client for Edpyme Alternativa, with good personal and work references.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to further her business.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has four children. She has been educated through junior high school. Her husband is a security man. Aba sells smoked fish at Kwaprow, near Abura in Cape Coast. She uses her income to pay for school fees and utility bills, as a way of assisting her husband. Aba will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke, to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke, to expand her business.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business in the Philippines selling used clothes.

Flavia has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell. She has been in this business for 30 years now. In the future, Flavia would like to save enough to provide a secure future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has one child. He lives with six family members, four of whom work.

Zaid has owned a food market since 2006, selling cheese, juices, bread, daily use items, and dairy products. He is committed to his work and loyal to his clients. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a diesel generator. He is aiming to increase his income so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a diesel generator.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es: Marvin Antonio tiene 34 años, su actividad es la venta de refrescos y golosinas. Tiene más de 11 años en este negocio, es una persona luchadora que disfruta de su actividad. El negocio lo inicio cuando decidió invertir en ciertos productos fue así que con la ayuda de los financiamientos su negocio ha podido crecer. Ahora el solicita este crédito para la compra de bolsas, frutas, azúcar, pajilla, vasos desechables y una gran variedad de golosinas.
texts.en:
Marvin Antonio is 34 years old and has a business selling refreshments and candy. He has been in business for more than 11 years. Marvin is a determined person who enjoys his work. He started this business when he decided to invest in certain products. With the help of loans, he has been able to grow his business.

Now he is requesting a loan to buy bags, fruit, sugar, straws, disposable cups, and a variety of candy.

loans.use: to purchase bags, fruit, sugar, straws, disposable cups, and a variety of candy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike and pigs to feed for selling

loans.name: Luis Alfro

texts.es:
Luis de 52 años,  es el propietario de un negocio llamado “Tienda la Única”, a 10 minutos del mar, allí donde vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 12 a 18, tiene un punto de venta donde las amas de casa y la comunidad  de su barrio y de sus alrededores, compran al detalle productos de la canasta familiar, como ranchos, víveres, bebidas abarrotes etc. Sus clientes lo reconocen y cada día sus productos rotan mucho más rápido hasta quedarse sin existencia de algunos de ellos.  Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen, con ello conservaría un stock de mercancías no perecederas,  como café, azucar, arroz, aceite, enlatados, refrescos y ahorraría en precio  por la compra en volumen y también el transporte, adicionalmente teniendo productos que muy pronto terminan para no decir “no hay” a sus clientes. 
Luis inició su vida comercial hace 25 años  aproximadamente,  cuando proveniente de su natal zapoteca (departamento de Santander) se instaló en la Costa caribe e inició como empleado de una tienda, después se independizó en inició la distribución de productos lácteos en una bicicleta y agregó galletería y confitería, simultáneamente trabajó en tareas de la construcción, en una panadería hasta que recapitulando su experiencia, emprendió hace 7 meses su negocio de tienda con mucho éxito y por la aceptación que tiene de su clientela en su nicho de mercado. Luis tien el gran apoyo de su familia especialmente de sus dos hijos, que ya construyen su experiencia empresarial en su negocio mientras estudian, por eso su mayor anhelo es dejarle algún dia una fuente de ingreso segura y para ello debe trabajar persistentemente y con disciplina. Mientras esto ocurre su actual negocio le permite una rentabilidad sobre las ventas  no menor del 8,7% mientras su costo de ventas es de un 84,1% .
texts.en:
Luis is 52 years old and the owner of a business called “Tienda la Única” (The Only Store), which is 10 minutes away from the sea. He lives with his wife and their four children who range in age from 12 to 18. Housewives from the community and the surrounding areas come to his store to buy everyday items for their families such as snacks, food, beverages, groceries, and other items. His customers know him and his products sell quickly to the point that he runs out of a few items. For this reason he is requesting a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the funds to buy in large quantities so that he can maintain a stock of non-perishable goods such as coffee, sugar, rice, oil, canned foods, and soft drinks. By purchasing in volume, Luis will be able to get a discount and also save on shipping costs. In addition, by having more products in stock, he can stop saying “We’ve run out” to his customers.

Luis started working approximately 25 years ago. This native of Zapoteca, in the Department of Santander, moved to the Caribbean coast and started a job as a store clerk. Afterwards, he became independent and started selling dairy products from a bicycle. He also started selling candy and cookies while holding down other jobs working in construction and at a bakery so that he could gain experience. Seven months ago, Luis opened his store with great success and a warm reception from the customers who make up his niche market. Luis has the support of his family, especially from two of his children who have gained business experience while going to school. His greatest wish is to one day leave them with a secure source of income so that they can work persistently and with discipline. In the meantime, his current business is generating sales profitability of no less than 8.7% while his cost of sales is 84.1%.

loans.use: to purchase non-perishable goods in bulk such as coffee, sugar, rice, oil, canned foods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Apal's Group

texts.en:
Apal, 28, is the treasurer of this group. She resides in the town of Tokmok with her husband and a four-year-old child. Apal’s husband is employed in a local plant, while she is a nurse in a nearby hospital. Apal has pursued this sphere, because she always knew how important health is and wanted to help make changes in people’s lives. However, after the birth of her child, she realized this job couldn’t earn enough to provide for her child's living expenses. So, in cooperation with her husband, she decided to try cattle breeding. And she wasn’t mistaken. Soon Apal bought her first calves for 5 000 soms, fattened and resold them at a good deal. Now she applied for a loan from Kiva to buy some more livestock for further breeding and reselling. If she succeeds, Apal would like to start a dairy business too. 

           --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is married, with three grown up children.   She is 47 years old and her spouse is a farmer.  Flora's shop sells many kinds of products, such as shampoo, toothbrushes, noodles, confectioneries and soft drinks.  She also sells vegetables and fruits. She started this business five years ago, and it provides the main source of income for her family.

Flora is requesting a loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of basic goods, such as snack foods and beverages, to stock her store. She hopes that will enable her to increase the turnover of her business and help her to improve her living conditions and set aside some savings.

loans.use: to purchase milk, coffee, noodles and vegetables for her store

loans.name: Osnia

texts.en:
Osnia is age 28  and married to Amos, a 28 year old motor-taxi driver. They are blessed with a son  Arly, 8 who is studying in the second grade of theelementary school. Osnia owns a business of selling vegetables i.e. tomatoes, mustard greens, kangkung, carrots as well as betel nut and betel vine. She has been engaged in this business for 12 years. The business is located 500 meters from her house and she usually operates the business from 7 am to 8 pm. 

Currently, Osnia is planning to improve her business by renovating her business place and adding more stock of vegetables and kitchen herbs. To do so, Osnia is seeking for a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: To renovate her business place and to add more stock of vegetables and kitchen herbs to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 32 years old, married and has a two-year-old child.  

She runs a pub to earn a living. She has operated the business for one year.  

Through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management skills, she has gained a lot of skills, hence improving her business.

Margaret hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested 50,000 KES to buy beer and soda.

loans.use: To buy beer and soda.

loans.name: Mirzosaid

texts.ru: Мирзосаид честный, трудолюбивый. Раньше он продавал мебель, вот уже год занимается  покупкой и реализацией продуктов питания. Он приобретает товар с центрального рынка. Жена помогает ему в бизнесе, у них 2 детей. У Мирзосаида собственный магазин. Он имеет хорошую репутацию. Мирзосаид хочет развить бизнес, но у него нет достаточных средств. Он просит займ в размере 1000$ США и надеется, что вы ему поможете. Мирзосаид заранее благодарит вас за понимание.
texts.en: Mirzosaid is honest and hardworking. Previously he has been selling furniture but since last year he has managed his own grocery store. He purchases goods to sell in his store from the central market. His wife helps him with his business and they have two children together. Mirzosaid's grocery store has a good reputation. He would like to add more variety to the goods he offers in his store, but he is lacking the capital to make the bulk purchases. That is why Mirzosaid is requesting a loan of 1000 US dollars and he is hoping for your help. Mirzosaid would like to thank all of his lenders in advance!

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Najib

texts.en: Najib has owned a cattle farm since 2007, where he raises cattle, poultry, chicks, etc. He is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man. He is living with his wife and one school-aged child. His business income is very important because he represents the only income provider for his family. Today, he is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase fodder for the animals and added merchandise needed. Najib is very positive and plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for the animals and added merchandise needed

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is 47 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. Her oldest child is 24 years old. Mauricia's husband is a farmer.

Mauricia sells barbecue to the people in her community. She marinates pork and chicken meat in the morning to sell in the afternoon. She also raises chickens to produce and sell eggs. 

Mauricia requested this loan to purchase pork and chicken meat and feeds. She hopes for her business to improve.

loans.use: buy pork and chicken meat and feeds

loans.name: Fausta

texts.es: La socia actualmente tiene 74 años D. edad, la socia continua con su negocio D. internet ella tiene su cabina D. internet y ha ido muy bien con lo que pudo ahorrar pago sus servicios y compro algunos pequeños accesorios y el mantenimiento D. las maquinas, la socia también se dedica a realizar tejidos como mantas para la venta ella en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra D. materiales para la elaboración D. las mantas gruesas que la socia realiza, ella desea tener buena cantidad D. tejidos en mantas para la venta en la epoca naviD.ña y tener un ingreso extra para los regalos D. los hijos y los nietos, la socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. materiales como lanas D. colores y diferentes grosores para la elaboracion D. mantas.
texts.en: Fausta is now 74 years old, and is continuing to work in her internet cafe business, and it is going very well.  With her savings she was able to pay for her services and buy some small accessories, and do maintenance on her computers.  Fausta also makes knitted items such as blankets to sell.  At this time, she wants to invest the loan in purchasing materials to make the thick blankets that she knits.  She wants to have a good quantity of knitted blankets to sell during the Christmas season, so that she will have extra income to buy gifts for her children and grandchildren.  Fausta requests a loan to invest in materials such as a variety of wool in different colors and weights to use making blankets.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make blankets.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, none of whom are in school. Madina has operated a pub business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. 

Madina has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and soda. Madina's main business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and hopes for her business are to own a fully stocked pub and to become a wholesaler. Madina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 32 años de edad; es madre soltera vive en casa alquilada junto a sus dos hijos Ingrid de 07 años y Yorsin de 11 años a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Ana, es un ejemplo de madre que se esfuerza por darles lo mejor a sus hijos; pues ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas como: refrescos, cremoladas, gaseosas, cerveza. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, pues saben que los refrescos que toman es de fruta natural y la  atención es amable de parte de Ana. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder conversar con sus vecinos, pues desde hace 05 meses que trabaja en esta actividad y considera rentable este negocio, por lo que desea ampliarlo y tener más productos que ofrecer. Este será su préstamo número 02 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos de trabajo. En su banco comunal agradece a sus compañeros por elegirla como presidenta de su grupo. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, podrá invertirlo en la comprar gaseosas, cervezas y  frutas para elaborar refresco como: piña, maíz morado, fresa, etc.
texts.en:
Ana, 32, is a single mother living in a rented house with her two children: Ingrid, 7, and Yorsin, 11 that she wants to provide a better quality of life for.  


Ana is an example of a mother who strives to provide the best for her children.  She sells beverages like  fruit smoothies, soft-drinks and beer.  Her main customers are her neighbors because they know that the refreshments they are enjoying are made from fresh fruit and Ana treats them with kindness.


What she likes best about her work is chatting with her neighbors.  She’s been in this line of work for five months and she believes it’s profitable so wants to expand it and have more products to sell.


This will be her MFP loan #2 so she hopes for your support to continue toward her work goals.  She thanks her fellow communal bank members for electing her President.


She will use the 2000 new soles to buy soft-drinks, beer and fruit to make smoothies with: pineapple, purple corn, strawberries, etc.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, beer and various types of fruit.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is 60 years old and single. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Ngoc earns an income by buying bulbs of garlic from wholesalers and then peeling the outer layer to sell to her customers for food production. She has done this since 2005. 

Ngoc is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling. This loan will allow her to increase her income and set aside some savings.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: La señora Luz Maria a sus 47 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa femenina e infantil, con los frutos de esta actividad ha podido sacar adelante a sus dos hijos puesto que no cuenta con el apoyo de su cónyuge del cual se separo hace dos años. Con el fin de mejorar en cuanto a su calidad de vida y bienestar de sus hijos, desea adquirir surtido con el cual pueda recuperar su clientela, mejorar sus ingresos y cumplir su sueño algún día de tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Luz Maria is 47, and sells women's and children's clothing. With the proceeds of this business, she has been able to raise her two children, as she doesn't have the support of her partner, from whom she separated two years ago.

With the aim of improving her quality of life, and the well-being of her children, she wishes to acquire stock with which she can win customers, improve her income, and fulfil her dream of having her own store one day.

loans.use: To buy a selection of women's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Dulce Deyanira

texts.es: La señora Dulce es una persona emprendedora  y día   con día  se  esfuerza   por  salir  adelante, actualmente  ella  se  dedica  a  la venta de  hamburguesas  la  cual  realiza  en las   noches además de  vender  joyería,   ella  acudió  con nosotros   ya  que   requiere  realizar  la compra  de materia prima para continuar  trabajando en su puesto de comida,  agradece  el apoyo  brindado para  la  realización de  su proyecto   ya  que le  proporcionara la  oportunidad  de  hacer  crecer   su  negocio.
texts.en: Sra. Dulce is an enterprising person who works day after day to get ahead. Currently she is engaged in selling hamburgers which she makes at night. In addition she sells jewelry. She came to us since she needs to purchase ingredients so she can continue working at her food stall. She is grateful for the support enabling her to carry on her work, since it provides her the opportunity to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make hamburgers.

loans.name: ´tony´jose Antonio

texts.en:
I have nearly 20 years of experience in making barbecue tacos (my favoriate Mexican Food!) in a small trailer. This business has been my principal source of living for me, my wife, and my children.

Unfortunately, due to a strong storm that recently whipped through Nuevo Laredo, my small trailer was severely damaged and my ingredients for making tacos were rotten when the storm ended. That is why I am asking for support to help rebuild my trailer and buy new equipment to heat the food for my customers. This loan will help me to continue generating income that will allow me to support the needs of my family.

I would like to ask for a loan of $950 dollars. More specifically, this loan money will be used for the reconstruction of my trailer and to purchase the necessary equipment for my kitchen operation. And if there are left over funds, I wish to purchase some more ingredients to meet the needs of my customers.

Thank you Kiva Lenders!

Español

Tengo casi 20 años de experiencia en la elaboración del tacos de barbacoa (mi comida mexicana favorita) en pequeño remolque. Este negocio ha sido mi fuente principal de vida para mi esposa, mis niños y propia. Desafortunadamente, debido a una fuerte tormenta que azotó recientemente en Nuevo Laredo, mi pequeño remolque fue dañado seriamente y de la misma manera los los ingredients. Por lo cual estoy pidiendo ayuda para reconstruir mi remolque y a comprar equipo nuevo para calentar los alimentos y seguir vendiendo a mis clientes. Este préstamo me ayudará a continuar generando ingresos que permitirá cubrir las necesidades de mi familia. Me gustaria solicitar un préstamo de $950 dólares. Y pagarlo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses, este dinero será utilizado para la reconstrucción de mi remolque el equipo necesario para calendar alimento en la cocina del remolque y si sobre fondos, deseo comprar algo de ingredientes para la elaboración de tacos y asi poder seguir vendiendo a mis clientes. Gracias por su ayuda.

loans.use: trailer rebuild, buy heat and cook equipment and some ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Open a second-hand clothing shop

loans.name: Simamao

texts.en: 30-year old Simamao comes from the small Samoan village of Saleilua.  She is married and has two children.  However, her husband is unemployed, making Simamao the breadwinner of the family.  She runs a small store in her village.  When fully stocked, Simamao can bring in a handsome profit, as the next general store is a mile away.  However, she is currently running low on inventory, and she is desperate for a loan to finance her next inventory purchase to ensure she can maintain a consistent supply for her local customers.  Her goal is to keep her customers satisfied and loyal.

loans.use: Buy merchandise and food for re-sale

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg has combined his love of the outdoors and healthy living with a successful rental and sales business catering to outdoor sports enthusiasts. He is based in Truskavyets, a little town near the beautiful Carpathian mountains in western Ukraine. This area is popular with tourists seeking active vacations during both the summer and winter seasons. 

Oleg rents and sells a variety of recreational equipment for people to enjoy in the outdoors. He also offers guided tours of the region along with food and lodging. He has extensive experience in his field and enjoys sharing with others. This has earned him a great reputation and a loyal clientele. Oleg makes about $600-$700 per month, enough to support himself, his wife and his son. He is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase additional rental equipment, including rock-climbing gear and paintball guns. This loan will help him improve his high quality services and provide great experiences for many more customers.

loans.use: Purchase outdoor equipment to upgrade his rental/sales business

loans.name: Luís

texts.en:
Since he was 15 years old, Luís had always liked animals. He raised chickens, ducks and pigeons in his house. His neighbors already knew him and began to buy these animals from him. When Luís got married, he continued to work on his business and also specialized in raising exotic animals such as doves, hens and peacocks. He already has a steady stream of clients and places to exhibit his animals, where he also delivers them.

The pens are in the backyard of his house and he checks and attends to the animals daily. Every weekend, Luís goes to the market and stores to offer his products. Besides this activity, Luís cooks at the community kitchens starting from 5:00 PM. These are his only sources of income.

Luís improved the structure of his pens implement a cleaning out system with a previous loan he received. He is now hopeful that he can invest in more exotic types of birds and poultry that are more profitable than the ones he raises now.

He is 37 years old, married with 3 children. His wife works at a company and supports him with the household expenses. Together they have been able to acquire their posessions—especially the house which they have changed from a house made of cane to a cement one. Theirs is a hard-working and humble family; his wishes are for his children to be able to finish school and so to have their incomes from work to help the family.

loans.use: Buy different types of birds

loans.name: Silvia Florentina

texts.es:
My name is Silvia E.. I have dedicated myself to the sale of consumer goods for the past 4 years and I am doing well but I need to offer a greater variety of products for sale. I am requesting the loan to purchase meats, dairy products and canned goods. My customers are very loyal. They appreciate the manner in which I provide service and the prices and quality of my goods. With the additional income, I wish to purchase a refrigerator to expand the products I offer and provide for my family, which is most important.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Silvia E. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, actividad que realizo hace 4 años en la cual me va bien, pero necesito tener mas variedad de productos para la venta, por eso estoy solicitando mi prestamo para poder comprar carnes, lacteos y embutidos, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les gusta la forma en que los atiendo y tambien la calidad y los precios de mis productos, con la ganancia que obtenga deseo poder comprar un refrigerador para tener mas productos que necesiten refrigeracion tambien alimentar mi familia que es lo mas importante.

loans.use:
Purchase of milk, cheese, canned goods, poultry, beef, butter and sausages

compra de leche, queso, embutidos, carnes de pollo y res, mantequilla, chorizos

loans.name: Alicia De La Cruz

texts.en:
Alicia became a client of FSMA six months ago, when she took her first loan which she invested to enlarge a small business she had started seven months before that. She sells ‘longaniza’ (spicy sausage), fried bananas, potatoes and some pâtés and natural juice.

Alicia is 32 years old and is a single mother of five children. On her own, she has to provide food and educate them; she also has to pay the rent for her house and be prepared for any emergency situation. At this time, her fried food business is her only source of income.

Alicia hopes her business can keep growing and she can have her own locale where she can run her business. With the loan requested, she will purchase raw materials in order to keep producing food and preparing and selling juice. That way, she will continue saving money and improve her large family’s living conditions. Alicia will also be closer to achieving her goal which is to have a cafeteria one of these days.

loans.use: To buy raw materials in order to keep on producing food for her fried food business

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Maria was born in Cajamarca and was a primary school teacher until six years ago, when she decided to sell clothes in the local market. Three and a half years ago, she opened a convenience store in her home.

She is a kind, hard working mother of three children (the youngest is adopted) who struggles daily to give her children the best so they may receive the appropriate education.

She is asking for the loan to purchase goods for the convenience store and to be able to rent the home she wants to build for additional income.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and house construction

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio L. is 67 years old, married and has three adult children, and one of his daughters works with him. Antonio works in media marketing, ranging from publicity and advertisements to professional service presentations, promotions, making Web sites, technical supports, etc. On top of this, he also runs a small business with 12 employees that does human resource consulting.

With the loan Antonio will purchase furniture for the office. He is in the green shirt in the photo and is standing with one of his employees in charge of commercials.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Antonio L. tiene 67 años, es casado, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad de los cuales una hija trabaja con él. Antonio se dedica al Marketing de Medios, como por ejemplo publicidad, anuncios comerciales, presentación de Servicios de profesionales, promociones, elaboración de páginas Web, soporte técnico, etc.

Además de eso tiene otra micro empresa que se dedica a la consultaría de Recursos Humanos donde da empleo a 12 personas.

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en su publicitaria para la compra de muebles para la empresa. En la foto es el señor de remera verde que aparece junto con uno de sus empleados encargados de la edición de los comerciales.

loans.use: Purchase office furniture.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria has been a member of the community bank “Cocharacas” for two years. Through the community bank she learned to be responsible, punctual, how to educate her children, and to save.

Victoria is 44 years old. She is married and has four children. Victoria lives in the district of Acosyinchos, which is 90 minutes outside of the city of Ayacucho.

Together with her husband Victoria weaves a variety of products. She sells them to an intermediary and sometimes sells them in Ayacucho. She uses laborers to sell them at local markets.

Victoria needs a loan of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she well use to buy wood and pay her laborers.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Victoria plans to use her savings to pay for her children’s education. Her dream is to own a home in the city of Ayacucho, and that her children will be professionals.

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she well use to buy wood and pay her laborers.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
Mario is 52 years old and lives in the Reconciliacion Villa. He's married and has 3 children. His wife, who has always been a great help to him, works in a cafeteria, and he works doing public transportation since from 8 years ago. Currently he is owner of a refrigeration plant, and through his many responsibilities, they have gotten ahead. With hard work and good financial habits, they have made improvements to their humble home. Now he is requesting a loan in order to further improve his house. This is how this gentleman has improved his quality of life and has made his small home better for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Mario de 52 años de edad vive en Villa Reconciliación casado y con 3 hijos, su esposa que siempre ha significado un valioso apoyo para él, trabaja en un cafetín y él de transportista desde hace 8 años, es dueño de un taller de refrigeración y es en sus múltiples actividades que han logrado salir adelante, con esfuerzo y buen comportamiento de crédito han mejorado su humilde vivienda. Solicita un crédito para realizar una mejora en su casa. Así este señor ha ido mejorando calidad de vida y haciendo de su pequeña vivienda un hogar agradable para su familia.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to improve his home. (Comprar materiales de construcción para su vivienda)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy leather, string, paint, and footwear.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel started her business in order to support her children, who - in her own words - are her reason for living. When she divorced, Isabel had many financial problems, as she needed to pay off debts which her husband left her. In addition, he gave her no child support, which is the reason that she began her business 9 years ago. In the beginning she only had a grill outside her parents´ home where she started selling food. Now she has established a business selling roasted chickens and thanks to this business, has been able to maintain and educate her 4 children.

She currently needs a loan for US$1,175, which will be repaid in 6 months, to invest in some publicity and promotional articles for the business, as she is about to open a new point of sale. With your help, Isabel will reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel inició el negocio para mantener a sus hijos que son la razón de su vida, según sus palabras. Al divorciarse Isabel tuvo muchos problemas económicos, ya que necesitaba pagar deudas que le dejó su esposo, y además el no le daba pensión para la manutención de sus hijos; por lo que comenzó hace nueve años con su negocio, al principio solo con una parrilla afuera de la casa de sus padres, donde empezó a vender comida a la gente, hasta que logro establecerse como un negocio de venta de pollo asado, gracias a este negocio ha podido mantener y darle educación a sus 4 hijos.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $1,175 que pagara en 6 meses para invertirlos en algo de publicidad y artículos promocionales de su negocio ya que ya que abrirá un nuevo punto de venta. Con tu ayuda Isabel alcanzara sus metas.

loans.use: Invest in publicity and promotional articles.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
Anvar S. lives with his family in Rudaki. He is married and has six children. Additionally, his daughter-in-law and his small grand daughter lives with him. They have a big family, but all of them help each other. His wife works in gold embroidery. She sews and embroiders traditional dresses for brides. He works in the Dekhkon market where he has a shop. He sells vegetables. He wants to take out a loan to increase his product turnover. He can pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Шокиров Анвар живет со своей семьей в районе Рудаки. Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. Кроме того вместе с ним живет сноха и маленькая внучка. У них большая семья , но они все помогают друг другу. Его жена занимается золотошитьем. Шьет и вышивает нацианальные наряды для невест. Сам он работает на рынке «Дехкон» , где имеет торговую точку. Продает овощи. Хочет получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот . Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 39 years old. She is a married woman with 4 children aged 19, 15, 14, and 12. She became a milk seller in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

In the past, Helena has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Helena now hopes for a loan to buy more milk for her business.

loans.use: to buy more milk for her business

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila baji is married to A. R.. She lives in the small city of Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last two years. She has no children. Jamila baji is a housewife. Her husband is a salesman and sells spices. He buys spices from different shops and sells them in different markets. Presently he has no money to buy inventory. Therefore, Jamila baji is applying for a loan to buy spices to restart her husband's business.

Jamila is joined in her loan group by four others. Fatima baji and Ishrat baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Safia baji wants a loan to buy wheat to re-sell. Khalida baji wants a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more inentory

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
La señora Nimia, socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Las perlitas”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Desde hace tres años se dedica a la costura y a la venta de productos de belleza. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, en el Jr. Libertad  Nº 498. Los clientes son sus vecinos y amigos que viven en la misma ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de hilos para remallar, telas de diferentes colores y calidades, también pagará la última letra de su máquina remalladota. Nimia confecciona ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, también quiere invertir en perfumes, y desodorante, los cuales son los productos que más solicitan los clientes y que tienen mayor rotación.

Nimia tiene 51 años de edad y es natural de Tarapoto. Su meta es implementar su taller con una vitrina y más máquinas de coser.
texts.en:
Nimia, member of the group "Las perlitas", lives in the department and province of San Martín, District of Tarapoto. For three years Nimia has worked as a seamstress and in the sales of beauty products. The business is located in her own home. Her customers are neighbors and friends from the same city. With this loan of $350 US, which will be paid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of thread for sewing, fabrics of different colors and types, and she will also pay the rest of her loan on her sewing machine. Nimia makes clothing for women, men, and children, and would also like to invest in perfumes and deodorant, which are the products most requested by her customers and have the greatest rotation. Nimia is 51 years old and is a native of Tarapoto. Her goal is to install a display area in her shop and add more sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the purchase of thread, fabric, and to pay for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Uth

texts.en: Uth Y., 48, is married and has three children. The family lives in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. Uth earns income growing rice and raising pigs, and typically makes US$2.5 per day. Her husband has an ice-cream sales business, and he also makes about US$2.5 per day. Uth Y. would like a loan of US$300 to be able to purchase feed for pigs as well as additional pigs for breeding.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs and feed for pigs

loans.name: Erika Junieth

texts.es: La Joven Erika Junieth solicita a AFODENIC financiamiento de su primer  crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, construir los servicios higienicos de su casa, trabaja como conserje desde hace 2 años en la Administracion del Juzgado de Nueva Guinea, a pesar que esta clienta no tiene hijos ayuda a su madre y a su abuelita con los gastos del hogar ya que son de escasos recursos económicos, ella se caracteriza por ser una joven muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive en zona # 8 de Nueva Guinea, desde  niña ha aprendido a trabajar y a valorar lo que mas ama que es su familia,  actualmente esta estudiando una licenciatura en la Universidad  Martin Lutero, su sueño es llegar a ser una profesional para servirle al pais,  y  tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia ya que son humildes.
texts.en:
The young Erika Junieth requests from Afodenic her first loan to invest in the remodelling of her home, to put in a bathroom. She has been working as a security guard for the past 2 years at the Courthouse Administration of New Guinea. Although she does not have children of her own she helps her mother and her grandmother with the household expenses, seeing as the financial resources are scarce. She is a very responsible young woman, honest and hard working. She lives in the Zona #8 in New Guinea. Since she was a girl she has learned to work and to value what she loves the most, her family. Currently she is working towards a university degree at Martin Lutero University. Her deram is to become a professional, to serve her country, and to have stable employement so that she can help her poor family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom.

loans.name: Guida

texts.es: Guida es madre soltera, vive junto a sus 3 hijos que están estudiando y la apoyan mucho. Su dedicación a la venta de comida logró que pudiera construir en su propio domicilio su pequeño restaurante, donde por las noches vende salchipollo (salchicha y pedazos de pollo fritos), debido a que sus clientes se lo pedían, por su buena atención y sazón, se ha ganado el cariño y respeto de sus comensales, ete negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años, le gusta mucho cocinar bien para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos. Le es rentable, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona y le va excelente, nos cuenta. Es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar mesas y sillas, para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Guida is a single mother who lives with her 3 children who are students and support her a lot. Her dedication selling food enable her to be able to build a small restaurant in her own home, where in the evenings she sells “salchipollo” (sausage and pieces of fried chicken), as this is what her customers ask her to prepare, and because of her good attention and seasoning, she has won the love and respect of her companions. She has had this business for 10 years. She very much enjoys cooking well so that her customers will be satisfied. Her business is profitable, as it is located in a good area and it is going well, she tells us. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to be punctual with her payments. With the money she wants to buy tables and chairs to provide a more inviting environment for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture for her restaurant.

loans.name: Temitope

texts.en:
Temitope is 29 years old and she is single. She sells rechargeable phone cards and she also earns money making calls. She has been in this business for the past three years.

Temitope is the lady in the blue jean skirt in the picture.

She needs a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thank you to all who will make this loan possible

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Don Manuel tiene 33 años de edad, habita en memorial sandino, junto con su esposa que le tiene dos hijos de 5 y 7 años de edad, uno de los niños va a clase a primer grado en el colegio del barrio, su negocio es la venta de leña y presta el servicio de acarreo en un carretón de caballos, que ha sido su subsistencia ya que la gente ocupa muchos de sus servicios por los bajos costos, su esposa tiene una pequeña pulpería que día a día va creciendo y esperan salir cada día en mejores condiciones, el inicio este negocio por que su papa trabajaba ganándose la vida en este trabajo, y aprendió mucho,es un trabajo cansado, y que la mayor parte anda uno sucio pero es rentable y desea superarse para poder ayudar a su familia, con este préstamo que afodenic, le esta brindando es para hacer las paredes de su casa y poder gozar de una vivienda digna, para esto va  comprar materiales de construcción, como piedra, arena, cemento, hierro entre otros. Sus planes es comprar otro caballo para seguir dando mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Manuel is 33 and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood with his wife and two children, 5 and 7, one of whom is in first grade at the local school. Manuel sells firewood and provides transportation services using his horse and wagon. He spends a lot of time serving his clients for a very low cost, so he just gets by. His wife has a small general store that is growing by the day. They hope to make daily improvements to their quality of life. Manuel chose his business because he learned a lot from his father, who earned his living the same way. His work is tiring and fairly dirty, but it is profitable and he wants to better himself so he can help his family. Manuel is seeking a loan from AFODENIC to build walls for his house so he can enjoy a decent home. He'll need to buy construction materials, such as stone, sand, cement, iron, etc. His plans include buying another horse so he can continue providing better service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build walls for his house

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana Rosa C. D. V., ResiD. en Zacatecoluca, junto a su hija, la cuál es madre soltera. Ambas deben trabajar arduamente para poder sostener su hogar y brindarle todas las necesidades básicas a su nieto. Ana Rosa posee su propio negocio, el cuál consiste en vender D. manera ambulante ropa en Zacatecoluca y Santiago Nonualco, así también por las tardes venD. en su propia casa, fruta, helados y charamuscas, las cuales son un tipo D. golosina típica D. El Salvador y son elaboran con jugos naturales los cuales se colocan en una pequeña bolsa plástica y se congela, ella logra vender muy bien este tipo D. golosinas, debido a que en los pueblos es costumbre que los niños coman frutas y charamuscas por las tardes. Ana Rosa solícita un préstamo a través del cuál obtenga el capital necesario para poder aumentar la cantidad D. ropa y poder elaborar más golosinas, y D. esta manera obtener mayores ganancias las cuales contribuyen al sostenimiento D. su hogar y así también a mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su pequeño nieto.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa C. D. V. lives with her daughter and her grandson in Zacatecoluca.Ana Rosa's daughter is a sinlge mother, and both women must work hard to support their home and to proviD. for the child. Ana Rosa sells clothing on the streets in Zacatecoluca and Santiago Nualco. In the afternoons, when she is back home, she sells fruit, ice cream and charamuscas (popsicles), which are maD. by freezing fruit juice in small plastic bags. Sales are good because children in the small towns are used to eat fruit and charamuscas in the afternoon. Ana Rosa is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing and more fruit to make charamuscas. With this loan she expects to produce more and obtain higher profits to support her home and to proviD. a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothing wholesale

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline M. is currently in the business of selling bags at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Jackline is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is the head teacher. She has four children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.ru: Равшан Жалилов 1975 года рождения женат имеет 2 детей. Он закончил школу и сразу пошел работать мастером ремонтных работ. Он помогал дяде ремонтировать квартиры и дома. Но работа оказалась немного тяжелой и он также начал заниматься откормом скота. Он получает кредит для покупки скота. Его жена ухаживает за скотом, полученное молоко продает, от этого и есть маленький доход. Равшан и его жена планируют расширить коровник и  прикупить еще несколько коров . Они откормят и продадут быстрее, если дадут высокую плату.
texts.en:
Ravshan J. was born in 1975, he is married and has two children. He finished school and started working as a repairman. He was helping his uncle to repair apartments and houses. But this job turned out to be a little too hard and he then started a business raising cattle. He takes out a loan to buy cattle. His wife watches after the livestock and sells the milk from which she makes small income. Rashvan and his wife plan to expand the cow house and buy a few more cows. They will feed them and sell faster if the get a higher price.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Adiaratou

texts.fr:
Madame  Adiaratou O. est mariée et mère de 4 enfants (2 garçons et 2 filles). Elle est née le 24 Janvier 1974 à Sikasso, 3eme région administrative de la république du Mali.  Elle vit avec son mari et leurs enfants à Kadiolo  dans le quartier Noumousso.
Elle mène son activité de commerce d’articles divers depuis 6 ans (vente de draps, de wax, d’ encens, de jus et de la glace). Expérimentée en raison des années d’activité, elle le fait avec réussite.
Elle est à sa deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt précédent a été remboursé sans difficulté. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt un congélateur,  des tissus  et des draps de lit. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso, à Sikasso ville, à Kadiolo et environnants. Elle vend au comptant et à crédit (en gros et en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car elle ambitionne acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adiaratou O. is married and the mother of 4 children (2 sons and 2 daughters). She was born on January 24, 1974 in Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. She lives with her husband and children in Kadiolo in the Noumousso district.

She has had her business selling general merchandise (bedsheets, "wax" brand African print cloth, incense, juice and ice) for 6 years. As she had had a lot of experience, she succeeds very well at this business. She is on her second loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The preceding loan was reimbursed without difficulty.

With this loan she expects to buy a freezer, some fabric, and bedsheets. She buys her merchandise in Burkino Faso, in the town of Sikasso, and in Kadiolo and its surroundings. She sells for cash or credit (wholesale and retail) to a clientele composed of women and men.

She expects to earn a monthly average profit of 45,000 F CFA of which part will be used to help her husband cover household expenses and the rest will be put into savings since her ambition is to be able to buy a plot of land on which to build a house in the town of Sikasso.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Kossi  Agbenyenu

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus le commerce de papiers pour emballages et couverture, ses clients emballent chez lui des cadeaux de mariage et d’anniversaire. Son stock actuel de papier d'emballage ne peut lui permettre de satisfaire ses clients, il demande à WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 35 lots de papiers d’emballages et divers. Il est célibataire et travaille dur pour subvenir à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
This gentleman earns an income from commerce in paper products for wrapping and covering. His customers come to him to wrap their marriage gifts and birthday presents. His current stock of wrapping paper prevents him from satisfying his customers. He's asking WAGES for his first loan to buy 25 lots of wrapping paper and various items. He is unmarried and works hard to support himself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper for wrapping and covering

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is married and the mother of one child. She lives at Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana with her family. She is 23 years old. She runs a mini shop and has been selling items like blouses and skirts, women's slippers and dressing bags for the past year. She gets her stock of goods from Kumasi which is the nearest city center but she is unable to bring back more.

Patricia is constrained by lack of funds for the business. She needs this loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to be more resourced to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Asomdwe’ which means Peace.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, ladies wear, and slippers

loans.name: Aydalina Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Aydalina Muños, mujer trabajadora que logro poner su propio negocio una pulpería donde vende productos variados el cual administra desde cuatro años, tiene la edad de 38 años, reside en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua,  su esposo es comerciante, le tiene dos hijos uno de 19 y otro de 3 años de edad, el mayor es independiente, su negocio lo inicio con dinero que su esposo dio y prestamos en Afodenic  con esto ha logrado incrementar su inventario. Con este préstamo va a comprar granos básicos, productos lácteos, carnes entre otros, para ofrecer a sus clientes. Sus planes es poder hacer grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Aydalina Muños is a hard-working woman who managed to start her own general store, where she sells a variety of products, four years ago. She is 38 years old, and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. Her husband is a merchant, and they have two children ages 19 and 3. The eldest is now living independently. She started her enterprise with money from her husband, as well as loans from Afodenic that have helped her to increase her inventory. With this loan, she will invest in basic grains, dairy products, meats, and other items, to offer to her customers. Her plan is to grow her store into a large business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and dairy products.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen S. is from the village of Polo Pitogo. She is 34 years old. Helen is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Helen is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: La Superacion Group

texts.en:
Guillermina S. is a budding entrepreneur who is currently employed in retail clothing sales. She sells new, fashionable clothes from her home and in the streets. The selling of used clothes in the Dominican is big business, but Guillermina has decided to sell new clothes in an effort to separate herself from the masses who are selling used clothes. Her clothes may be more expensive, but the newness of clothes is an effective selling tool.

Even though Guillermina has been successful selling new clothes, she needs capital to really expand her business. It had been very frustrating for her, because she knows that she could expand her business, but she couldn’t find anyone to lend her money. She was extremely ecstatic to learn about Esperanza, and you could tell by listening and talking to her that she was eager to receive her loan and begin investing and growing her business.

loans.use: To purchase a more clothes to sell in her neighborhood

loans.name: Lalotea

texts.en:
Lalotea S. is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Mulifanua. She is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Lalotea operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Lalotea has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 650 Samoan tala (about $246 US) a month from these activities.

In 2005, Lalotea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lalotea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 tala from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase a fishing boat. Lalotea is now requesting a new loan of 1000 tala which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her third from SPBD. Lalotea plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is from the village of Sta. Catalina of Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Samuel who helps her in their small charcoal production business. She is glad that they also have a small farm which gives them an additional source of income. The couple have three children, all of whom are currently studying. Jane hopes that they will be able to finish their studies so that they can have a better standard of living when they have families of their own.

Jane collects wood to make charcoal and sometimes also buys it for this purpose. To help her business grow, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. The income from her business is essential to her family because it is used to provide their basic daily needs.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Esperanza 2&3 Group

texts.en:
Antoinet is the group coordinator of the group Esperanza (Hope), which is based in the rural area surrounding Santiago, a city in the mid-west region of the country where electricity and running water (not suitable for drinking) is unreliable at best. Here she makes her home with her husband and three primary-school-aged children in a simple rented house of cement blocks and a tin roof. Access to medical supplies and nutrition are also limited – it has been over two years since she was last able to see a doctor and her family typically consumes only two meals per day for lack of regular income.

Despite these obstacles, Antoinet remains confident that her future will be better, and she has come to Esperanza to request her first loan. With this loan she plans to purchase yuca, potatoes, beef, chicken, salami and other cooking items to open a comedor (cafeteria). She hopes that this business will provide a regular income for her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase yuca, potatoes, meat, chicken and salami

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra B. is from the village of Danao. She is 30 years old. Myra is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Myra owns & operates a business making & selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Myra is just starting this business.

In 2008, Myra joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Myra is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Myra from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina F. is from the village of Dimalco Bonifacio in Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Gina is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products and dry goods in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Gina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save for future needs.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es:
La señora Aura Estela R. posee su propio negocio de pulpería el cuál es atendido por ella misma en su establecimiento ubicado en el mercado El bisne del departamento de Chinandega donde atiende a diario ofreciendo los productos varios como jabones, ase, gaseosas, huevos y otros comestibles ofreciéndolos a todos sus clientes que le visitan.

Actualmente, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para la compra de los productos para la pulpería y así continuar en su actividad para lograr la satisfacción de sus clientes que a diario le visitan para comprar los productos ofrecidos en la pulpería.
texts.en:
Señora Aura Estela R. owns her own convenience store which is attended by herself in her establishment located in the El bisne market of the department of Chinandega. There she attends daily offering various products such as soaps, cleaning products, carbonated waters, eggs and other foods, offering them to all the clients that visit her. At present, she has responded to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of the products for the store and thus to continue in her business to achieve the satisfaction of her clients that daily visit her to buy the products offered in the store.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her convenience store

loans.name: Mary Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Mary es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad D. Ancara, del distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 45 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 06 hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Ancara , ella no tuvo la ocasión D. estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 3 años y su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. ganado ovino.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino y también algunos balones D. gas para venderlo en las ferias D. la zona.  Paralelamente se dedica a las labores propias del campo.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando y generar sus propios ingresos.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros.
texts.en:
Mary is a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank located in the Ancara community in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 45, married, and has six children. She lives in the Ancara community. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan for 300 PEN allowed her to increase the capital in her business of buying and selling sheep. She currently needs a loan for 2,000 PEN, which will allow her to buy sheep. She will also buy tanks of gas to sell at the regional fairs. She does her own field work at the same time. Her biggest desire is to keep working to generate her own income. She likes the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and tanks of gas

loans.name: Chinbat

texts.en:
D. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and seven-year-old daughter in the Uvurkhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and his daughter attends a local secondary school. With the help of his wife, D. operates a wooden product business in his town. He began his business in 2000 after borrowing his friend’s woodworking tools. In 2005, he received a loan from XacBank, one of the largest banks in Mongolia, in order to purchase his own woodworking tools. Because he has been in business for almost a decade, D. has increased his business experience and his customer base. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan in order to purchase wood and other necessary materials for his woodworking business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

loans.use: To purchase wood and other necessary materials for his woodworking business

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
H. Tungalag is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger". Her oldest son, Altangerel, is in college, and her youngest, Nemehbayar, attends a local secondary school. Her husband is a driver and manages a transportation service. Tungalag operates a clothing trading business in her town. She sells a variety of clothing items, most of which she imports from China to her many customers. Tungalag started her business in 2001 with capital of 400,000 tugrugs (~280 USD). After years of successful operations she has managed to increase her working capital to a level exceeding 1,500,000 tugrugs (~1,050 USD) today. Her earnings have enabled her to by a car for her husband to use as a taxi. Tungalag is always looking toward the future and hopes her continued success will allow her to provide for her family. She says, “I want my children to become educated people.” She is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug (~840 USD) loan to purchase clothes from China to sell in her business.

About XacBank:

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dellilah

texts.en:
Dellilah M. is 56 and widowed with 3 children.  She owns a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  Dellilah has 3 years of experience in this business.  Dellilah needs a loan of WST $2000 to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates & utensils, and coal.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Dellilah joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Dellilah's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Dellilah M. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates & utensils, and coal

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en:
T. Marusya is a 50-year-old single mother of one teenage son. She lives in the Arkhangai province of central Mongolia. Her son is a student at a university, and Marusya operates a dairy retail business in her local market. 

She began her business in 1999 with a working capital of 100,000 MNT and in the eleven years of being in business, she has managed to increase her working capital to 3,100,000 MNT. She plans to continue to grow her business so that she can help her son in the future as he gets married and eventually starts his own family. 

Marusya is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large variety of wholesale dairy products which she can sell from her stand for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Puth

texts.en: Puth S., age 63, is married and resides with his wife and child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. He is a doctor, earning approximately an income of US$ 10 per day. By doing so, he is able to cover family expenses. He has been in this business since 1969. His wife is a tailor, earning an income of US$ 5 per day. The standard of living of this family improved since they have been in these businesses, so they want to have a loan to expand their businesses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to buy more materials to aid his wife's business of tailoring. This is his first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: buy more materials to expand his wife's tailoring business

loans.name: Ambignakola Group

texts.fr:
Les   femmes du groupe  Ambignakola ont en moyenne  39 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à Zanfina un des villages  de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et font  l’achat vente, du bois de chauffe, de condiments alimentaires et de céréales.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les 4 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Ambignakola sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 2 tonnes de céréales et des colis de plusieurs variétés de condiments alimentaires.
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur place auprès des producteurs et grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes d’une façon ambulante et au marché de Fana, généralement au comptant, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000FCFA qui servira à essentiellement étoffer leur fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group Ambignakola are, on average, 39 years old, with 4 children each and they all live in traditional families in Zafina, one of the towns of Fana, which is a county of Dioïla, the second administrative region of the republic of Mali. These women know one another through neighborhood connections. They sell firewood, food condiments and cereals/ grains. Having fully repaid 4 previous loans, the women of the group Ambignakola are requesting their fifth group loan, which they will use to purchase 2 tons of cereals/ grains and packages of several varieties of condiments. They supply themselves mostly locally from farmers and wholesalers. They do their sales as they walk around town and also in the market of Fana, usually for cash, to a clientele composed of women and men. They envision each earning an average monthly income of 15,000FCFA, which they will use to reinforce their business' funds.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory sells clothes and bags of garri (cassava flakes) at retail prices to make a living in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Garri is made from cassava and it is a staple food in Nigeria. She is 30 years old and married with a child. Her husband also works to support their home. She is a friendly and happy woman. She says her only challenge is lack of funds and she hopes to overcome this challenge. She needs a loan amount NGN 150,000 to purchase more clothes and bags of garri (cassava flakes) to sell. She hopes to grow her business. She loves her business and family dearly and she hopes to excel in life. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and bags of garri to sell.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheng K. is 46 years old. She is a villager in Daeum Pring village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Phally Meach, are vegetable sellers who earn a small income to support their family. They own two motorcycles and a Khmer trailer to support their business. Since their business is going well, they want to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sokheng K. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more vegetables. The rest of the loan she will use to buy fish to sell. Mrs. Sokheng K. is a mother of four children. One of the children is a seamstress in a garment factory, two stay at home and support their parent's business, and the youngest is 10 years old. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is single. She has received senior high education.  Elizabeth prepares palm oil for sale at Abura. To prepare her locally made palm oil, she gets her palm nuts from the farmers at their farms.

She washes them then boils them for a while until they become tender. She scoops the cooked fruit into a big mortar and pounds gently with a pestle so as not to damage the nut.
