She then adds water to the pounded fruit. The pounded fruit is squeezed and filtered to get the juice out and remove the chaff. (The chaff can be used to light charcoal fires).The juice boils again and the fresh oil floats to the surface of the pot. It is scooped into yet another pot to cool. Fresh oil is eaten with roasted yams or plantains.

Elizabeth uses her income to pay utility bills and accommodation.  Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more palm fruit to process palm oil for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more palm fruit to process palm oil for sale.

loans.name: Mrs. Kimly San Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank is comprised of seventeen people, living in Krang Ta Mung village in Takeo province. Mrs. Kimly S. is a village bank president, selected by all the members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in order improve the living conditions their families. Her problem is that it is time to farm their rice field. So, to improve production rice, Mrs. Kimly S. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, to hire farming laborers to plow the rice field, and rest of the loan she wants to start a new business breeding piglets. Her husband, Mr. Kork Horn, is a construction worker. They have three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is helping to do farming, and the other is studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, to hire farming laborers to plow rice field.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang N., 38, lives in Battambang Province and earns a low income. She is a good and determined mother who tries to feed her four children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a bicycle repairman.
Neang N. sells fresh fish in the market to earn a living. Every day in the late morning, she goes to a place that is full of fisherman to buy fish in bulk. Then she hurries to the market, where she sells the fish retail. Neang N. is requesting a loan to purchase an old vehicle to transport the fish. With any remaining cash from the loan, she will build a small pigpen where she plans to raise a few pigs for extra revenue.

loans.use: To purchase an old vehicle for transportation

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An L., 37 years old, lives in the province of Siem Reap, Cambodia, where she owns and farms a plot of land next to her house, growing mushrooms to sell when they come to maturity. She plants her crops twice a year, and she was taught how to grow mushrooms by her grandparents. She has been married for many years to her husband, but this couple has no children yet. Her husband assists with her in planting mushrooms. In addition, he also teaches his nearby villagers how to plant mushrooms well for a fee. 

Mrs. An L. has requested a loan to purchase essential equipment that she uses to establish more locations for growing mushrooms.

loans.use: To establish more locations for growing mushrooms

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 47 años, comparte su vida con su pareja y sus dos hijos, Joel de 17 años y Jaquelin  de 14 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas de 1 año se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza, negocio al cual incursionó gracias al consejo de sus amigas, quienes frecuentemente le comentaban las buenas ganancias que obtenían con esta labor. Es así que Gladys decidió trabajar en este rubro, logrando obtener experiencia, además sus amigas y vecinas continuamente le hacen variados pedidos de sus productos, por lo que espera tener muchas ganancias. Por otra parte, también se dedica al tejido a mano de prendas de vestir como: ropa de bebe, chalinas guantes, entre otros, generándole un ingreso extra a su economía. En un futuro desea instalar otro negocio, como una librería y bazar a la vez, pero dentro de su propia casa, pues cree que es un negocio fijo y mucho más rentable y seguro. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y siempre se caracterizo por ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar variados productos de belleza, para que pueda tener en stock.
texts.en:
Gladys is 47 years old. She shares her life with her husband and two children, Joel 17 years old and Jaquelin 14 years old. They live together in their own house. She has been selling beauty products for more than 1 year, a business she got into thanks to the advice of her friends. They often mentioned the good earnings they got from this job. That is how Gladys decided to work at this trade and got experience. Her friends and neighbors continually give her orders for her products that she hopes to earn a lot from. On the other hand, she also works hand knitting clothing, baby clothes and gloves among other things, to generate additional earnings. She would like to start another business in the future, like a bookstore and shop together but inside her own house. She thinks it is a more stable business and more profitable and safer. This is her first loan with MFP. She has always been known to be responsible with her payments. She would like to buy varied beauty products to have in stock with the loan she is applying for.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase varied beauty products.

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda, de 37 años, es una mujer alegre y emprendedora que vive con su pareja Walter de 38 años, con quien tiene 2 hermosos hijos. Está familia vive juntos en su casa propia. Sus dos hijos son su motivación para esmerarse en el trabajo cada día, por eso desde hace 5 años, se dedica a cultivar café y plátano, además es negociante de frutas oriundas de la selva peruana, siendo éstas adquiridas de sus vecinos que producen dichas frutas, de las cuales compra, los encajona y los traslada hacia los mercados de “Huancayo” y “Lima” para su comercialización. Por otro lado su cónyuge brinda el servicio de transporte público, y durante los días que descansa, ayuda a Herlinda en la agricultura y en el negocio. Ella disfruta de la tranquilidad del campo, sin embargo le parece difícil tener que trasladar sus productos hasta los mercados, por eso los acopia lo cosechado en su tienda. Aunque este oficio, no la desalienta le parece sacrificado pero a la vez rentable, porque gracias a las utilidades, puede brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia, por tal motivo piensa continuar plantando café pero sobre todo incrementar y surtir de productos en su establecimiento. Esta es la segunda  vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y asegura que continuará laborando de manera activa en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más frutas para continuar con la comercialización al por mayor y además comprar llantas para el carro de su esposo.
texts.en:
Herlinda, age 37, is a happy and enterprising woman. She lives with her life partner, 38 year old Walter, and their two beautiful children. This family lives together in their own house. Her two children are the motivation for her to do her best at work everyday. She has been growing coffee and bananas for five years. Also, she is a businesswoman selling fruit from the Peruvian jungle. She gets them from her neighbors who produce these fruits. She buys them, boxes them, and takes them to the Huancayo and Lima markets to sell. Her life partner offers public transportation services. On his days off he helps Herlinda with the farming and in the business. She enjoys the tranquility of the fields. Nevertheless, it is difficult for her to take her products to the markets. That is why she stocks her store with the harvest. Even though this job does not discourage her, it is seemingly self-sacrificing. At the same time it is profitable. Thanks to the profits she is able to give an adequate quality of life to her family. That is why she plans to continue planting coffee, and most of all, she will increase her products and stock her establishment with them. This is her second loan with MFP. She pledges to continue working in an active manner in her communal bank. She will use the requested loan to buy more fruit in order to continue selling it wholesale. She will also buy tires for her husband’s car.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fruit and sell it wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more timber to fix beds, chairs and other funiture

loans.name: Rispha

texts.en:
Rispha J. is a woman of 33 yearsof age, married to Stephen Maiyo and together they have four children. They live in Strawberg in the outskirts of Eldoret town. She has a cafe in the same area where she sells cooked food.  She has been in business for five years and earns a monthly income of six thousand shillings.

This will be Rispha's sixth loan with Kiva partner KADET. She plans to buy cooking fat for 6500 shillings, five trays of eggs, six bundles of baking flour, etc.  She plans to support her children by paying their school fees and buying them food with the additional income she will earn.

In the future she hopes to educate her children to the highest level and also to provide for their basic needs such as food, clothes and shelter.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, eggs, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith K. lives in the Ntinda Kulambiro neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of her mother. Edith has a business sewing sweaters. She has been in this business for 2 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Edith sells her products at nearby schools by means of wholesale/retail.  Edith has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more thread and needles for making sweaters.  The main business challenges for Edith are transportation and seasonality. She also generates additional income through rental rooms and rearing chickens. Edith lives in a home that she owns and has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, food and school fees. Edith's goal for her business is to one day own a sweater factory.

loans.use: To buy more thread and needles for making sweaters

loans.name: Ngalla

texts.en:
Ngalla M. B. is a married man with four children between nine years and one year old. His business is located at Shibu Tumaini in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites--not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. 

He has been selling shoes to the local people for the last four years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is insufficient funds. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more shoes to expand his business and sell at wholesale to other retailers. 

He also hopes to diversify his business so that when shoes sales are low, he still can continue with his business profitably. He describes himself as patient, determined and open minded.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: kodzo est un homme de 36 ans, il est un enseignant de profession. pour accroître ses revenu il s'est lancé dans le commerce de détail de cartes de recharges téléphoniques. il  a une ancienneté de 3 ans dans ce commerce et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. la demande actuelle de sa clientèle est élevée. Il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 2 cartons de cartes de recharges ILLICO, 5 cartons de cartes de recharge TOGOCELL et 5 cartons de recharges MOOV. Avec ce stock il compte satisfaire toutes sa clientèle. il est marié et père d'un enfant.
texts.en: Kodzo, 36, is a teacher. To increase his income, he  also sells rechargeable telephone cards. He has been doing this for three years and buys his stock at the big market in Lomé. His clientele is made up of all sorts of people. The demand from his clientele is presently higher so he is asking WAGES for a loan to buy two boxes of ILLICO brand rechargeable phone cards, five boxes of TOGOCELL, and five boxes of MOOV. With this amount  of inventory, he believes he can satisfy the needs of all his customers. He is married and the father of one child.

loans.use: purchase of a number of boxes of rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Beatrice Auma

texts.en:
Beatrice B. is 27 years old and has four children between 3 and 7 years old. She is married to Ezekiel B.. 

Beatrice has a hotel (a mini restaurant) that she has been running for the past three years. She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD and has a good credit history with KADET. Her monthly income comes to 18,000 Kenyan shillings per month. She intends to use the money to buy some utensils and cooking ingredients for her hotel. The profits made will basically be used to pay school fees for her children and to cater for the family needs.

Her hopes and dreams are to see her business grow and to open another hotel in the neighboring town.

loans.use: Buy utensils and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Momo

texts.en:
Momo is a married woman with one boy aged 12 who is attending school. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is clothing.

She operates a restaurant from home, and neighbours and passers by are her major customers. Momo faces competition from nearby restaurant operators. She hopes to build her own home in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings she wants to purchase packets of washing soap, cooking oil, rice, maize and beans for her restaurant. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase packets of washing soap, cooking oil, rice, maize and beans for her restaurant.

loans.name: Eva Concepcion

texts.es:
la sra. Eva R. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pulpería desde hace varios años y vende productos de la canasta básica familiar. su pulperia esta ubicada en la colonia Simón Azcona frente a la Escuela Rafael Pineda Ponce, Eva administra muy bien su negocio ya que lo atiende personalmente,  de este negocio le ha dado la crianza a sus hijos ya que enviudo desde hace mas de 10 años y una vez faltándole su esposo lucho y siguió adelante con el fin de sacar adelante a sus hijos, su negocio es bien visitado por sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería para tener mas surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eva R. has had a general store for several years and sells staple goods. Her store is in the community Simon Azcona, in front of the school Rafael Pineda Ponce.
 
She manages her business very well because she does it personally and her costumers visit it regularly. It has been her household only source of income since she has been a widow for over 10 years. After her husband passed away, she continued to work hard to make sure her children are well provided for.  

The loan will be used to buy goods to stock up her store.

loans.use: To buy staple goods for her store,

loans.name: Wilfred Kimutai

texts.en:
Wilfred Kimutai K. has been selling new clothes in Eldoret for the past nine years. From this business he is able to earn a profit of Kshs 15,500 per month. Wilfred is 31 years old, married to Hellen Cheplagat Mutai and they have one child who is 4 years old. 

He is applying for his seventh loan from KADET LTD of KES 50,000 after successfully paying back his other loans. He plans to use the funds to buy supplies of various kinds of new clothes to sell, especially during this festive season. With the anticipated profits from the expanded business, he plans to open a business for the wife in Iten town. 

In the future Wilfred wishes to operate a large boutique and create job opportunities for other people.  His deeper desire is to live a good and blessed life.

loans.use: To buy various kinds of  new clothes

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel G. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store business.  She lives in Prk. Yanog, Brgy. Tampalon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP10,000. 

Raquel is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Raquel aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: La señora Dionicia nacida el 24 de marzo en Chuquisaca,  hace 25 años logra comprarse una parcela en el Porvenir 85,  distante a 32 km de El Torno,  pertenece a la provincia de Cordillera. La señora se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz sorgo y sésamo, el  dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas y lo que ocasiona los gastos del preparado de la tierra para la siembra por eso la señora trabaja con Emprender hace 4 años por la facilidad de pago que se le da a ella y es una buena cliente, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Dionicia was born on March 24th in Chuquisaca.  25 years ago she managed to buy a plot of land in Porvenir 85, 32km from El Torno, in Cordillera province.  Dionicia is a farmer.  She grows corn, sorghum and sesame.  She will use her loan money to buy seeds and to cover the costs of getting her land ready for sowing.  Dionicia has been working with Emprender for 4 years because of the loan facilities that they provide her with.  She is a good client and is grateful to the institution for the support that she receives.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab J. is a young man from Tulkarem, a warm city famous for its citrus fruits. Ihab is a single young man living with his parents, sisters and brothers. He helps his family with the income he makes working in an auto repair workshop.

As Ihab wants to increase his income, he has come to FATEN to request a loan to start a small vegetable and fruit stall. Ihab is a respected young man known in the city for his good reputation, which he thinks will help him attract a good number of customers and so increase his family's income.

loans.use: To start a fruit and vegetable stall

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Mrs. Perla E. is 57 years old, married to a fisherman and has three adult-aged children. She lives in Lobogon barangay within the municipality of Aloran, Misamis Occidental province of the Mindanao islands. Perla sells a variety of fish to the local community, earning 4000 PHP a month.

Perla is glad that she's been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since 2007. She was able to get financial assistance from PMPC as well as other benefits available to members. Perla needs additional working capital for her fish sales business and is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan.

In the future Perla wants to own a stall in the public market where it would be easier to sell her fish. She would be happy if all her children could be stable and happy in their own families.

loans.use: As working capital for her fish sales business

loans.name: Claverina

texts.en:
Claverina S. is from the village of Sta Lucia, Quirino, Isabela. She is 60 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Claverina owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Claverina has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Claverina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claverina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase breeding livestock. Claverina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Claverina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Angela Yolanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

La señora Angela es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, la menor aun viven con ella y estudia en  la  Universidad. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz.

Ella realiza los créditos para ayudar a su esposo que tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz, para que el pueda comprar ciertas herramientas que aún le faltan para brindar un mejor servicio, él esposo  trabaja en su taller todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene mucho trabajo. Su especialidad son los remaches, nos cuenta que el  lleva con su taller ya por 16 años y que gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien ya que no le falta el trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar ciertas herramientas y materia prima para los remaches. Sus sueños son tener un carro en el futuro.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'La Inmaculada' community bank meets in the city of Tosagua.  This area is known for being very dynamic.  Most of its inhabitants work in crop farming and livestock raising.  It is an area with a lot of vegetation.

Angela is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it because the interest rates are lower than those of other institutions.  Angela is 43 years old, married, and has two grown-up children.  The youngest still lives with her and is studying at university.  Her husband is a mechanic.

Angela is taking a loan to help her husband, who has a garage, so that he can buy certain tools that he still needs in order to provide his customers with a better service.  Her husband works in his garage every day from 8.00am to 6.00pm and sometimes until later when there is a lot of work.  His speciality is doing bodywork.  She tells us that he has owned his garage for 16 years and, thanks to God, it has done very well since he is never short of work.

This loan will be used to buy certain tools and materials for her husband so that he can do his bodywork.  Angela's dream is to own a car in the future.

loans.use: To buy tools and rivets

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Art Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam Art, who was born in 1977, is a village bank president who has been selected by 17 people who make up a village bank loan. The members will use their portions of the loan in different ways to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Sam Art is a sausage seller in the local market where she can earn some profit to support her family. She is the mother of five children, two of whom are construction workers, and the others are enrolled in local public school. 

Her husband, Mr. Vuthy, is a construction worker. 

In the present, her house is not comfortable to live in because it does not have a lavatory. S. to improve this condition, Mrs. Sam Art is applying for a loan to build a lavatory.

loans.use: to build a lavatory

loans.name: Dulcesima

texts.en:
Dulcesima F. is from the village of Rang-ay, Dagatkidavao, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Dulcesima is married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Dulcesima owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and raising pigs for sale. Dulcesima has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Dulcesima joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dulcesima is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dulcesima from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Jossie

texts.en:
Jossie P. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old. Jossie is married and has four adult children. Jossie makes and sells snacks & other delicacies like rice & cheese cakes in the local community. Jossie has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2008, Jossie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 17,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital.

This loan will be her sixth from HSPFI. Jossie is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour, eggs & sugar. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like flour, eggs, & sugar

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en: Jean Paul is 40 years old and is not married. He sells food items, such as sorghum and beans. He has done this business for 5 years. This business has enabled him to support his mother, with whom he lives.  It has helped him meet their needs and increase his capital.  Jean Paul is requesting a loan to buy more food items and hence to make more profits.  In the photo are several sacks with different food items.

loans.use: to buy food items for sale.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco tiene ya más de seis años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de comida preparada. 
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta equipo de inmobiliario nuevo y hacerle algunas reparaciones al local. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el equipo y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejorar al negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con algunas partes de las ganancias que obtiene del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Francisco has had a business making and selling prepared food items for more than 6 years.  He needs some new equipment for his business and also needs to make some repairs to the premises.  He is requesting a loan so that he can buy the equipment and pay a person to make the repairs.  He plans to pay back this loan with part of the earnings he gets from his business, as this business is the source of income that he uses to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy equipment and make repairs to his business premises

loans.name: Mayllory

texts.es:
La Sra. Mayllory pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de  Mariscal, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 49  años  tiene tres  hijos dos de ellos ya cuentan con familia propia, el menor de 10 años cursa estudios primarios. 

Por iniciativa propia se inició con un capital de S/ 300.00 nuevos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños, negocio que le da muy buenas ganancias y le brinda muchas satisfacciones.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3000.00, comprará vestidos, blusas, pantalones, polos, faldas, adicional a esto invertirá en la compra de espejos pequeños, aceitillos, ganchos, carmines y otros productos  para brindar una  buena atención a sus clientes. 

La Sra. Mayllory   es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta,  su sueño es tener una boutique.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mayllory belongs to the “El Abiseo” Communal Bank, located in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal, department of San Martín. She is married, 49 years old and has three children two of which have their own families, the youngest is 10 years old and is in primary school.

Through her own initiative, Mayllory began working with a capital of S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, she sells clothes for women, men and children. The business gives her good profits and a lot of satisfaction.

With a loan of S/ 300.00 nuevos she will buy dresses, blouses, pants, polo shirts, and skirts, as well as small mirrors, oils, hangers, lipstick and other products to give good service to her customers.

Mrs. Mayllory is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman; her dream is to have a boutique. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her get ahead in life.

loans.use: buy dresses, blouses, pants, polo shirts, and skirts.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a school supplies and medicines sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eighteen years.

Carmelita requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more school supplies and medicines to sell. In the future, she would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and medicines to sell.

loans.name: Dyanamique Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chibonga, représente du groupe d’affaire « Dynamique » est entrepreneur, âgée de 39 ans, femme vivant seule, mère de 2 enfants qui  étudient tous.  Elle est vendeuse de souliers usés au long de la rue ambiante de Katoyi-Quartier Mabanga. Depuis  2007, elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  6 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima dans la banque communautaire. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  20 paires de souliers usés et le reste d’argent  sera affecté dans les petits projets de la famille.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle pour y construire sa maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe « Dynamique » reste caractériser par le travail et le succès dans les affaires.
texts.en: The customer, Chibonga, who represents the "Dynamique" business group, is a 39 year old female entrepreneur, who lives by herself and has two children who are both studying. She sells used shoes along the busy Katoyi district road in Mabanga. She has been carrying out this business since 2007 and during this time has had six community banking loans from Hekima. This new loan will allow her to get 20 pairs of used shoes, and the rest of the money will be used for small family projects. Furthermore, her ambition is to be able to educate her children and to buy a piece of land on which to build a house. The customer is grateful to Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women who cannot access classic banks. The "Dynamique" group is characterised by work and success in business.

loans.use: to pay for 20 pairs of used shoes

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 54 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Alejandra has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from buying and selling recycled materials.

Alejandra aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Conrada

texts.en:
Conrada is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Conrada has a retail shop that sells beverages, canned goods & snacks. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Conrada is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Conrada hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Thioro

texts.fr: Madame Thioro est âgée de 44 ans et est mère de 4 enfants. Elle vend au marché central de la ville diverses marchandises. Elle s'approvisionne un peu partout dans le pays. Avec ce prêt qu'elle sollicite, elle comptait s'approvisionner en produits de mer ( poissons séchés, poissons fumés....) et d'autres produits qu'elle va acheter au sud du pays .
texts.en: Madame Thioro is 44 and the mother of four children. She sells various goods in the central market of the town. She buys her merchandise here and there in the country. With the loan she is requesting, she intends to stock up on seafood (dried fish, smoked fish, etc.) and other products that she will buy in the south of the country.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has four children, all of them school-ag and unemployed. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual activity in which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for her crop but she doesn’t have enough equity yet to use on her farm. So, Sok is looking for a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting. Mrs. Sok is very grateful to all lenders that support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 54 years old and married with two children. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for ten years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Nelly works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and paid off seventeen loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Nelly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 41 years old and married. Geoffrey sells fruits and vegetables in Majaoni, Mombasa. His business has been in operation for the last four years and it has been a success. 

This marks his first borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to expand his business by purchasing more coconuts, potatoes, cabbage, spinach, onions and a variety of fruits.  

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts, potatoes, cabbage, spinach, onions and a variety of fruits

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is proud to share that through the income she earns from the direct selling of cosmetics she can provide the daily allowances for her three children in school. Now, two children have finished their college, hold degrees and are professionals.
 
Florentina is 53 years of age and happy to say that she is married to a farmer. She dreams of finishing her youngest child to her college level of education, and that's why she is keeping on selling make up, face powder, lipstick and eyeliner. She learned this type of business through friends and relatives. She is proud that she has been 11 years in this business. 

Florentina is asking for a loan of P12,000 to buy lotion, shampoo, fragrances and eye shadow. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers around their village and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy lotion, shampoo, fragrances and eye shadow.

loans.name: Saleh's Group

texts.en:
Saleh is a 45-year-old housewife who performs her household responsibilities at home.  She is very caring and her family is very happy with her nature.  Saleh’s husband is a fruit seller who sells fresh, seasonal fruit to his customers for a good profit.  She is the mother of two daughters who are both very young and have not yet started their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business.  He will buy fresh, seasonal fruit in bulk to increase his sales and profit.  Saleh’s husband has been in this business for many years and she is confident that an investment will make his business more profitable. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Saleh”.

loans.use: to support her husband's business so he can buy fresh,seasonal fruit in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 39 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running it for five years and also earns an income from a carenderia (local eatery). She has requested a PHP 49,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Rosita has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF prior this loan. 

Rosita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room, to have better living conditions and more comfort.

loans.name: Elvia Argentina

texts.es:
Doña Elvia Argentina, de 65 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos de 23, 32 y 40 años de edad, Dos hijos viven en los Estados Unidos  y uno vive con ella y dos nietas,  de 6 y 10 años de edad, quienes están estudiando en la escuela. Ella es madre soltera, vive en la aldea Terencio Sierra de Tela,  Atlántida. 
Su negocio es la venta de ropa clasificada para damas y niños, zapatos, perfumes, cremas y accesorios para damas. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa, desde hace 5 años. Anteriormente   trabajaba como cocinera en hoteles, restaurante y mercados.  Luego uno de sus hijos comenzó enviándole ropa y zapatos de los EE.UU en pequeñas cantidades y al ver que los vendía fue surtiendo de mas productos, y  ya tiene sus clientes que le hacen encargos. 
Le dedica tiempo completo el viernes y el sábado porque son los días en que sus clientes cuentan con dinero.
Ha solicitado un préstamo a ODEF para comprar ropa nueva y perfumes para tener más surtido el negocio.
Su plan es obtener un local para establecer este negocio con la ayuda de los financiamientos y con las ganancias lograr que sus nietas culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Elvia Argentina is 65 years old.  She has three children; ages 23, 32, and 40.  Two of her children live in the United States.  The other child lives with her and her two grandchildren, ages six and ten.  The grandchildren are in school.  She is a single mother, and she lives in the village of Terencio Sierra de Tela, Atlántida.

She sells women’s and children’s clothes, shoes, perfume, creams, and women’s accessories.  She has had the business in her house for five years.  She previously worked as a cook in hotels, restaurants, and markets.  Then, one of her children started sending her small quantities of clothes and shoes  from the United States.  Upon seeing that they sold, she stocked up on more products.  She now has customers who order from her.  She works full time on Fridays and Saturdays because those are the days that her customers have money.

She has requested a loan from ODEF to buy new clothes and perfume.  She will do this in order to have more stock for her business.  Her plan is to get a place to establish her business.  With the help from the loans and with her earnings she will manage to have her granddaughters complete their education.

loans.use: to stock her business with new clothes and perfume.

loans.name: Viktoriya

texts.ru:
Виктория замужем, у нее двое сыновей. Она живет в селе Великая Знаменка и торгует женской и мужской одеждой на местном рынке. У Виктории два больших широких киоска, что позволяет значительно расширить ассортимент. Киоски расположены в очень удобном месте на базаре. Так как Знаменка – небольшой городок и рынок там, соответственно, тоже небольшой, спросом там пользуется в основном недорогая практичная одежда, которую и предлагает Виктория.   

Виктория занимается торговлей на рынке уже 8 лет. На данный момент доход от бизнеса составляет около 30 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль не превышает 6 000 гривен в месяц. Виктория хотела бы вложить кредит КИВА  в 15 000 гривен в приобретение зимней партии товара. Перед началом холодов на этот тип товара всегда появляется очень хороший спрос. Виктория долгое время занимается бизнесом, прослеживается постоянное развитие, поиск новых видов товара, приносящих более высокую прибыль. Она работает с широким кругом людей, привозит товар под заказ индивидуально. Ее покупатели всегда довольны обслуживанием, ассортиментом и ценами. В будущем Виктория планирует расширение киоска и сферы влияния.
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Viktoriya is married and has two sons. She lives in the village of Velikaya Znamenka and sells men's and women's clothes at the local market. Viktoriya has two large, wide stalls, which allow her to expand her collection. The stalls are located in a very convenient spot in the market. As Znamenka is a small town, the market there is small as well and the biggest market is for inexpensive, practical clothing- just the type Viktoria offers.

Viktoriya has been trading in the market for 8 years. At this time, the income from her business is around 30,000 hryvnia. Her net income does not exceed 6,000 hryvnia per month. Viktoria would like to receive a Kiva loan of 15,000 to purchase a winter shipment of goods. Before the cold weather begins, this type of product is always in high demand. Viktoria has been in business for a long time and knows there is constant development, looking for new types of goods which bring in even higher profits. She works in a wide circle of people, ordering her goods individually. Her customers are always satisfied with her service, assortment of goods, and prices. In the future, Viktoriya plans to expand the stall and her sphere of influence.

loans.use: Purchase a shipment of winter clothes

loans.name: Jesus Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Jesus Margarita es soltera, tiene 41 años de edad, cursó el primer año de educación media, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, inició este negocio como operaria y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y clases, y crear mas productos, espera ver en el futuro su negocio grande y con amplio capital
texts.en: Jesus Margarita is 41 years old, single and completed one year of middle school. She makes a living weaving typical styles. She started the business as a machine operator and has 10 years of experience. She is requesting the loan to purchase yarns of different colors and styles to create more products. She hopes in the future to see her business grow and to expand her capital.

loans.use: to purchase yarn.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor Juan Manuel  se caracteriza por ser un buen trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bienestar de su hogar y ha logrado darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia. A él se le conoce por ser una persona excelente y con buenos valores morales como persona.

En esta oficina de Ceprodel se presentó el señor Juan Manuel a solicitar crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito lo necesita para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, arena, cemento, piedrín, hierro esto será utilizado para hacer una pared y así darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Juan Manuel is known for being a good worker due to overseeing the wellbeing of his home and he has given his family a better quality of life.

He is known for being a good person with good personal moral values. 

Juan Manuel came to our Ceprodel office to ask for a loan to improve his housing. He is asking for this loan because he needs to buy construction materials such as blocks, sand, cement, gravel and iron to be used to build a wall and thus give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to improve his living conditions

loans.name: Mehrikhon

texts.ru: Мехрихон жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 40 лет. Замужем. Имеет двоих детей. Она занимается растениеводством. В этой области она уже семь лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Mehrikhon is a resident of the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 40 years old, married and has two children. She grows crops and has been in this business for seven years. She is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Adaligia

texts.es:
Doña Adaligia,  reside en el municipio de Nindirí,  en el  departamento de Masaya. Es casada y se desempeña en la bonita labor de maestra desde hace 23 años.

Actualmente está necesitando realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda y está consciente que Ceprodel se ha dado a la tarea de beneficiar a los maestros por medio de los créditos para que puedan mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales.

Por este motivo, solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción, como arena , arenilla, cemento, zinc, piedra, hierro, ladrillos, etc. 

De esta manera, mejorará su calidad de vida, y también le ayudado a dar una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adaligia lives in the town of Nindirí, in the department of Masaya. She is married and has had the beautiful task of being a teacher for 23 years. 
She is currently making some necessary improvements to her house and she is aware that Ceprodel has been given the task of benefiting teachers by means of giving them loans to improve their living conditions. 
For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, zinc, stone, iron, bricks, etc.
In this way she will improve her quality of life and it will also help to give a better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: sand, cement, zinc, stone, iron, bricks, etc.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
El socio Fredy pertenece al banco comunal "MAMACHA ASUNTA DE CALCA"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Calca perteneciente al departamento de Cusco, a una hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 1  y medio años de edad; El socio trabaja en el ministerio de Salud, paralelamente a esto el socio ayuda con la quinta a su mamá ya que se a vuelto un negocio familiar el apoya con la atención los fines de semana el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra de cervezas para implementar el negocio familiar de la quinta restaurante. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de cervezas al por mayor para implementar la quinta familiar.


El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrower, Fredy, belongs to the " Mamacha Asunta de Calca" communal bank, located in the province of Calca, which is part of Cusco department, an hour from the city of Cusco. The borrower is 31, and lives with his partner. He has a 1 1/2 year-old child.  

He works in the Ministry of Health. Along with this, he helps his mother with an outdoor restaurant, as it has become a family business. He helps run it on weekends. On this occasion he wishes to use the loan to buy beer for the family business of an outdoor restaurant. 

The borrower is applying for the loan in order to buy beer at wholesale for the family's outdoor restaurant.  

He is grateful for the loan, and promises to make his instalment payments on time.

loans.use: To buy beer at wholesale for the family's outdoor restaurant.

loans.name: Nduni

texts.en: Nduni is 40 years old and married with six children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and describes her business environment as good because she is visited regularly by her customers. She earns extra income from her farming activities. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Nduni has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business further in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина жила с родителями, училась, потом работала на заводе. Вышла замуж в 30 лет, решили с мужем  купить в рассрочку землю, построили теплицы. В начале  приходилось трудно, но  она и ее муж люди трудолюбивые и это их не испугало. 

На своем участке Валентина садит высокорослые помидоры весной, огурцы высаживает осенью. В прошлом году провели отопление в теплицы, теперь приходится учиться выращивать овощи по новому. Немного не удачный был осенний урожай, неожиданное похолодание  плохо повлияло на огурцы и в результате заработали меньше чем ожидали. Поэтому Валентина решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы закупить уголь для отопления своих теплиц, ведь нужно сейчас позаботится о тепле для своих растений. Она  надеется что в этом году результат будет лучше, так как уже есть опыт прошлого года.  

Примечание: на фото Валентина вместе со своим мужем

loans.use: to purchase coal to heat green houses

loans.name: Lucy's Group

texts.en:
In Andingo village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya, Lucy has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Lucy is a friendly member of the community with 3 children. Lucy lives with her family in a house made of concrete walls, concrete floor, and iron roof.

Andingo village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Rotary borehole. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Lucy’s family, and the 13 other households using the local water source, need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Lucy has volunteered to be the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Lucy volunteered to be the promoter because she wants to help the community by encouraging them to treat water, thus allowing the community to be healthy and prosperous. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Veronica, Jane, Caroline and Julius.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Lucy’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is married with one child who is eight years old. He used to work in a factory, but they had to liquidate four years ago. Because money was tight and he had mouths to feed, Juan opened up his own business, which has become a local favorite in Guayaquil. In fact, whenever the Mifex team visits Ecuador, Juan (or “Nene” as he likes to be called) serves up the best dishes around.

He and his wife work seven days a week managing their restaurant which sells rice & beans, beef, chicken, and chorizo. His wife Betty is the cook, and Nene attends to the clients. It wasn’t easy starting the restaurant because they didn’t have much capital. However, like many other Ecuadorian businesses, they started out of their home to save money. Through perseverance, things have gone pretty well over the past four years. They have received such high demand that they had to build an extension to their home just to make space for more tables. Not only are customers coming from the local neighborhood, but from all around Guayaquil. Nene and Betty run the restaurant from 6:30 pm until 2:00 am. They are asking for this loan so that they can buy more tables and chairs, as well as prime materials such as rice and cooking oil.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: buy more tables and chairs, as well as prime materials such as rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Pakiza

texts.en:
48-year- old Pakiza lives in Khaladj village,Salyan region. She is married and has 3 children.
She goes to the market and stores to offer her products. 
She has a steady stream of clients and places to exhibit her sheep. She also delivers them.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Peleiupu

texts.en: Peleuipu is married with two children. The whole family is living together with Peleiupu's parents-in-law, who are very old. Life is hard for them considering that the whole extended family relies on the meagre income of her husband. When she got to know about the SPBD microfinance program, she thought of the idea of starting a small business to help her husband earn a living. Her first loan from SPBD was used to set up a pancakes and chips business. She sold them to the nearby village school. Later on she discovered that there is great demand for her products on Sunday evenings when most of the households are gathered together for family dinners. Her initial success has given her the confidence to expand her new business by buying a bigger stove and additional stock to be used for her pancakes and chips business.

loans.use: To purchase a new stove and additional stock for her business

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson V. is a very hardworking man. He makes clothes and hats in a small workshop he has in his house. He works there with his wife, Miriam, where each has a sewing machine. They make a certain number of pieces and then sell them to stores in the city market and surrounding areas.

Currently, Nelson and his wife are producing a lot of hats, especially for children. The sale of hats has increased significantly since Nelson invested in inks and stencils for silk screening, which he uses to put personalized names and drawings on his hats. According to Nelson, the hats that are in greatest demand are those that have the logos of various soccer clubs. With winter approaching, Nelson wants to invest in fabrics and materials for making coats, for which he needs a loan of $400.00.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Nelson V. es un hombre muy trabajador, realiza confecciones de ropas y gorras en un pequeño taller que ha formado en su casa junto con su esposa Miriam donde ambos trabajan con una máquina de coser cada uno. Ellos confecciona una cierta cantidad de piezas para luego salir a vender a las tiendas del mercado de la ciudad y alrededores. Actualmente lo que más está produciendo el señor Nelson y su esposa son gorras, sobretodo para niños. La venta de gorras se incrementó notablemente desde que Nelson invirtió en tintas y placas para serigrafia con los que realiza nombres y dibujos personalizados en sus gorras. Según cuenta Nelson las gorras que más se demanda son las que poseen escudos de diversos clubs de fútbol (soccer). De cara el invierno Don Nelson quiere invertir en la compra de telas y materiales para confeccionar ropa de abrigo para lo que necesita un préstamo deUS$400.

loans.use: To buy heavy fabrics for winter, buttons, zippers, threads, and dyes for silk screening

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Mr. Felipe is 47 years old, iand s widower for 5 years.  Helives with his 3 children in the district Makai de Luque. For more than nine years he has been dedicating himself to the animals for the at his house -- like pig, duck, goats, hens and cows for the sale. 

Also he sells cow milk and goat milk.  He provides to his neighbors the slaughters at the central market of the city. Their daughters dedicate themselves to the tasks of the house. Don Felipe also works by the nights as guard of security in a house and by day makes in order to have sufficient funds to maintain the family. The loan that he asks for he wishes it to invest in the purchase of balanced animals and as well as in the improvement of the corrals of the animals.

ORIGINAL SPANISH
El señor Felipe tiene 47 años, es viudo desde hace 5 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en el barrio Makai de Luque. Desde hace más de nueve años se dedica a la cría de animales para la venta en su casa, como cerdo, pato, cabras, gallinas y vacas para la venta.
También vende leche de vaca y de cabra, provee a sus vecinos y a carnicerías del mercado central de la ciudad. Sus hijas se dedican a los quehaceres de la casa.
Don Felipe también trabaja por las noches como guardia de seguridad en una casa particular  y de día realiza en su casa sus actividades cotidianas para poder tener suficiente ingreso para mantener la familia. 
El crédito que solicita lo desea invertir en la compra de animales y de balanceados así como en la mejora de los corrales de los animales.

loans.use: compra de animales y de balanceados así como en la mejora de los corrales de los animales.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves is a very hard-working 20-year-old. She began working at 16 helping her mother sell used clothing to help with the family expenses and to finance her studies. She sell clothing on the street three days a week--Monday, Thursday and Sunday from 4:30 AM to 5:00PM and studies garment making at an occupational training center in her town the other days. Her dream is to some day have her own garment shop making t-shirts, overalls and pull-overs. She is working very hard towards this goal. Right now she would like to increase her stock and buy several bundles of used clothing to resell and finance her dream. She is asking for a loan of $500 which she promises to repay in 6 months. With your help, this young entrepreneur will soon see her dream of owning a garment shop a reality.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Nieves tiene 20 años de edad es una joven luchadora y muy laboriosa, empezó a trabajar a la edad de 16 años, en un principio apoyando a su madre en la venta de ropa de segundo uso, oficio al que actualmente se dedica y con el que le permite apoyar económicamente a su humilde familia y cubrir el gastos de sus estudios.Vende su mercadería 3 días a la semana los lunes, jueves y domingo, en forma ambulatoria, a partir de las 4.30 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde, el resto de días se dedica a estudiar confección textil en un centro de ocupación superior de su pequeña ciudad, el sueño de esta joven emprendedora es tener su propio taller de confección de camisetas, buzos y casacas y está dispuesta ha esforzarse día a día para concretizar lo antes posible este sueño.Por ahora desea aumentar su mercadería y comprar más fardos de ropa usada, con el fin de poderlos vender y obtener mayor beneficio económico para ahorrar lo suficiente y así en un futuro no muy lejano hacer realidad sus sueños; para esto solicita un préstamo de 500 dólares y se compromete a hacer la devolución en un lapso de 6 meses“Con tu ayuda desinteresada esta joven emprendedora podrá hacer realidad sus sueños de tener su propio taller de confección de prendas de vestir”

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for a small clothing shop.

loans.name: Suryanah

texts.en: Suryanah is 28 years old and is the mother of an 8-year-old daughter. She produces and sells some fried snacks at her house. She can earn up to $3 per day. Her husband, Misja, is a driver who earns $2 per day. She has to work hard to earn more income for her family. She requests a loan of $125 to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To produce more various snacks

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi D. is 30 years old and her husband is 44 years old. They have a son and a daughter that are both underage of schooling. While her husband repairs clocks and watches, she does business. Because of advantageous location (in the market), her business continues very well. On average, she profits 4-5 USD/day. This profit helps paying daily living cost and repaying the loan weekly. When her husband has free time, he also helps her with her business. This time, Mrs. D. wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more products to satisfy needs of people in town.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị D. năm nay 30 tuổi, còn chồng chị 44. Họ có 2 con nhỏ 1 trai 1 gái đều chưa đến độ tuổi đến trường. Trong khi chồng chị sửa chữa đồng hồ thì chị bán hàng hóa. Do địa điểm bán hàng thuận lợi (trong chợ) công việc kinh doanh của chị D. diễn ra rất thuận lợi. Trung bình 1 ngày chị lãi 4-5USD. Số tiền lãi này đủ giúp chị trang trải những chi phí hàng ngày và trả tiền tuần. Chồng chị những lúc nhàn rỗi còn giúp chị rất nhiều trong công việc bán hàng. Vòng vốn này chị D. xin vay 950USD để mua được nhiều mặt hàng hơn nữa phục vụ nhu cầu đa dạng của nhân dân trong vùng.

loans.use: Buy goods for grocery store

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Lê Thị M., 46, has been raising cows for the last 7 years. She raises cow for beef and also for breeding. This is a stable business because beef price is always on the rise, thus it provides her family a steady income. But it requires a lot of capital to buy cows. She has 2 children who are attending school, the school fees/expenses are high. In order to raise capital for her business, Mrs M. joined TYM fund branch 4  Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Her husband is a farmer,  he is very supportive of her about this. Her family income is about 200 USD a month. This time she requests a loan of 1200 USD to buy a few cows.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị M., 46 tuổi, làm nghề chăn nuôi được 7 năm nay. Chị chuyên chăn nuôi bò sinh sản và bò thịt phục vụ cho người dân nơi chị sinh sống. Đây là một nghề mang lại lợi nhuận tương đối ổn định vì giá bò luôn có xu hướng tăng. Tuy nhiên để mua bò cần một số vốn tương đối lớn. Hai con chị đang trong độ tuổi đi học, chi phí cao nên nhu cầu vốn càng cao. Để có nguồn vốn hỗ trợ chị đã tham gia Quỹ Tình thương tại chi nhánh 4 Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Chồng chị, một người nông dân hiền lành chất phác rất ủng hộ ý định này của vợ. Thu nhập bình quân 1 tháng của gia đình là 200USD. Vòng vốn này chị M. rất muốn vay 1200USD từ Quỹ để mua thêm vài con bò và bán ra khi được giá.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr:
Mrs. Victoire N. was born in 1981 in LADJI, a shantytown of COTONOU. She is married and the mother of three children. She is a professional hairdresser with good business ethics. In addition she sells products in line with her activity such as cosmetics, extensions and others. She is requesting a loan to improve the conditions of her performance and to answer the demand of her customers. We are reminded that this is her third loan and that she has a large experience in this area since she opened her salon 5 years ago.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Dame N. Victoire est née vers 1981 à LADJI un bidonville de COTONOU. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. De bonne moralité elle est coiffeuse de profession. En plus de celle-ci elle vend des produits qui entre en ligne de compte de son activité tels que les produits cosmétiques, les mèches et autres. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour améliorer les conditions de sa prestation et pour répondre aux sollicitations de sa clientèle. Rappelons qu’elle est à son troisième prêt et elle a une grande expérience dans le domaine puisqu'elle a ouvert son salon de beauté il y a 05 ans.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products, extensions and others.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Señora Victoria A. B. is 44 years of age and has completed her studies to the fifth degree of grade school. She has three children in all but none depend on her for support. She lives on Deam Saavedra street in the El Cortijo sector of the province of Trujillo in the La Libertad department – Peru.

With the aid of a simple machine señora Victoria makes backpacks, briefcases and suitcases; products that she distributes in the different stores of the Sierra Libertaña and the north of Peru. Many of these establishments order from her in advance by the dozens and half dozen. At the age of 21 years she learned dressmaking. With her creativity, she designed backpacks of various models.

She belongs to the “New Peru” Communal Bank where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles. With this money she bought material to make the backpacks.

With the loan of 800 soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy 20 meters of wet fabric, petron and four rolls of ‘vivo’ (material to make backpacks).

Her greater dream is to have a workshop with modern machinery.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Victoria A. B. tiene 44 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria. Tiene en total tres hijos pero ninguno depende de ella. Vive en la calle Deam Saavedra en el sector El Cortijo en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Con la ayuda de una sencilla maquina la señora Victoria elabora mochilas, maletines y maletas, productos que distribuye por las diferentes tiendas de la sierra liberteña y por el norte del Perú, muchos de estos establecimientos le hacen pedidos anticipadamente, vende por docenas y media docena. Desde la edad de 21 años aprendió el curso de corte y confección, con su creatividad, diseñó mochilas de varios modelos.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro material para elaborar las mochilas.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual cancelara en seis meses comprar 20 metros de tela mojada, petron y cuatro rollos de vivo (material para elaborar mochilas).

Su mayor sueño es tener su taller con maquinaria moderna.

loans.use: To buy materials for making backpacks.

loans.name: Karla Magdalena

texts.es:
Mrs. V. is 36 years old, lives in Stage III of the Hialeah neighborhood, and has a beautiful 16-year-old girl. She is an English academic advisor with five years of experience. With the loan, she wants to build a room onto her house. She has been making home improvements with the loans given to her by Afodenic and part of her savings. In the future, she wants to set up a business for the stability of her family.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. V. habita en el barrio Hialeah III etapa, tiene 36 años de edad y una hermosa joven de 16 años de edad, es asesora académica del área de ingles con 5 años de experiencia. Con el préstamo desea construir un cuarto ella ha venido haciendo mejoras a su casa con prestamos que Afodenic le ha otorgado y con parte de sus ahorros. En un futuro desea poner un negocio para la solidez de su familia.

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Mercedes,” her business is selling food at the weekly market that is developing in the district and province of Carhuaz in Ancash state

With the S/.2,000.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 2 buckets of oil, 2 sacks of rice, 3 sacks of potatos, and 4 packages of various noodles.

She is 44 years old, married, and has 1 son. Her husband works from time to time, and the income she generates enables them to meet their household expenses and proviD. an education for their only child.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Mercedes, su negocio es la venta D. comidas en la feria semanal que se desarrolla en el distrito y provincia D. Carhuaz, departamento D. Ancash.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 2 baldes D. aceite, 2 saco D. arroz, 3 saco D. papa, 4 paquetes D. fideos surtido.

Ella tiene 44 años D. edad es conviviente, su esposo trabaja eventualmente, y tienen un hijo, los ingresos que genera les permite solventar los gasto D. su hogar y la educación D. su único hijo.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Son K., 52, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her four children. She works in the fields as a farmer, making around US$2 each day, while she is also supported by  two of her children who work in the local garment factories and her son who works in the market selling fruits. The income from the two daughters is US$2.60 each day, while her son typically makes US$3 each day of net income. This has been a difficult year for farmers in Cambodia, because weather patterns have not been as consistent and inflation has been high. Many families are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income. Son K. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to expand her son’s fruit inventory. She sees his business as more profitable than her own and has set it as a higher priority. However, she would like to expand her own farmland in the future, and expand her cultivation. She is an ambitious woman who is working hard to support her family and improve its standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro started his business when he found himself unemployed and he had to obtain an income to support his family. He started a little more than 5 years ago helping a friend with a taxi. Little by little he progressed until today he rents a taxi that he has been working for several years.

He needs a loan of $400, which will be repaid in 5 months, to pay for some repairs that his taxi needs and to maintain it.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro inicio su negocio ya que se había quedado desempleado y tenia que conseguir un ingreso para sacar adelante a su familia. comenzó hace un poco mas de 5 años ayudándole a un familiar con un taxi, poco a poco fue progresando hasta la actualidad que renta un taxi que es con el que ya tiene varios años trabajando.

El necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar algunas refacciones que su taxi necesita y darle mantenimiento.

loans.use: To pay for repairs and maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Nunuu

texts.en:
Nunuu is married and has 6 children. Her children are between 4 and 18 years old.

Nunuu became a food seller in 2007. Each day, she works at her business selling food. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40.

Nunuu now requests a loan to buy more food items to sell.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Rusbi

texts.es:
La señora Rusbi, socia del Banco comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, vive en el  Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de la ciudad. Los clientes son las personas que también venden verduras pero en menor cantidad.

Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  verduras en sacos como papa, cebollas, arvejas, apio, poro, zapallo, lechuga para tener bien surtido su puesto y los clientes encuentren lo que buscan.

Rusbi tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo, por quien trabaja para salir adelante. Le gusta el negocio y mantenerse ocupada. Su meta es tener su propio puesto en el mercado, en vista que vende de manera ambulatoria.
texts.en:
Señora Rusbi, member of the community bank "Mujeres de la Colina II," lives in the province of San Martín, district of Tarapoto. She is dedicated to selling vegetables and fruits in a traveling manner at the markets of the city. The clients are people who also sell vegetables but in smaller quantities. With this loan of 800 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy vegetables in sacks like potatoes, onions, peas, celery, gourds, and lettuce to expand her business and so her clients can buy what they are seeking. Rusbi is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and her little son, for whom she is working. She likes the business and it keeps her busy. Her goal is to have her own stand at the market, because right now she sells her goods in a travelling manner.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vegetables in sacks (potatoes, onions, celery, peas, gourds, lettuce, etc.

loans.name: Gnouma

texts.fr: GNOUMA T. HABITE LE QUARTIER NDAYANE DE DIOURBEL. ELLE EVOLUE DANS LE SECTEUR DE LA TEINTURE DEPUIS 10ANS. ELLE EST MARIEE.
texts.en:
Gnouma T. lives in the Ndayane neighborhood of Diourbel. She has been working at dyeing fabric for 10 years. She is married.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of materials necessary for dyeing fabric

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Luận năm nay 57 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Trong suốt 5 năm qua chị Luận luôn sử dụng vốn vay vào công việc buôn bán phế liệu của gia đình.Hiện nay với thu nhập 3.000.000đ từ buôn bán phế liệu và lương làm thuê của chồng kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn định và ngày càng phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15 triệu đồng đầu tư vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu
texts.en:
Mrs. L. Thi Nguyen, 57 years old, has been participating in the Fund since 2003. In the past 5 years, Mrs. Nguyen has always used the loan towards the family's recycling business. Currently, with an income of 3 million VND from trading recycling materials and her husband's income as labor-for-hire, the family's finances is very stable and growing day-by-day. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 15 million VND to invest in buying recycling materials.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to be recycled

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther  S.  sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Esther is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has three children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Open up a shop

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria sells drinks and bottled water. She also bakes snacks to sell. She has been in this business since 2000. Victoria is a 43 years old and she is a widow with three children. She takes care of her children alone and she hopes to give them quality education.  She needs the loan amount of 140,000 NGN ($1,000 US) to purchase more crates of drinks and bottled water to sell. She says, "Thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and bottled water to sell.

loans.name: Taciana

texts.en:
Taciana L., 48, is married and lives at Bagting, Dapitan City. She has 2 children. Her husband works as a utility worker at CGSO.

Because of her eagerness to have a better life, she works hard and patiently and does manicure and pedicure services. Later on, she does other services such as hair coloring and hair cutting. She has her friends and neighbors as her regular customers and decided to open up a small beauty parlor. But she would need to have capital for these so she was looking for an institution that would be able to help her.

Taciana found Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and became a member on September 15, 2008. Her first loan of 3,000 php was used in buying materials and equipment for her business. She wants to purchase modern equipment, facilities and materials to increase her clientele and encourage them to look for her services so she has applied for a loan amounting to 7,000 php for additional capital. With her continued membership in Paglaum, she hopes to have a fully air-conditioned beauty parlor. She is willing to attend training, for acquisition of more skills.

loans.use: purchase of materials & chemicals for the beauty parlor
